name: MAD MAGPIE
description:
On March 8, 2025, the artist MAD MAGPIE released her second album, ‘An Escape Attempt From The New World’. The album, an experimental blend of synth-rock, post-punk, and synth-pop, takes listeners on an escapist journey through a woman's confusing attempt to flee from her own emotions.
MAD MAGPIE draws inspiration from artists such as PULP, Kent, Radiohead, and Depeche Mode. The album feels especially relevant in a world that has changed drastically over the past few months and serves as a continuation of her conceptual debut album, ‘An Eyewitness Account From The New World’, released in March 2020.

name: ABSURD
description:
The South Funen pop band ABSURD has quickly made a name for itself with its energetic live performances and honest lyrics. The band, consisting of five young musicians from Svendborg, combines familiar pop elements with a personal twist, which has earned them a growing fan base and attention on TikTok and Spotify.
With their single ‘Danser Alene’, ABSURD secured a spot on Spotify’s Viral 50 chart and inspired over 1,400 fan videos on TikTok. In 2024, they played more than 20 concerts, including performances at Jelling Musikfestival, Midtfyns Festival, and Byhaven at Pumpehuset. They have also opened for acts such as Blæst, Barselona, and PATINA, as well as participated in the Quasar Talent Competition.
Now, ABSURD is taking the next step in their career with a record deal at Mermaid Records. They are working on new music leading up to their first full-length album. 2025 will also bring a spring tour and a campaign against youth loneliness in connection with the re-release of ‘Danser Alene’.

name: New Things Live Day Party
description:
All Things Live Denmark presents New Things Live Day Party at Salling Rooftop Aarhus on Friday, May 2nd during SPOT 2025. Look forward to a strong lineup featuring DAYYANI, KATMORE, Freja Kirk, Charlie South (SE), and two surprise acts.
Behind the singer, songwriter, and producer DAYYANI is Aarhus-based Isabella Dayyani. With a musical depth rarely seen in mainstream pop, she offers everything from high-energy Y2K-style pop bangers to more emotional and reflective sides of herself.
Former Off Bloom frontwoman Mette Kathrine Mortensen now steps into the spotlight as a solo artist under the name KATMORE. Her debut single, ‘Dancing In The Dark’, is, in the artist’s own words, an anthem for getting through dark times. The sound is organic, and the lyrical universe intimate and personal.
Freja Kirk is an artist who embraces and explores the fundamental human longing and struggle to find one’s identity – in body, gender, among friends, in grief, and in desire. She manages to channel and nuance this through her honest and soulful pop songs.

name: The Norwegian Day Party
description:
SPOT is calling, and Trondheim Calling is answering with a day party at Volume Village on Friday, May 2nd during SPOT 2025
They’ll be serving freshly made waffles with brown cheese – could it get any more Norwegian?
Bring a good colleague (or many) and come hang out with the Norwegians

name: Kryster
description:
Kryster is a true Odense-born musician and songwriter who, at just 20 years old, has already gathered enough thoughts and emotions to share with the world. She is not just a songwriter but a storyteller of life's poetic journey. Her songs feel like personal letters that touch the heart, leaving a lasting connection between the listener and the music. She creates a space where we can all, in one way or another, see ourselves reflected in her words and melodies.
Welcome to Kryster’s unique musical universe.

name: Sille Trolle
description: There is no one like Sille Trolle on the Danish music scene. In her universe, flutes, jazz drums, and echo effects weave in and out of songs that could have been written by Alberte Vinding or Sebastian. As a teenager, she toured with jazz bands and orchestras. Today, she performs with some of the country's best musicians, and her music is released by the star producers, Pitchshifters.

name: Downtown July
description:
Downtown July sounds like if TV-2 and Rigmor had a late-in-life surprise child - full of high poetry and casual cheekiness, with introverted emotions screamed out over pumping grooves and gripping melodies. And now, they bring us ‘Ku’ vi’, the first single from their upcoming debut album.
Downtown July is a band in the traditional sense, made up of five very different personalities - and you're bound to find a favorite. As part of KarriereKanonen 2025, with over a million streams and more than 140 concerts at venues and festivals across the country, Downtown July is an unstoppable force. A community where you can relate to the idea that life is beautiful, powerful, and fast - but also that sometimes we have to crawl before we can walk.
Going to a Downtown July concert is like attending an extended family birthday party where the schnapps was opened two hours ago and the emotions are pouring out. And right there - in that moment where life hits pause - we move together as one, laughing and crying over all of life’s facets. The beautiful ones, and the ugly too.

name: Lykke
description:
Lykke is a Danish project within the genre of Nordic indie-folk, where she elegantly captures the essence of the four seasons through life-changing events. In her songs, she takes listeners on an emotional journey, such as experiencing betrayal and deceit from loved ones for the first time on a bright summer day, as illustrated in the song ‘Utro’.
Her music is a tribute to the Danish language, skillfully combining beautiful melodies with quirky and intricate lyrics. Lykke hides nothing behind facades—she says things as they are, with an honest and raw tone.

name: Wantate
description:
Wantate is one of the most exciting new voices on the Danish R&B scene - his sound is a fusion of R&B and soul, blending honest lyrics, pulsing drums, and dreamy production into an intense yet laid-back atmosphere.
His music has already caught attention, earning spots on Spotify’s New Music Friday and GAFFA’s Best New Tracks. Wantate has performed on stages like VEGA/Ideal Bar, ALICE, and Byhaven, and in 2023, he was handpicked to open for British star Zak Abel at Pumpehuset.
If you haven’t seen Wantate live yet, now’s the time. He’s one of those artists you’ll wish you heard before everyone else did.

name: Århus Sinfonietta
description:
Århus Sinfonietta strives to perform music that understands its past, plays its present, and develops its future. Århus Sinfonietta was founded in 1990 by a group of musicians from Aarhus Symphony Orchestra and Det Jyske Ensemble in collaboration with composer Hans Abrahamsen and consists of 19 permanent musicians today. Århus Sinfonietta takes its role as a central Danish intermediary of experimental Danish and international music seriously, and commissions a number of new works for their ensemble every year. For the concert at SPOT Festival 2025, the orchestra will present works by Veronika Voetmann and Matthew Grouse.
Veronika Voetmann is a multifaceted musician and composer. Initially playing the classical cello, she soon began to experiment with the cello’s versatility across other genres, such as Nordic folk, improvisation, rock and metal. She has performed and composed in the context of theatre plays and performances, art music concerts and exhibitions. She has also toured nationally and internationally with her own ensembles Stringflip and Cloud Atlas trio, and with various artists such as Myrkur, Marc Facchini and Ættir. The concert will feature the work “Metaxy” for string quartet.
Composer, performer and organiser Matthew Grouse often works at an intersection between music for instruments and voices, electronic sound, text, video, and performance. His music regularly engages with a re-contextualisation of everyday sounds, objects, and automatic, repetitive behaviours to reveal the latent musical in the banal. Matthew Grouse is originally from Yorkshire (UK), but is currently living and working in Copenhagen. The work “A very exciting product launch” for quintet, interactive video, audience participation and electronics presents Ensemble Kontrol 2 from the fictional music technology company ‘Florg’ – a voice-controlled device that seemingly lets the audience control live music with voice commands. However, the illusion is shattered when it is revealed that a hidden performer is actually controlling the changes, exposing the artificiality of the products and raising questions about authenticity, causality, agency, and control.

name: EMI LIA
description:
EMI LIA is a name to watch on the Danish music scene. As part of this year’s KarriereKanonen, EMI LIA has made her mark as a bold, innovative artist, crafting a dark electronic pop universe deeply rooted in club music. Her sound is a captivating fusion of EDM, Drum & Bass, and atmospheric synthscapes, where heavy beats and catchy melodies merge to create an intense, cinematic experience.
With uncompromisingly honest Danish lyrics, EMI LIA explores the nightlife of the city, the ups and downs of love, and the absurdities — both big and small — of everyday life. She serves up deep and not-so-deep topics with a self-reflective and sarcastic undertone, making her universe both relatable and thought-provoking. Her music balances melancholy and euphoria, and with a signature raw vulnerability, she unites emotional depth with energetic force.
Live, EMI LIA delivers a powerful visual and sonic experience, where the minimalist meets the grandiose. Her performance is intense, present, and full of contrasts — from pulsating club energy to fragile moments of pure introspection. With a strong visual identity and a cohesive aesthetic, she creates a complete experience that resonates deeply with her audience.
Though new to the music scene, EMI LIA already delivers a convincing live show. Her music is a breath of fresh air on the Danish electronic landscape. At SPOT Festival, she invites the audience into her pulsating world — a place where dance, contemplation, and emotion go hand in hand.

name: IDIDIT
description:
IDIDIT is alternative electronic pop — or whatever you feel it is. It’s a deeply heartfelt electronic synth universe, relentless guitar, and insistent beats. But most of all, it’s raw and honest lyrics about the highs and lows of life, encapsulating both the big and small moments.
As a group, IDIDIT explores different expressions, and right now, they are drawn to the contrasts between the intimate, present, and emotional versus the chaotic and spontaneous. They write songs that invite deep reflection and connection, as well as songs that allow you to lose yourself in the music and let go of control.
IDIDIT wants to invite the audience into their innermost thoughts — the pages of a diary written under the covers when restless thoughts keep sleep at bay. IDIDIT is a crack in the surface, opening into a space where feelings and thoughts of all shapes and sizes are carefully held and embraced.

name: Merry
description: Behind Merry is songwriter and performer Caroline Frandsen, who describes her music as dark-pop/sweet-rock. Merry's lyrical universe spans widely – from addiction, death, and heartbreak to physicality, self-love, and crushes. These themes are explored in her acclaimed debut EP ‘Easing into Healthy’. Live, Merry offers an unpredictable and unforgettable experience. With a voice that can shift from silky smooth to heartbreakingly powerful, and a presence that both captivates and liberates, Merry pulls the audience into her world and has established herself as an exciting name on both the Danish and international live scene.

name: Slow Meetup
description:
During SPOT Festival 2025, the popular initiative Slow Meetup is once again being launched – an informal and safe gathering space for young artists and creatives from the music industry. Set in Palmehaven at Institut for (X) in Aarhus, participants are invited to let go of performance pressure and instead engage in authentic conversations, experience sharing, and collective artistic expression.
The aim of Slow Meetup is to break down the barriers that often characterize traditional networking sessions, where especially emerging artists can feel alienated. Here, everyone – regardless of experience – meets on equal footing, with a focus on community, openness, and mutual respect.
The program includes informal “Speed Meet” conversations, authenticity, open jam sessions, and relaxed reflection circles. Feedback from last year’s pilot clearly demonstrated the need for precisely this kind of community, where participants can simply be themselves – unfiltered.
Slow Meetup is for anyone who wants to build meaningful relationships and find support in an otherwise competitive environment. The project aims to create lasting connections that extend far beyond the festival – and to be the starting point for a more sustainable and inclusive culture within the music industry.
The concept was developed by Sacha Kjøller from Kant Agentur and Sean-Poul de Fré Gress from Bellerose Agency.

name: The Folky Day Party
description:
Come along once again as you are invited to The Folky Day Party, where the many facets of folk music are showcased. Look forward to some delightful hours filled with enchanting folk, as Twang, The Mukherjee Development, Louise Støjberg?Martin Rauff, and MC Hansen present the very best they have to offer.
A concert with Twang is unpredictable. It's filled with humor and warmth when the three musicians take the stage and gather around their shared microphone. Twang is known for their presence, honesty, and close connection with both the audience and each other. It’s not unusual for their concerts to bring both tears to the eye and loud laughter shared with the band.
If you had to put The Mukherjee Development in a musical box, it would be the one labeled “musical class.” They are a unique musical collective, whether you experience them live or on record - and now you can do both. Meet a group of ambassadors for sunshine and handcrafted music.
The couple Støjberg-Rauff debuted as a duo with the album Appetite for Distraction (Go’ Danish Folk) in the fall of 2017. The album follows a tradition rooted in storytelling and contains nods to American folk music, Scandinavian folk, and the rock and blues that have been part of their lives since their youth. Their expression is acoustic, defined by the two musicians' voices - together and individually.
Storyteller, songwriter, and guitarist M.C. Hansen sets a new course for his musical narratives with his new band SPEKTAKEL, filled with vivid imagery and references to everyday life and the village we call “Denmark.” Rich in metaphor and focused on the musical staging of storytelling, a concert with M.C. Hansen is a reflection of everyday miracles and the colorful cast of characters that populate them.

name: Theo.
description:
With a razor-sharp flow and an ear for infectious grooves, Theo. is ready to bring high energy and heavy basslines to SPOT Festival 2025. Blending aggressive bounce with hypnotic hooks, his sound is both raw and refined - designed for the stage, the streets, and the speakers.
Theo. has made waves with his sharp lyrics and powerful presence as part of the underground group Hunnid22. His inspiration draws from both the blog era/golden era and modern hip hop. This show marks a new chapter in his musical development. Audiences can expect 808s, groovy bounce, and a stage presence that is impossible to overlook.

name: Bison Rouge
description:
Bison Rouge dives into electronic, modern folk, and neoclassical with her award winning cello, voice, and compositions. Her sound and songs transcend personal experiences by forming into an epic Myth: a Baltic Sea heroine with sonic powers that protects the feminine, nature, and minorities. Influences from Sudan Archives, Fred Again, and Laboratorium Piesni, and Jonny Greenwood are heard in this Polish born, Seattle raised, Berlin based self-producing artist.
Her latest single ‘Death is a Woman in White’ received a nomination for ‘Best in Film Music’ at the German Songwriting Awards. She has won the DIANA Songwriting contest, TOA19 ‘Battle of the Sounds’, and Portland, OR ‘DRAMMY. She has performed at Fusion Festival, Detect Classic Festival, and Berlin Clubs such as Kater Blau and Wilde Renate to captivated audiences. Songs from the 2025 Bison Rouge EP ‘Her Salt’ mixed by immersive engineer Thomas Geiger (Blind Guardian, Nils Frahm) can be heard live at this year’s SPOT Festival.

name: Talk: Hvad er god koncertstil?
description:
Over the course of just two days, SPOT Festival hosts more than 250 concerts — and really, who doesn’t love going to a show? SPOT is packed with amazing, big, small, wild, unforgettable, and sometimes even frustrating live experiences. The quality of a concert can depend on many things: the musicians on stage, the setup of the venue, and of course, the mindset and behavior of the audience. This has led SEIN to ask: what actually is good concert etiquette?
That’s why SEINxUMTO invites you to a panel talk on concert culture — where you can hear four concert-savvy guests share their thoughts on why and how we attend concerts, and what shapes the culture and vibe at each one.
The conversation will be moderated by SEIN’s culture editor Laura Rye Bislev, and the panelists are:


Thomas Beyer, co-manager of the venue turkis


Marie Højlund, Associate Professor in Sound Studies at Aarhus University


Frederik from Rakkerpak, who’ll be performing at UMTOxSPOT Friday night


Looking stylish when going to concerts is also a big part of the culture. Just try searching “I shaved my whole body for this concert” on any social media platform and you’ll find countless posts. We’re not asking you to shave anything — but if you swing by our glam station, you can get a fresh fade, biodegradable glitter on your face, or even a brand-new tattoo(!) — so you’ll be fully festival-ready.

name: Natasha Imani
description:
Danish/Malay Natasha Imani creates organic and melancholic RnB, where authenticity and vulnerability are in the front seat. Her mantra; nothing is too taboo to write about. She will not be limited, but rather insists on writing about the emotions we all carry. It has to be human and with no need for repression or shame.
In 2023 she debuted with the EP ‘Violate Me’, which centers around life’s bigger themes and is a summarisation of an especially chaotic time in her life, where boundaries are crossed both voluntarily and involuntarily.
The title track won ‘upcoming of the week’ on national radio P3, and in 2025 the same song has gotten her elected as 1 of 10 finalists in national talent competition KarriereKanonen.

name: SPEEDRUN
description:
The bloodthirsty space baron Diproto is on a mission to unleash his all-destructive algorithm and seize control of the universe. Are you ready for a perilous journey through space and time to stop the evil superpower?
Do you dare take the first step into the spaceship MOTH and embark on a voyage into outer space, where danger lurks around every corner? Together with SPEEDRUN, you will encounter strange creatures and explore new worlds in an attempt to stop the space baron from arming and deploying his mind-controlling killer robots from the planet Optatum.
Through the power of music, you will help fight evil and restore peace to your galaxy! Bring a friend, and together we can battle the darkness that has spread to neighboring galaxies!
Make sure to strap on your fastest rocket boots, because evil never sleeps, and time is running out. So gather your courage and join the fight against the dark forces before it's too late!
SPEEDRUN is presented as winner of ‘Årets Katapult’ 2024.

name: Tarick
description:
Experience the best of both worlds as Tarick weaves together his African heritage with a modern European sound. This fusion results in a stylish Afro-pop with a captivating Nordic twist, reminiscent of Danish summer nights beneath the Tanzanian sky.
Tarick calls Copenhagen home and carries a strong vision of amplifying African culture and music in the Nordics, igniting dance floors one by one. Countless hours in the studio have refined his craft, earning him a prominent place among the selected few Danish Afro-artists. He flawlessly delivers his lyrics in both English and Swahili, perfectly complementing the Afro sound. With an unmatched ability to rap, sing, and perform with precision, Tarick stands out as a must-see live performer.
A deep love for his homeland’s language, culture, and lifestyle runs as a common thread through his music. His songs beautifully capture the many facets of youth - love, infatuation, and emotions - while also reflecting on his roots and the society he is part of.
Tarick has personally experienced the feeling of being a stranger, no matter where he is. These experiences fuel his mission to bridge people together and inspire movement with love rather than hate. Through his inspiring lyrics and uplifting perspective on even the heaviest topics, Tarick offers a bright outlook and a relentless “keep your head up” spirit. All of this is elegantly wrapped in warm rhythms, delivered with a confident belief that people will dance along, even when the themes carry significant depth.

name: Ida Lilja
description:
Fast-paced electropop in a power performance where the audience can both lift off and land safely. Just under a year after her debut single, Ida Lilja firmly steps into the spotlight as a participant in KarriereKanonen 2025 — with big ambitions to become a source of inspiration across generations.
But those ambitions are nothing new, as her résumé shows: four singles, a summer tour, support for When Saints Go Machine, and two showcases at Uhørt Festival.
Imagine The Minds of 99 and Oh Land breaking out of 14 days of isolation to meet Kate Bush in a sunny parking lot - that’s where the inspiration behind Ida Lilja’s sound is born: grand and pop-driven, yet organic and deeply personal.
Her singable synth leads, punk-inspired drums, and captivating Nordic tone create an intense atmosphere that invites listeners to see themselves, find strength in their vulnerability, and face their emotional fears. She inspires you to feel all of life - the challenging and the life-affirming - and to claim your place within it.
Ida Lilja has got you. You just have to give in.

name: Julie Ellinor
description:
Danish singer, songwriter, and guitarist Julie Ellinor delivers indie pop brimming with raw emotion and honesty. With her charismatic voice and knack for infectious pop melodies, she invites listeners into a universe of dusty synthesizers, airy guitar layers, and driving basslines.
Julie Ellinor has previously released well acclaimed singles like ‘Disarray’ and ‘Mislead’, both widely played on Danish radio, with the former being named P3’s “Unavoidable Track of The Week”. In 2023, she reached new milestones, performing her biggest concerts to date in Aarhus and Copenhagen, releasing her debut album ‘Reality's Got Nothing On Illusion’, and wrapping up the year by supporting Alex Vargas on an extensive national tour.
In spring 2024, Julie released the single ‘Anywhere With You’, followed in late summer by her latest track, ‘Neon Glow’.

name: Mud Grief
description:
A fusion of raw intensity, thundering guitars, and razor-sharp melodies—or an uncompromising mess infused with style and finesse—Mud Grief delivers energetic and explosive noise from Gothenburg, Sweden. With a dynamic and high-energy soundscape, Mud Grief creates an electrifying atmosphere that keeps audiences moving.
In late 2024, the band signed with Welfare Sounds, carrying the momentum into 2025, starting with a show in Berlin. This spring, Mud Grief will release several singles, all building toward their debut album, scheduled for release in September. They aim to pair the album launch with a tour, confident that their intense live performances make them a perfect fit for any stage.

name: Udsyn
description:
Udsyn is a meeting between Nordic jazz, American minimalism, film music, and post-rock.
The band creates organic atmospheres that can be felt and visually imagined. In a dynamic interplay of harmony, intimacy, and dissonance, Udsyn conveys perspectives on life through musical spaces and worlds—ones you can lose yourself in, explore, and perhaps find meaning within.
In September 2024, Udsyn released their debut album ‘Indsigt/Udsigt’ on the Aarhus-based indie label Blikflak. That same year, the band participated in Jazzkonkurrencen, earning both audience and critical acclaim for their performances. Now, Udsyn is ready to return to turkis with cinematic and free-spirited jazz during Roots&Hybrid and SPOT Festival 2025.

name: Åh Buster
description: Åh Buster is an Aalborg-based artist project that blends melancholic everyday poetry with phrases that make you both smile and shed a tear. Although Åh Buster is new to the Danish music scene, he has long been working with music. In 2022, he was awarded the title of Årets Nordjyske Sangskriver (Songwriter of the Year in North Jutland), and his music has been featured on Netflix and major radio stations both domestically and internationally. In the fall of 2024, Åh Buster performed at the festival Way Up North and received 6 stars from Gaffa for his performance.

name: Eros for you
description:
Eros for you is the sound of hugging under strobe lights. The Copenhagen-based duo met through a shared love for the emotional dance genre and French electronic music.
In 2023, they released their debut single ‘Palm of Your Hand’, and just weeks later, they were offered a record deal in Paris. Eros for you describes their music as "EDM Bon Iver", an attempt to fuse club music with a sense of care and tenderness.

name: Junior Brown
description:
With his emotional pop-soul, Danish-Jamaican artist Junior Brown explores complex lyrical themes such as identity and belonging.
His music has earned praise from media outlets like GAFFA and received airplay on P3, P4, and The Voice. Most recently, he was named one of the 10 selected artists for KarriereKanonen 2025.
Discovered on the streets of Kingston by a police officer named Junior Brown, and later raised in Odense, he draws on a unique background that shines through in both his music and Danish-language lyrics. Imagine a fusion of Silk Sonic and Swae Lee - if they’d taken Danish lessons from Kim Larsen and Lord Siva.
Junior Brown has established himself as one of the strongest new musical storytellers. Since his debut at Uhørt Festival in 2022, he’s been creating live experiences where unpredictability and presence go hand in hand. These are anthems for late nights and emotional hangovers - music that makes it clear there’s something real at stake.

name: Karen Juhl
description:
Karen Juhl is a strong name on the Danish experimental scene. Inspired by artists such as Laurie Anderson, Solange, and M.I.A., Juhl creates art pop for the 21st century. Her debut album, ‘Mother Tongue,’ has received high praise from BBC6, Metal Mag, and Groove Mag.
Live, club culture and chamber music blend together, and beat fragments merge with MIDI harp improvisations in a complex and moving performance.

name: Laura4evigt
description:
Laura4evigt is the sound of dark 2000s nightclubs blended with modern electronic pop. 24-year-old Laura Kjelgaard creates electronic pop straight from her core, crafting a universe that is both boundary-pushing and strange - yet still poppy and tender. Her inspirations range from FKA Twigs to eurodance icon Cascada, but what all her songs have in common is their sharpness, pulsing with both energy and emotion.
Previously releasing music under the name ‘Laura’, she now begins a new era - with darker undertones and a harder electronic sound.

name: Fine
description:
Fine is a Copenhagen-based singer-songwriter and producer whose music blends samples, acoustic and electric instruments into a groovy and ethereal crossover sound, both familiar and dreamlike.
Her debut album, ‘Rocky Top Ballads’ (2024), turns experiments into songs by cutting and layering band improvisations, bringing them together with melodies and voice. The album features loose-wristed-head-bobbing drums, a wide range of guitar sounds, bass riffs, reverb-soaked atmospheres, and real sound recordings — all woven together with Fine's distinctive voice and lyrics.
Live, Fine reshapes her hypnotic sound together with her band: Lola Hammerich on guitar (Baby in Vain), Andreas Murga on bass (Gorgeous), and Mads Muurholm on drums.
Starting early, Fine began her career over a decade ago with the Danish electronic trio Chinah, releasing three albums. She has since co-written for New Jeans with Erika de Casier and Smerz, contributed to Clarissa Connelly’s Kanonschoir, and collaborated with Astrid Sonne under the moniker Coined.

name: ETVA
description:
ETVA turns her gaze inward, toward what’s been hidden away. Blending raw Danish electropop with soul-wrenching indie, she shares herself with the audience in a stripped-down, honest, and intimate space where every emotion is welcome. Her music and lyrics reflect a person with visible cracks in the surface, bathed in tears, yet carrying the willpower to stand up for herself - and for what often feels wrong. With deep humility, she makes an honest attempt to be the voice that so many silence within themselves.
ETVA is one of the 10 selected artists in DR’s KarriereKanonen 2025, with her song ‘Hævet over larm’ - an atmospheric indie-pop anthem that captures the feeling of drifting out of the mind’s shadowy thoughts and rediscovering oneself. She has previously participated in the Royalties talent development program, performed live at venues like Loppen, URBAN 13, and Way Up North Festival, and was formerly signed to a major label - a path she has since chosen to walk away from in favor of creative independence.
Look forward to experiencing her live, as she casts a spotlight on forgotten feelings with vulnerable, powerful intensity.

name: Damkapellet
description:
Damkapellet is a professional collective of musicians and composers with a mission to promote diversity and inclusion in the Danish music scene. They perform music by women, non-binary, and transgender people, and they experiment with collective co-creation of music rooted in the broad spectrum of art music – from contemporary composition and improvisation to opera, baroque, and children's performances. At their concert at SPOT Festival 2025, the ensemble will present works by Kirstine Lindemann, Greta Eacott, Tine Surel Lange, and a collectively composed piece.
Instrumentalist, composer and performer Kirstine Lindemann (b. 1987) is interested in the space between you and me. In the field of tension between symbiosis, synchronicity, empathy – discrepancy, alienation and friction, she explores the drive towards the other – as a primordial force and existential conflict. The work “Forsøg i Gentagelser” (“attempts in repetitions”) is an investigation of the transformation in repetition. With a few notes, the music travels between the voices with a repetition that bends, twists, stretches and pushes the music into a recurring question about how we, in harmony with others, can separate, flow together and perhaps change?
“En skog av lyd” (“A forest of sound”) is a sound work composed by the Danish-Norwegian composer Tine Surel Lange (b. 1989) for Damkapellet. The work is inspired by how individual, scattered trees slowly grow together to form a forest, and by how the fungus mycorrhiza functions as a symbiotic network between plant roots, enabling mutual communication, exchanging nutrients and warning each other of dangers.
British/Swedish composer Greta Eacott (b. 1990) is known for her uninhibited approach to composition and her experimental percussion works. The fourth installment of Greta Eacott’s “GESTALT MINIMAL” series, is a long form one note composition written especially for Damkapellet. Expect a frissonistic and pummeling rhythmic massage.
“Signature”, a work composed collectively in Damkapellet, is a listening organism that examines the friction of the individual in a collective perspective. The musicians become the composers and vice versa. Each contributes their unique voice and perspective. The work is a dynamic experience in a mission to create cohesion between musicians and audience. The work is composed by Josefine Weber Hansen, Irene Bianco, Nadia Okrusko, Nicole Hogstrand, Randi Pontoppidan, Mika Persdotter, Julija Morgan, Kirstine Lindemann, Pauline Hogstrand and Tove Bagge.

name: Schæfer
description:
With quirky and poetic songs, Schæfer invites you into a world of socially relevant stories that are both dark and melancholic, as well as bright and sly. The duo and close friends, Anna Skov Jensen (vocals) and Emil Mors Rasmussen (keyboards), write vulnerable, intense, and humorous songs that point fingers at the world around them and, not least, at themselves. Schæfer has already gained recognition for their sharp songwriting, having earned the title of ‘Årets Nordjyske Sangskriver 2024’ (Nordjyske Songwriter of the Year) in the Skråen music competition, Band Battle.
Live, Schæfer takes the stage as a seven-piece band, pulling the music in explosive directions together.

name: Synvilla
description:
Synvilla delivers heavy psychedelic rock, balancing between stoner & doom and high-energy rock. Based in Gothenburg, they released the album ‘Feberfoster’ on February 28th, a spellbinding fusion of surrealism and everyday realism, where atmospheric riffs share space with subtle humor.
With ‘Feberfoster’, the band lets their dark and experimental vein flow freely, taking you on a journey through a pitch-black desert where biting riffs and fever-dream-like melodies chase you into a pulsating ambient oasis. With a distinct groove and eerie, ghostly tones, psychedelic rock, doom, and stoner merge into a unique sound that defines Synvilla.

name: Velvy
description:
In a mix of innocent naivety and a distorted acid trip, the little child is placed in a world even the adults can’t understand.
Over the past two years, the new Danish duo Velvy, consisting of Laura Teglbjærg (vocals/lyrics) and Asbjørn Busk Horne (production/lyrics), has built their own world – blending elements of electronica, rock, and improvised music with a foundation in modern pop aesthetics. Velvy released their debut EP, ‘The Room We Lived In’, in November 2024.

name: DEEJADE
description:
DEEJADE creates MAXIMALIST ELECTRO-POP, showing us that both intimacy and presence can exist within a hyperactive electronic soundscape.
DEEJADE sounds like big emotions and zero compromise. Through heartfelt vocal arrangements, she adds depth to an otherwise intense sonic landscape of hard-hitting beats and adrenaline-fueled synths. Her music creates a space where it's okay to be “hyper-sensitive” — whether you're at rock bottom or speeding at 200 km/h with a confetti cannon under each arm.
Behind the project DEEJADE is 24-year-old Freja, who gained radio play on stations like P3 and P4 from her very first release, along with features in several media outlets. Last year, she released a music short film with five accompanying tracks, which was featured on the Ekko Shortlist and premiered by GAFFA. Additionally, her latest singles, ‘BLACK BELT’ and ‘TALK TALK’, received airplay on Popdatering and placements on playlists such as Fresh Finds Nordics and NMF.
DEEJADE has been described as an artist with major international potential — something clearly reflected in both her music and visual universe. It's evident that this is a project with sky-high ambitions and no limits in sight.

name: Hjalte Ross
description:
Hjalte Ross has established himself as one of the most critically acclaimed and recognized songwriters in the Danish music industry.
In the fall of 2023, Hjalte Ross released his third album, the self-produced and minimalist ‘Less’, which he describes as his most direct, vulnerable, and expressive songwriting to date. With ‘Less’ and a series of highly praised performances at major European industry festivals, Hjalte Ross has further accelerated his career on the international stage, cementing his reputation as a skilled songwriter.
Live, Hjalte Ross manages to combine presence and intensity - whether through fragile a cappella moments, noisy guitar textures, or reimagined arrangements with strings. He has an  ability to let the songs come alive in the moment and move his audience.
At SPOT Festival 2025, audiences will have the chance to experience a unique symphonic concert on a smaller scale, where Hjalte Ross will perform alongside the string ensemble Who Killed Bambi. This collaboration breathes new life into his songs and creates a singular sound - a concert sure to touch and impress.

name: Sheebaba
description:
Sheebaba is Eliott Eccho & Prof.Costello
Sheebaba was born in an art space
Sheebaba is based in Luxembourg. LU
Sheebaba is noise, thoughts & drum loops
Sheebaba is genre-bending
Sheebaba is art wave
Sheebaba is experimental
Sheebaba is loud
Sheebaba is industrial glitch
Sheebaba is conceptual
Sheebaba is performative
Sheebaba is all colors of the rainbow
Sheebaba is against hate.
/Full stop

name: Aland Z
description:
The hyper-modern and innovative Aland Z emerges on the musical scene with a unique sound and a powerful narrative that draws deep roots from his Kurdish background. With his phenomenal vocal talent and an ability to create danceable pop hits, Aland Z
transforms personal experiences and cultural nuances into a universal musical experience that appeals to both the heart and the dance floor. His songs are a blend of modern pop, traditional Kurdish elements, and inspiring lyrics that speak to the challenges and triumphs many face in their daily lives. With a voice that ranges from soft, melancholy tones to powerful, energetic riffs, Aland Z captures the listener's attention from the moment he steps on stage.
Aland Z is ready with new music that promises to be a kaleidoscope of sounds, weaving together the endurance of love, the beauty of culture, and the relentless realities of life. Prepare to be drawn into his musical universe and experience how Aland Z is redefining the pop genre with his unique voice and inspiring message.
Aland Z is here to make a change, one beat at a time.

name: Anna Roemer with Strings
description:
Anna Roemer has a unique approach to her instrument and insists that the guitar is capable of far more than the listener might think.
In 2022, Roemer released her debut album ‘Azure’, which critics hailed as a virtuosic record. With her second solo album ‘Blåregn’ (‘Wisteria’), released in March 2024, she draws inspiration from her father's death, delivering a love letter to the person who introduced her to music. This album serves as the focal point of this year’s SPOT concert, where, for the first time, the music will be presented in arrangements for strings. For the occasion, Roemer has teamed up with Thorbjørn Kaas (double bass), Line Felding (cello), and Maria Jagd (violin).
Roemer’s focus is on creating soundscapes and sonic universes where listeners witness her patience, strength, and vulnerability. Her works manage to encompass multiple emotions simultaneously. They are at once present and dreamy, gentle and insistent.

name: Dupont
description: Dupont’s sound follows you out the door, down the street, past the corner store, and to that little place where peace allows observations and impressions to settle. Here, every emotion can be laid bare and screamed into the open. They come together in stories about everything we love, cherish, long for, and fear losing. Dupont are the winners of KarriereKanonen 2024 and are now ready to take on the Danish live scene.

name: Gunge
description:
Under the artist name Gunge, Ida Gunge creates captivating pop music with honest lyrics about youth life and everything it entails. Her debut release, ‘Ambulance’, had a flying start with great reviews, playlist placements, and radio plays. In the song, Gunge visualizes a classic youth scenario of being chosen over for someone else, set in the streets of Copenhagen.
Drawing from personal experiences of a bittersweet and turbulent youth, Gunge writes honest songs in Danish, carried by a quirky and vivid language that combines both melancholy and self-irony.
Gunge began her music career in a small, closed-off basement studio in Østerbro. In meeting a hip-hop collective that wanted to use her for hooks, the Copenhagen-based Gunge realized that not everything in music had to be polished, and that box wine and hand-rolled cigarettes could also belong in a great pop hook. Later, she found a musical collaboration with co-producer and artist Daniel Joy, who could mirror her fascination with pop music in a version that is just as hard-hitting and emotional as hip-hop.
Live, Gunge creates an intense and intimate experience, where her strong vocals and dynamic band transform the songs into something greater. Her debut, including supporting Ella Augusta on tour, has already attracted attention, and there is no doubt that audiences can expect a special experience when Gunge takes the stage.

name: Familien
description:
Familien was formed in 2020 as Benjamin Hav’s backing band. Since then, they have built a reputation as one of the country’s tightest and most entertaining live acts on the Danish music scene. Together with Benjamin Hav, Familien has developed a playful, vibrant, creative, and sensory-overloading live show - featuring handcrafted, skillfully performed, and irresistibly swinging music, topped with dazzling dance moves, sharp brass sections, and a generous dose of liberating humor. This is a band that makes you want to move and put on your biggest smile.
Familien has also developed several instrumental tracks and a musical universe where the music exists purely on its own terms. There are no backing tracks or gimmicks - just raw, groove-based live music. When Familien takes the stage, the door is always left slightly open for surprises and a sprinkle of magic. They embrace the spontaneous moments that arise between musicians with full intensity. You won’t know what hit you - but you’ll know it feels amazing!
Welcome to Familien!

name: VARNA GL
description: In a powerful convergence of tradition and modernity, multidisciplinary artist Varna Marianne Nielsen brings life to a new genre. Her work embodies a rich fusion of sounds and emotions, drawing from Varna´s Greenlandic heritage from East Greenland, while pushing the boundaries of contemporary music. This fusion of electronic music and traditional Greenlandic drumsongs is unique.

name: ELJO
description:
In the borderland between the acoustic and electronic, ELJO crafts a sonic universe that blends elements of modern Nordic jazz and minimalist electronic music. Here, the listener is presented with a soundscape of stylistic clarity, floating introspection, and a building surface tension between meditative repetition and uplifting momentum.
With Elias Lykkeskov on keyboards and Johannes Bohn on drums, ELJO delivers a unique live concert experience where all elements - both electronic and acoustic - are performed live on stage.

name: PROPHIT RECORDS feat. Kasper og Nima Rezai
description:
For this showcase, you can experience a wide spectrum of hip hop from Northern Jutland.
PROPHIT RECORDS consists of HUMMERDRENG, KLOSTERMAND, and AAGE G, who will turn up the hip hop spirit as they take the stage together, performing both their individual tracks and spitting verses across each other's songs.
Nima Rezai is a relentless alternative rapper who, with sharp rhymes and heartfelt lyrics, explores identity, personal stories, and resistance. His unique voice is charged with raw emotions and powerful messages that both move and shake the listener.
Kasper, known from the music collective Fantastisk, brings sharp lyrical depth with existential verses, where clever punchlines meet themes such as addiction, love, and family. Together, they deliver authentic and gripping hip hop that goes straight to the heart and head of the listener.

name: Styva Linan
description:
Styva Linan made a grand entrance onto the Swedish music scene in the fall of 2022 with their acclaimed debut album ‘Dallas’. Their raw yet skillful portrayal of reality was embraced with open arms, leading to TV appearances and sold-out shows. Their unique blend of indie and prog struck a chord with nostalgic listeners while also becoming a defining part of the new wave of traditional bands reclaiming the stage.
Alongside a growing fan base, their reputation as a sharp live act has kept them touring nonstop across the Nordics. In 2024, they released their self-titled album ‘Styva Linan’, celebrated with packed shows in Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm, and Oslo.

name: KEDDE
description:
The 24-year-old pop talent KEDDE grew up in a tiny rural town where everyone looked the same - and no one really dared to stand out. But he did - he just didn’t quite know yet what made him different. It’s only within the past year that KEDDE has found a safe place to land, where he now fully understands and embraces being queer—both within himself and openly with the world.
KEDDE has since found his home in Copenhagen - a place where it feels more acceptable to stand out, and where he can see reflections of himself on nearly every street corner. And that has made him brave.
In 2023, KEDDE performed at Smukfest, where he won the Tak Rock Award. He has also toured with Mekdes and Pil, performed at Copenhagen Pride on the City Hall Square, and played shows at Tivoli, SPOT Festival, Jelling Festival, and more. His song ‘Sådan må det være’ was chosen as P3’s Unavoidable Track at the beginning of 2024.
Now, KEDDE is entering a brand-new chapter with his song ‘Dagdrømmeri’. His music has always been personal, but it has never been this honest - or this queer. For the first time, KEDDE has found exactly where he belongs. A place where he feels understood, and where he feels mature and confident enough to write the songs that truly matter.
The vibe is “acoustic in the club”, and KEDDE has fallen in love with the guitar - especially the acoustic one, which allows him to tell stories in a whole new way.

name: Martin Zeppelin
description:
Martin Zeppelin, formerly known as a member of the band Astronaut, has now established himself as a solo artist with a unique voice and a strong songwriting profile. With a background in songwriting from the music conservatory, where he was mentored by Peter Sommer, he has crafted a lyrical universe that is poetic, moving, and laced with humor. His music explores life’s big existential questions, close relationships, and the ambivalent contrasts between light and shadow.
Zeppelin’s debut album, Tropenat, brought him onto stages across the country, including supporting Folkeklubben and performing at Smukfest in 2022. His follow-up album, Skyggeblomst, cemented his status as an artist with something to say and earned five stars from GAFFA, which called it a potential “Danish-language surprise of the year.”
Now, he is ready to take another step forward with his upcoming album, Stjernesejler, where he continues his journey through musical landscapes blending melancholy, life insight, and his distinctive sense of humor. The first single from the album was released April 23rd, offering a taste of the universe Zeppelin creates with his characteristic vocals and profound lyrics.
At SPOT, audiences will get the chance to experience Martin Zeppelin’s presence, authenticity, and ability to captivate listeners with the stories he tells through his music. SPOT marks the beginning of a new musical era for Zeppelin.

name: Sanyu
description:
Sanyu has performed at festivals such as Øya, Trondheim Calling, and regularly at jazz festivals in both Oslo and Copenhagen in recent years. Her debut EP, ‘Now You Hear It’, was described by Beehype as "proof of true artistry and dedication to the craft" and was selected for their collection of Best Albums of 2024. Yet, the EP only offers a glimpse of what you can expect to experience live.
Rooted in old-school R&B and improvisation, Sanyu's live performances are characterized by a soulful expression with warm harmonies, while also playing with rap and groove-based riffs in a soundscape where acoustic and electronic elements are seamlessly intertwined.
On stage, she is joined by some of the most notable musicians from the young Norwegian jazz and electronic music scene. Rino Sivathas on drums, multi-instrumentalist Kristina Fransson, and Joachim Mørch Meyer on double bass bring both calmness and explosiveness to their musical creations together.

name: Prize for the Future
description:
Prize for the Future is a Danish alternative electro-pop duo that combines edgy, inviting melodies at first listen with a reflective lyrical universe. Draped in dark synthesis and electronic beats, the band seeks authenticity and presence in a world that at times feels very foreign — drawing from the emotions, thoughts, and dilemmas that come with being a young person in the modern world. Their music highlights a cross-section between euphoria and melancholy that resides in all of us: Feeling alone even when surrounded by your best friends or feeling inadequate even at 1000 kilometers per hour.
The duo is set to release an EP later this year, with the first single, ‘The Nerve,’ already out on the record label Møs Møs. They released their debut EP, ‘Intrude,’ in the spring of 2023, and it was the group's first major release since their debut concert at SPOT Festival 2022, which GAFFA rewarded with four stars under the headline ‘Electropop-duo surprises to dazzling debut.’ The band has also received airplay on both P6 Beat and P3, recorded a cover of JoJo’s ‘Too Little Too Late,’ and released a music video for the song ‘Blindspot.’

name: Østen
description:
Since Østen kicked off 2024 with his debut single 'Regn,' the Aarhus-based singer and songwriter has been busy. The single was named P3’s Ugens Uundgåelige, received positive attention from several influential media outlets, and has, at the time of writing, surpassed 3 million streams on Spotify.
Østen followed up with two more singles before releasing his debut album 'Daylight' on October 25. The album explores themes of rootlessness, depression, and the fear of loss, forming a deeply personal narrative about Østen’s life – told through unique lyrics and powerful productions.
The album was well received by critics: Soundvenue included it on their list of the best Danish albums of the year, while Gaffa praised Østen’s songwriting talent and "grand and well-crafted productions."

name: Baseløs
description:
Over the past few years, Baseløs has evolved into a duo with a sharp, honest sound that draws on elements of folk, indie, and acoustic music. Their music has become more personal and bold, finding inspiration in artists like The 1975 and Lizzy McAlpine.
In 2023, the band underwent a significant transformation, saying goodbye to two members. Now they return as a duo consisting of Alexander and Laura, while bassist Lasse continues as an "invisible" part of the group. This shift has allowed them to reflect on their music and discover a new direction that resonates more deeply with their innermost emotions.
Their first single, ‘Breakup Season’ (October 2024), takes listeners on an emotional journey through the challenges of autumn romance. The song blends country and folk elements with a fresh groove and is inspired by their own and their friends' experiences with breakups and life's tougher moments. This marks a new chapter for Baseløs—a sense of renewal that runs through their upcoming EP, ‘Tænk hvad vi ku blive’ created in collaboration with friends from bands like Dusin and Undertekst.

name: Darling Darlene
description:
Indie rock outfit Darling Darlene let the skeletons out of the closet in their moody and naive approach to pop songwriting. The project is a clash between country and disco, arrangement and intuition, sincerity and stupidity in a 00’s fighting game arena, where the sharp pixelated edges are smoothed over by a dense mist.
The fog leaves you stumbling through blurry sonics and unclear narratives circling estrangement, strandedness and Sisyphean perseverance. Blindly, your hand catches a thread. Cutting through the ethereal is a trail of clear-cut melodies, simple percussive synthesizers, vocal harmonies and sharp song structures maintaining direction and form.
In late 2024, the first of a new breed of songs from the quartet, ‘Mechanical Heart’, emerged. A departure from the prior Dream Pop sound, the reclusive disco-rock track charts a grittier, darker path ahead for the group with several additional releases planned for 2025.

name: Forræder
description:
With his minimalist songs, Forræder conveys a sense of general inadequacy in response to loss and in relation to a world in decay. It is the sound of a fragile yet confrontational voice, wrapped in dry guitars, wind instruments, and noise, channeled through a curious indie singer-songwriter universe.
The songwriter behind the project, Viktor Ravn, is also the lead singer and guitarist of the hardcore band Demersal, which has toured Europe multiple times and released two albums. Forræder is Viktor’s solo project, where the same intensity is expressed in a new, intimate format. Here, the music moves effortlessly across genres, unfolding in a naïve tension between longing and contempt, between hope and restlessness, and between trust and betrayal.

name: Girl Scout
description:
Girl Scout is a Swedish quartet consisting of Emma Jansson, Viktor Spasov, Per Lindberg, and Evelina Arvidsson Eklind. Jansson and Spasov met while studying jazz at the Royal College of Music in Stockholm, bonding over playing Burt Bacharach and Beatles songs and their shared love for Stranger Things and Big Thief. They had ambitions to make their musical partnership something larger than life itself, which led them to invite their fellow Royal College of Music student, Eklind, and Spasov’s friend, Lindberg, to complete the band’s lineup.
Girl Scout has been compared to everything from The Breeders to Snail Mail while bringing a sonic finesse that often surpasses these names in vivid technicolor 4K.
The band released their second EP, ‘Granny Music’, in 2023—a five-track collection that continued their unique sound, supported by the single ‘Boy in Blue’. Their latest EP release, ‘Headache’ (2024), further builds on their solid and exciting discography.
Few bands manage to create daring, mesmerizing noise without compromising melody, but Jansson and Spasov’s songwriting chemistry has resulted in impeccable, unexpected algorithms within their work. Their songs rarely take predictable paths, yet somehow they sound both traditional and electrifying, as if crafted by any young, hungry alt-rock band with the resources to aim high.
Starting a band these days can be almost impossibly challenging, and creating truly great music is even harder. Girl Scout seems to have cracked the code. Their path forward appears limitless. Perhaps the moon is the only landing spot for Jansson, Spasov, Lindberg, and Eklind—or maybe even that is too short a distance.

name: Koya
description:
Hailing from Aalborg, Denmark, Koya has charged onto the Danish metal scene and quickly become infamous for their energetic live shows and indignant, take-no-prisoners attitude. A testament to this is their early participation in events such as the Danish '24 WOA Metal Battle Finals, Support Our Scene, Mono Goes Metal, Lasher Fest, When Copenhell Freezes Over '25, and others.
With a foundation in contemporary Danish post-hardcore, Koya combines the aggressive, fast-paced nature of hardcore with the crushing weight of sludge and atmospheric elements influenced by black metal and shoegaze, resulting in a captivating and dynamic sound.
Essentially, Koya captures what can best be described as a form of Scandinavian bleakness - a feeling of inherent cold and darkness akin to that of late autumn - although presented on stage with raised fists and that northern Danish charm.
Brace yourself for an auditory assault as Koya invites you to delve into their darkness.

name: ORA
description:
Lea and Samuel are siblings, and together they form the duo ORA. In many ways, they are completely alike, yet at the same time, they are each other's polar opposites. But despite their differences, they have always been there for each other, which their latest single, ‘Life Witness’, serves as musical proof of. It is a captivating sibling anthem with hints of R&B and indie pop, as well as a recognizable inspiration from the timeless disco classic ‘We Are Family’ by Sister Sledge.
When 22-year-old Lea and 23-year-old Samuel write, record, and produce their infectious R&B indie pop together, they tap into a dynamic energy that defines ORA. Their music is rooted in personal storytelling, with Jonathan Elkær from Phlake as a steady presence in the producer’s chair.
ORA, named after their grandmother and meaning "the light of the sun," released their debut single, Bad Day, in August last year. It received praise from influential media outlets such as ‘Ones To Watch’ in the USA, Belgian platform ‘Dansende Beren’, and the UK culture site ‘tmrw magazine’, while their follow-up single, ‘Space Rock’, made it onto P3. In other words, there is every reason to keep a close eye on ORA in 2025.

name: Ethel-Prisen
description:
The Ethel Award was established by pianist, composer, and studio lecturer Pia Rasmussen, who was a central figure in the 1970s women's music scene. It is awarded to individuals who have made a special effort to promote the conditions for female musicians, gender balance, and diversity in Danish music life.
The award consists of an "Ethel" – a sculpture depicting Ethel Smyth, created by sculptor Malene Bjelke – along with 25,000 Danish kroner.
We look forward to seeing who the 8th recipient of the award will be when the Ethel Award is presented at SPOT 2025 prior to the concert with Laura Ziani at Lille Sal on Friday at 19:15 PM

name: Laura Ziani
description:
Laura Ziani is a danish singer, songwriter, and cellist who artfully combines catchy melodies with profound lyrics and the enchanting sound of the cello. With a degree in songwriting from the rhythmic music conservatory and a background as a classical cellist from the royal danish academy of music, she crafts a unique musical universe.
In late 2022, she released her critically acclaimed debut album ‘Breathwork’ which Soundvenue praised as "a formidable debut." Her music blends elements of alt-pop, jazz, and classical tones, resulting in a dreamy and deeply personal soundscape.
Continuing her musical journey in 2023, Laura released the EP ‘Skin to Skin’ delving into the experience of becoming a mother for the first time. Most recently, she unveiled her first danish-language single ‘Du har ret’, an energetic and danceable tribute to liberating friendships. With her profound musicality and authentic expression, Laura Ziani is an exciting talent who will continue to captivate and surprise audiences.

name: Collision
description:
Collision delivers hard-hitting, energetic indie rock with an intensely melancholic lyrical universe. Drawing inspiration from 90’s rock, Collision integrates these influences into a fresh and innovative sound. At its core, Collision is all about sharing live experiences with the audience - something they also strive to recreate in their recordings.
Collision consists of Marius Norup, Mads Brunsbjerg, Oskar Bendixen, Jens Madsen, and Lauge Slot.

name: Hilal Kaya
description:
Danish-Turkish vocalist Hilal Kaya masterfully blends traditional Turkish melodies with jazz, rock, world music, and afrobeats, giving her music a unique sound that transcends both culture and time. With a voice that carries both power and vulnerability, Hilal Kaya captivates her audience, taking them on a musical journey from Istanbul to Copenhagen.
Hilal has made her mark as a dynamic live performer and through her collaborations with Denmark's acclaimed supergroup Kalaha and Aarhus Jazz Orchestra. Together, they have created music that has been nominated for several jazz and roots awards. Her vocals bring a unique cultural twist to Kalaha's electronic and jazz-infused sound, capturing attention both in Denmark and internationally.
In September 2024, she released her debut single Perisan, which received great attention for its unique sound and emotional vocal delivery. Hilal plans to enter the studio in January 2025 to complete her upcoming album, which is expected to be released in 2026. Additionally, she is set to release her next single at the end of April 2025, generating significant anticipation among her fans.
Hilal gave her first performance at the Resonator Festival, where she impressed the audience with her powerful voice and charismatic stage presence. She then performed at P8 Jazz Sessions 2024, earning high praise for her unique genre fusion. Most recently, she took the stage at the VinterJazz Festival, where the concert was sold out and received overwhelming acclaim from both audiences and critics.

name: BUKURU
description:
BUKURU is a young artist from Northern Jutland, raised in a small town about an hour outside of Aalborg, in a home where music was always a big part of life. The past year has brought major changes for him. In 2024, he signed with Capitol Records, and after finishing high school, he took the big step of moving to Copenhagen to go all in on his music career.
Preparation and growth have shaped BUKURU into a strong artist at an early age. Even before releasing any music, he caught the attention of influential media outlets like Soundvenue. His debut single ‘Tandlæge’ speaks for itself. It brings a rare sound to the Danish music scene, offering tender, Frank Ocean-inspired neo-soul with melodic electric guitar, deep reverb, and a vocal performance that’s both intimate and powerful.
BUKURU moves gracefully between melodic pop and soul, with a remarkable ability to lyrically convey emotions and experiences that are deeply personal, yet universally relatable.

name: BBYBITES
description:
The bold and versatile artist BBYBITES has spent the past few years releasing music that explores the experience of being a woman in her mid-20s, focusing on identity crises and the expectations of being a female superhero. By combining this with her unique visual universe, BBYBITES has managed to create a space for anyone in need of a sanctuary to cry, laugh, scream, and dance.
BBYBITES pours her heart and soul into every aspect of her artistry—from the smallest instrumental details to the grading of her visual material. This dedication has earned her widespread recognition, and in recent years, BBYBITES has been part of P3’s UU family, selected as one of VEGA’s Udvalgte, a finalist in Karrierekanonen, nominated for "New Artist of the Year" at the Zulu Awards 2021, sold out her own show at Hotel Cecil, and performed for a packed Countdown stage at Roskilde Festival.

name: School of X
description:
School of X is the stage name of Danish musician Rasmus Littauer, who has been releasing music under this alias since 2017. He is known for his internationally acclaimed albums and collaborations with artists such as Liss, Trentemøller, and MØ.
Rasmus Littauer found inspiration for School of X during his runs in Copenhagen and other major cities worldwide while touring as MØ’s live drummer. Before he started running, he had a vast amount of creative energy and a strong urge to create, but he didn't know how to unleash it or find the strength to turn it into reality. Running still provides him with the necessary clarity and energy to create his own music.
On November 1, 2024, School of X released his third studio album, ‘Seventh Heaven’. The album explores the pursuit of absolute happiness and perfection as a utopia while holding onto the hope of reaching it. During the recording process, Littauer changed direction by bringing a new band into the studio and handing over the producer role to Søren Buhl Lassen. This allowed for a renewed focus on songwriting and captured the intense live energy of School of X's concerts.
The album has received praise for its grand indie-pop sound. GAFFA described it as a "magnificent celestial journey with an all-or-nothing pop album that quickly takes flight." Soundvenue highlighted the combination of longing lyrics and energetic songwriting, creating a sense of fresh air and wind in the hair as the adrenaline rushes forward.

name: Sira Jovina
description:
In 2023, Sira Jovina made a name for herself on TikTok, inviting her rapidly growing audience into her teenage bedroom. There, she wrote songs, mastered multiple instruments, and performed acoustic versions from the safest place she knew—her bed. Just before the year ended, she independently released her first song, ‘Længe Siden’, produced by her older brother, Emil, with her father, Asger, on bass.
In 2024, 20-year-old Sira Jovina signed with Def Jam and released the EP ‘Min Drøm, Min Altid’, presenting her story and musical vision. A creative project tailored to Jovina’s own artistic instincts, it extended beyond the music into a visual universe that connected the bedroom with dreams—and, above all, ambition. In the fall, she released the single ‘Oktobernat’, which also made it onto the setlist when she performed as part of VEGAs Udvalgte in January.

name: Terrorpy
description:
The tempo is fast, the groove is filthy, and the ambition is dripping with bile — teeth-grinding death metal at its finest. Terrorpy is a trio heavily rooted in the American death metal tradition - though occasionally mixed with some Germans, Poles, and the odd Swede. Expect blast beats, bass distortion, sweeps, and a hellish tobacco-ravaged growl delivering grotesque lyrics to the audience. Consider this your invitation to partake in unholiness of the wettest kind.
In 2024, Terrorpy entered the studio to record their second album, ‘The Bisection Collection’, aiming to both strengthen their established style and explore new directions. That same year, they qualified for the Danish finals of the Wacken Metal Battle and released their album to a warm reception in November.

name: efteraar
description:
Aarhusianske efteraar delivers a dreamy fusion of indie pop and rock. Their lyrics revolve around the emotions of the late twenties - feeling stuck in the hamster wheel, friendships fading, and the highs and lows of love. That sense of everything moving so fast around you that you just follow along without thinking. Big questions arise: Should you stay on the same path, or take the leap and try something new? Maybe you just need to pause and breathe? These thoughts and reflections inspire efteraar’s unique sound.
The band is set to release their debut album, Kalder på et øjeblik, on April 25th, 2025, making them a highly relevant act at this year’s SPOT Festival. Their indie-inspired sound moves between the raw energy of rock and the airy melodies of pop, wrapped in dreamy guitars and an autumnal darkness, balanced by warm harmonies reminiscent of fall’s colors.
efteraar thrives on the special energy born from the intimate chaos of the rehearsal space, where handcrafted instrumentation drives their music. At the same time, they are fascinated by incorporating electronic elements into their universe - a fusion that truly comes alive in their performances.

name: gubbi
description:
gubbi is a Danish folk project by Gustav Bejder Jensen, who is the frontman and co-founder of Høker. gubbi writes intimate songs where musical sensitivity and big themes are blended with a quirky and poetic lyrical universe and an organic sound, rooted in gubbi's singer-songwriter background and inspirations such as Elliott Smith, Alex G, and Big Thief.
In November 2024, gubbi released his debut EP 'Heldigvis, heldigvis', which encapsulates the quirkiness and humanity that characterize gubbi's musical work. On the EP, gubbi reflects on the emotions and struggles he has experienced in his close relationships and on becoming a more emotionally whole person. The EP received positive recognition from Soundvenue.
Behind gubbi stands Gustav Bejder Jensen, who is also the lead singer and co-founder of Høker, a band that won KarriereKanonen in 2019, played concerts all over Denmark, opened for Minds of 99 at the Royal Arena, and received Ugens Uundgåelige on P3 with the song 'Ud af dig'.

name: Inventory
description: Inspired by a love for the more unconventional and introspective bands from the 90s alt-rock scene, Copenhagen-based Inventory creates music that draws equally from Red House Painters' slowcore anthems and Tortoise's playful, jazz-infused post-rock. Their guitar-driven rock combines the unexpected, the weird, and the soothing. Inventory is currently promoting their new EP ‘Sunday Tonne’, released on the British label Sofa Boy Records. Just back from a EU tour, Inventory is ready to take on SPOT Festival.

name: Krammer
description: Krammer is a young female solo artist from the heart of Jutland. Her musical universe draws inspiration and elements from pop, jazz, and R&B, blending them into an ethereal and ambient cocktail. Captivating lyrics about people and experiences she has encountered throughout her life set the stage. Moving vocal harmonies, along with flute and electronic touches, elevate her otherwise down-to-earth songs to a higher level, creating a unique atmosphere on stage throughout the entire set.

name: Local Hero
description:
Local Hero embodies both the powerful energy of the city's pulsating rhythms and the warm, inviting calm of more intimate moments. Their music ranges from atmospheric ballads to intense rock explosions. They masterfully balance great musical expressiveness with a playful approach — where listeners can be both captivated by the familiar and surprised by the unexpected.
David Miilmann’s melodic slide guitar adds a singing nuance to the music, Rasmus Dahl’s organ playing fills the soundscape with warmth, and Jakob Marker’s drums drive the music forward with pulsating energy. This dynamic organ trio breathes new life into the classic organ trio tradition with a fresh Scandinavian touch. Their diverse musical backgrounds merge into an energetic expression best described as Scandinavian jazz-rock.

name: Skt. DeLarge
description:
Rapper/producer Skt. DeLarge has previously been called "something as rare as an original in the hip-hop world" and has impressed and surprised the Danish underground scene since 2020 with his expressive yet thoughtful blend of alternative rap, noise, and digital hardcore.
His satirical staging and experimental, distorted musical universe is infused with anger and fragility, as he tackles topics such as toxic masculinity, xenophobia, capitalism, and uncritical popular culture. What remains is a person shouting at a broken world, aware that he is part of the destruction.
In 2022, Skt. DeLarge released the EP ‘Super Ego’, which was praised by both listeners and critics. Since then, he has shown significant creative development through aggressively introspective singles like ‘HEYOAH’ and ‘LILLESPEJL’, which have led to a series of well-received live shows across Denmark and the opportunity to support international acts such as Denzel Curry and Danny Brown.

name: Elle Ace
description: Elle Ace is an up-and-coming indie-pop duo, created by the siblings Astrid and Kristian. Drawing inspiration from all corners of music, they blend hard synths with soft melodies, resulting in an international, unique, and exciting sound. Based in their childhood home's basement, the music is written, produced, recorded, and finalized by Astrid and Kristian, each playing their own role in the process.

name: Majke Voss
description:
Majke Voss is a composer, singer and songwriter formerly known as Broken Twin. Following her critically acclaimed debut album ‘May’, her forthcoming album is written and produced by herself, featuring an array of prominent musicians from the Copenhagen music scene such as Johan Wieth (Iceage) and Nils Gröndahl (Under Byen). 
Built from piano, bass, beats and distorted strings and centred around her soulful voice, the coming album - this time set to be released in her own name - is a development and expansion of her distinct songwriting and minimalistic, cinematic sound.
Her debut ‘May’ was released on ANTI- Records and widely praised in publications such as Rolling Stone, Vogue, The Guardian and The Sunday Times. NPR called it a “Breathtaking debut”, while NME dubbed her “the most arrestingly beautiful songwriter we’ve heard in aeons”. Since then Majke has toured throughout Europe and collaborated with artists such as Copenhagen Philharmonics, the experimental photographer Daisuke Yokota (JP) and film composer and Danish punk legend Peter Peter. 
At this year’s SPOT Festival, she will play an exclusive show teasing new songs in a raw and intimate solo set up.

name: miaw
description:
miaw is a cross-pop duo performing a ‘UK Bass’-inspired deconstructed club music resembling Sega Bodega and Pink Pantheress, while blending into the field of shoegaze and ‘90s trip-hop. 
Consisting of Frederik Bruun and Liza Dries from Denmark and the Netherlands, the two producers use fast breakbeats, arpeggiated synthesizers, and unorthodox sampling techniques to create a sound at the intersection of a remix and a pop song. 
Their debut EP, ‘My Petswan’, released on Danish underground label Petrola 80, has received multiple airplays on international radio stations such as BBC6, 1Live and P6, along with a list of reviews and mentions from GAFFA, Soundvenue, Undertoner, Bands of Tomorrow, and BPM.

name: Safario
description:
If you ask a Safario fan to put Safario in one genre, they would tell you that it’s not happening. Safario is his own genre, it just makes you feel good. If Safario was an object, it would taste like a colourful smoothie containing eastern european punk, scandinavian jazz, four on the floor, and hip hop. Sounds weird right? It’s because it is.
Safario (Kacper B. Tratkowski) is a genre-bending artist whose high-energy performances and viral hits make him one of Norway's most exciting new talents. His debut album ‘Safario’ cements his signature style, merging hip-hop, indie, and his Polish roots. Standout tracks include the polish jazz hit ‘Chowder (Rada Rada)’, a viral sensation, and ‘Insomnia’, the punk track on the album.
Known for immersive live shows filled with raw energy, moshpits, bold visuals, and unforgettably stupid real life scenarios, Safario has built a cult following online and a rapidly growing fanbase internationally as well as in Norway. His unique sound and raw stage presence make him an ideal fit for European audiences seeking fresh, genre-defying music.

name: Cupid Girl
description:
Cupid Girl, also known as Julie Engelsviken, is an emerging indie pop-rock artist from Norway. She has gained significant attention in the Norwegian music scene, after becoming a “Årets urørt” (undiscovered artist of the year) finalist, which was marked by a live performance on Norwegian national television.
Her music style combines pop and rock elements with deeply personal lyrics, drawing inspiration from artists like Wet Leg, HAIM, and Fleetwood Mac.
Cupid Girl had a successful debut year, marked by an EP release, numerous concerts, and performances at renowned Norwegian music showcases such as Vill Vill Vest and Trondheim Calling. Her previous singles, "I Drop Everything," became popular on Norwegian radio and received global attention from Spotify's GLOW playlist as well as appearing on the cover of Nordic GLOW playlist. She was also voted the most promising newcomer in 2024 by the Norwegian music industry.
Cupid Girl is known for her captivating energetic live performances and is currently working on new music for 2025 which will be promoted by several festivals and live shows.

name: Ella Augusta
description:
Ella Augusta is a rising Danish singer and songwriter who has made her mark on the Danish music scene with her soulful voice and honest pop songs. Her music is characterized by intimate and heartfelt melodies that capture the emotions of youth with sharp and direct lyrics.
In January 2024, she released the single ‘Internetsangen’, which has gained over 1.5 million streams. Later that year, her debut EP ‘Sytten’ followed, with the track ‘Baglæns’ doubling her success with over 3 million streams.
Ella Augusta has also contributed the theme song for the youth series Grænser III and collaborated with artists such as Benjamin Hav on the hit ‘Første Dag’ and Lord Siva on the album ‘8 Dage i April’.
Her first headliner concert at VEGA’s Ideal Bar sold out, and several shows on her autumn tour have achieved the same status. Ella Augusta was nominated for two P3 Guld awards: P3 Talent and Årets Lytterhit for her collaboration with Benjamin Hav on ‘Første Dag’.
With her ability to convey emotions through music and create unique live experiences, Ella Augusta is a talent on the rise.

name: Zoumer
description:
Behind the name Zoumer is singer and producer Yasmina Derradj (DK/DZ), whose neon-green musical universe oscillates between energetic alternative pop filtered through punk, breakbeats, and the Algerian protest genre raï.
Zoumer is a playful exploration of freedom and self-expression, where not fitting in is transmuted into total liberation. The alias Zoumer originates from (and pays homage to) the freedom fighter Lalla Fatma N’Soumer, who led battles against French colonial forces in Algeria during the 19th century.
In just a year and a half, Zoumer has performed at major festivals across Denmark, including Roskilde Festival in 2024, earning praise from outlets such as GAFFA, Politiken, Undertoner, and Passive//Aggressive for her playful and high-energy live shows and her debut album, ‘Green World’.
She is currently working on her second album, ‘Euro Arab Lovergirl’, set for release in fall 2025, as well as the DJ duo Zoumer & Debbie Clubs with her creative partner Debbie Sings.

name: Demolizer
description:
Hailing from Copenhagen, Denmark, Demolizer is a relentless force in the modern thrash metal scene. Rooted in the raw energy and unfiltered aggression of old-school thrash, they bring a fresh edge to the genre with a street-inspired attitude.
These four thrashing juggernauts stop at nothing on a warpath of thrash, fearlessly pushing boundaries. Demolizer's message is a sonic rebellion, challenging the status quo with every pounding beat and roaring riff.
After shaking stages across Denmark with their previous releases, including the acclaimed ‘Thrashmageddon’ and the crushing ‘Post Necrotic Human’, Demolizer shows no signs of slowing down. With over 100 concerts under their belt, they are on a mission to melt faces with their relentless thrash metal.

name: Anastasia
description: Join us as Anastasia summons hidden emotions under the moonlight. Anastasia sings for  you, me, and us - regardless of the time, it's bittersweet pop melodies, with a touch of humorous singer-songwriter lyrics, jazzy elements, and flirtatious vocals about love affairs, that fly through the lungs, into the heart, and finally settle like playful butterflies in the stomach. Do you want to know what it means to be in love or heartbroken? Then you must hear Anastasia…

name: EYES
description: Hailing from Copenhagen, Denmark, hardcore quintet EYES are ready with their third full length album, titled ‘SPINNER’ on Prosthetic records.
