Following on from their critically acclaimed sophomore album, Congratulations, and a slew of eviscerating live performances all over Europe, EYES took to the studio to record the ten tracks of ‘SPINNER’ in Autumn 2024. Featuring members of LLNN a.o, EYES are very much a product of the burgeoning underground scene in their hometown, where they have already established themselves as a force to be reckoned with.

name: Frida Baltzer
description: Frida Baltzer captivates her audience with a powerful blend of vulnerability and strength, drawing listeners into a cinematic world filled with intensity and raw honesty. With a unique fusion of pop, folk, and electronic elements, she creates a dynamic and playful soundscape that is both deeply thoughtful and irresistibly intuitive. In February 2025, Frida Baltzer released her debut EP ‘Mens Jeg Venter’, where she, with a rare authenticity, explores longing, love, and the relentless urge to follow her dreams. This is music that isn’t just heard – it’s felt.

name: Inspector Spacetime
description:
Inspector Spacetime is a Reykjavík based pop band, influenced by a wide variety of dance and pop acts and genres such as Daft Punk, The Prodigy, Charli XCX along with disco and synth-pop classics. The band’s music is an ode to the European dance music scene throughout the decades, where the common goal is to get people moving. 
With their self-titled debut album Inspector Spacetime made waves in the Icelandic music scene in early 2020, receiving a nomination for ‘Album of the Year’ at the Icelandic music awards, as well as an award for ‘Album of the Year’ from the Kraumur awards and the title of ‘Artist of the Year’ from The Reykjavík Grapevine music awards. Their music has been well received by notable critics from Iceland and audiences alike. 
Inspector Spacetime has been a constant presence in Iceland since their emergence, as they strive to breathe life into the live-music scene in Reykjavík. They’ve made a name for themselves as one of the best live acts Iceland has to offer with their electric energy and carefree attitude. After careful expansion and evolution of their act, they’ve never been sharper.

name: Niko Blonde
description:
Niko Blonde made his debut in 2018 with the EP ‘Okay Demo’, and since then, he has made waves within the R&B and rap scene. He’s known for his meticulously crafted lyrics that hit straight to the heart and for his dedication to every aspect of his artistic journey.
With the single ‘Himmel til helvede’, Niko Blonde has already proven his musical strength, amassing over a million streams across platforms. His latest album, ‘Fred være med det’, has helped establish him as a rising name on Denmark’s emerging music scene, thanks to his unique sound and visual aesthetic.
Niko Blonde is more than just a musician - he’s a complete artist, determined to shape his own musical universe. His visual style aligns seamlessly with his musical vision, and he is known for giving every single detail the attention it deserves.
Blending R&B and rap, Niko Blonde brings a refreshing breeze into the Danish music landscape. While he has already gained significant recognition, his journey toward the stars is just getting started. His distinctive musical approach and style mark an exciting chapter in Danish music history - and with a bright future ahead, the potential to explore new creative horizons is limitless.

name: SLIM0
description:
SLIM0 is a Copenhagen based doom/grunge/punk trio consisting of Mija Milovic (guitar, keys, bass), Lena Milovic (guitar, bass) and Simin Stine Ramezanali (drums, bass). The vocals of all three members can be heard throughout, the voice being a central element to the band's practice. 
SLIM0 uses minimal, albeit feisty arrangements to convey a strong sense of ominousness. Through crashed cymbals, distorted guitars and voices in unison, they present a full body of work hailing from personal takes on classic punk/rock tropes with SLIM0 as the omniscient narrator. Their debut album ‘FORGIVENESS’ was released in October 2024 via 15 love.

name: sús
description:
sús is a Portugese performer, composer, producer and mixed-media artist based in Copenhagen.
Her sound draws from Portuguese tradition and lives in the lands of experimental music, bordering the suburbs of pop, folklore and electronica.
Her debut single Primavera Deserta has been featured in the compilation Fnac New Talents ‘23, curated by the main alternative radio channel in Portugal, Antena 3.  Her first album Entre, released in May, walks in avant-garde electronica, inhabiting the suburbs of pop, folklore and experimentation.
sús has performed at Vinterjazz, Copenhagen Jazz Festival and in the independent circuit of Portugal and Spain.

name: Emily Bowen
description:
Emily Bowen’s songs feel like the soundtrack to a coming-of-age indie film from the 2000s, where the protagonist slowly but surely grows into a life that’s anything but black and white. Her debut single, ‘Honey’, burst onto Danish radio as P3’s “Unavoidable Track of The Week”, and in early 2025, Emily released her debut album, ‘Hate Me For This’. The organic pop album is infused with the lived experiences of the 20-year-old newcomer. Written like a diary, the songs reveal pages full of confessions, truths, pain, smiles, humor, and an honest, vulnerable openness to the first-time experiences we all face from birth to death.
The aforementioned debut single, ‘Honey’, set the stage in spring 2024 with its charming, noisy indie-pop vibe and lyrics that read like a diary entry. While the song appeared to reflect a friend’s destructive thoughts and chaotic life, it ultimately pointed back to the songwriter herself. In her creative exploration, Emily’s empathetic and curious nature led her to new studios and collaborators. Among them was producer Rasmus Søegren (known for work with eee gee, Dopha, Hjalmer, and more), whose meticulous, innovative approach to music became the perfect match for Emily’s debut album.
Over the past year, Emily Bowen’s music has taken root on the live scene as well, with a performance at Smukfest and a supporting tour with English band Maximo Park. Danish online magazine Soundvenue has also named her one of the 15 most promising artists of 2025.

name: Kundo
description:
Kundo’s ability to convey words reflects an output rooted in a thoughtful and reflective young lyricist. The breakthrough for the rapper from Vejle came with 7100, North Face featuring Lamin, and the five-star debut EP, ‘Bar’ En Drøm’. His versatility has brought his laid-back flow into features with Kind Mod Kind, a collaboration with super-producer Anton Westerlin on Bellingham Freestyle, and two of the biggest late-summer 2024 hits: ‘Noget Si’r Mig’ with Thor Farlov and the previously mentioned ‘Signaler’ with MAS—both of which have gone Gold.
‘Hvem Har Stedet’ is the first single from Kundo’s upcoming album. The song is in constant motion, pushing forward, placing Kundo in shifting scenarios as he searches for the perfect spot in the city to party with friends. At the same time, it captures the song’s deeper themes—the consequences of a fleeting lifestyle, but ultimately, a journey toward greater self-awareness.
Last summer, Kundo hit Roskilde Festival for the second year in a row. This summer, he can be experienced at festivals across the country.

name: LIVLØS
description:
Since their inception in 2014, Danish melodic death metal titans LIVLØS have established themselves as an innovative force on the international death metal scene - most recently with the release of their epic concept album 'The Crescent King' in 2024.
LIVLØS' continued artistic growth has been evident in both songwriting and technical prowess since they began their career with the release of their deeply personal debut album 'Into Beyond' (2018). Their second album, 'And Then There Were None' (2021), released by Napalm Records, had a darker and more ambitious sound, resonating with both fans and critics.
On their latest record, LIVLØS continue to deliver their crushing style - a blend of heavy grooves, melancholic melodies, and progressive musicianship - while unfolding a cosmological, fantasy-inspired narrative about 'The Crescent King,' a symbol of humanity, its psyche, and its cycle in the universe. Ambition, form, and content merge beautifully on 'The Crescent King.'

name: Mawne
description:
Magne Lundgaard had a lot on his mind. At one point, so much that he had no choice but to share it. Through his project Mawne, he does so in a raw and youthfully poetic way. Lyrics born from different emotional states are laid bare across everything from dreamy, heavy, and electronic productions to soulful, warm, and acoustic instrumentals.
The music is entirely self-produced, stripping away any barriers between artist and listener. Mawne is genre-fluid and contemporary - what matters most is that the productions, lyrics, and melodies come together to convey a feeling as real and authentic as possible.

name: Vulvatorious
description:
Vulvatorious is a Danish extreme metal band based in Copenhagen, Denmark. The band was formed in 2020 by vocalist and front woman Ditte Krøyer and guitarists Signe Lading and Sofie Angen. In 2021, bassist Florent Besson and drummer Rasmus Johan Aarslev joined the band, and since then, things have quickly taken off. Their self-titled debut album was released in March 2024.
The musical style of Vulvatorious is a blend of different metal subgenres woven together to form a unique sound that is both black, somber, sludgy, and aggressive. The music is accompanied by Krøyer’s no-bullshit lyrics about themes like mortality, feminism, injustice and abuse -  in particular towards women.
Vulvatorious is a band known for their inclusive and feminist profile and for their intense live acts, often boasting a substantial female audience.

name: Demersal
description: Demersal is a hardcore band that writes songs about care and restlessness as a reaction to a world in decay. Their music incorporates elements of hardcore, screamo, mathcore, and post-rock, resulting in both chaotic meltdowns and calm, transcendent passages, topped by four vocals that appear both powerful and fragile at the same time. The band has toured Europe multiple times and played at Danish festivals such as Uhørt, A Colossal Weekend, Ilter Festival, Copenhagen Metal Fest, and SPOT. They have also gained recognition from major international media outlets like Stereogum and BrooklynVegan.

name: Hungry Boy
description: Johannes Debel, also known as Hungry Boy, stands out with his ability to write simple yet profound songs that tell honest stories from everyday life. His music is understated, emotionally charged, yet down-to-earth and straightforward. With his descriptive lyrics, Johannes creates songs that listeners can see themselves in.

name: ozzy
description:
ozzy breaks out of the bedroom and dissolves the boundaries of hip-hop with a sonic universe that draws threads from vastly different styles such as R&B, house, bossa nova, and future bass.
From his room in Helsingør, the 23-year-old rapper, singer, and producer Oskar Elholm has spent seven years crafting a sound that is difficult to compare to anything else on the Danish music scene. From his debut single ‘Samme side’—which has amassed over 1.5 million streams to date—to his debut EP ‘Alt Jeg Ved’, ozzy continues to challenge the conventions of what hip-hop can sound like.
ozzy’s journey into music began in 8th grade, during the SoundCloud era, which served as his entry point into the world of music. While he has moved on from the sound of those early days, the desire to create his own distinct project remains strong. The fusion of hip-hop and the R&B sound from the early 2010s has left a clear mark on ozzy’s music, drawing inspiration from artists like Kaytranada, Don Toliver, and tendai.

name: Sofie Mathiasen
description:
Sofie Mathiasen is a 19-year-old singer-songwriter whose alternative pop music world is drenched in raw intimacy and poetic expression. Sofie’s work is not bound by convention, but instead embraces the deeper, more lyrical corners of pop, inviting listeners into a reflective world of vulnerability and haunting beauty. 
Of Austrian and Danish heritage with a childhood spent in South America, Sofie is currently studying at the Royal Academy of Music in Aarhus as a songwriter. Her first EP will be released soon along with much more music in store for 2025.

name: Slush Eyes
description:
The duo Slush Eyes plays hard-hitting DK Dance. With one finger in the air, they sing songs about melancholic, euphoric nights out, about life’s surreal and lonely moments, and about love breaking apart on a cold curb on a Thursday night. When Slush Eyes performs, loneliness and insecurity transform into extravagant bubblegum colors, crystal-clear melodies, and irresistible beats.
As a contrast to the closed circles on the city’s dance floors and the cool atmosphere of techno clubs, Mikkel and Kristoffer from Slush Eyes look back to the naivety and unpretentious community of the ‘90s. They embrace bright, pastel-colored melodies and grand chords while a deep blue melancholy floats through their bubblegum landscapes.
It’s a kind of Eurodance mixed with Nordic Noir and Danish irony. Together, they are both playful and bigger than life. And they create a space where there’s room to feel blue and room to be on. Where, with slushy eyes, you can raise a finger in the air and let yourself be absorbed into their sugar-coated, neon-colored, and cathartic darkroom.

name: Yndling
description:
Yndling is the dream pop project of Norwegian artist Silje Espevik, drawing inspiration from acts such as Mazzy Star, Beach House, Men I Trust and Cocteau twins, whilst forming her own sound within the noisy realm of dream pop. 
Since her debut in 2021, Yndling has showcased her music at By:Larm, and had her international live debut at New Colossus in New York last year. This led to her signing to the American label Spirit Goth, and the release of her debut album ‘Mood Booster’ in August 2024. With her music slowly spreading and gaining her a growing international fanbase, she is working on new music that will be released in 2025.

name: CEVIL
description:
Behind the artist name CEVIL is 24-year-old singer, songwriter, and producer Cecilie Vahle. Since childhood, Cecilie has been writing songs and spending countless hours in the rehearsal space above her parents’ barn in Djursland, immersed in the many facets of music.
With her uncompromising approach to pop music tinged with retro and hyperpop influences, CEVIL draws inspiration from many corners of the music world. From St. Vincent to HAIM and Caroline Polachek, her inspirations revolve around an anti-manufactured sound that radiates integrity—an integrity that also shines clearly through CEVIL’s own catalog.
In the fall of 2023, CEVIL made her single debut with ‘Don’t Speak,’ followed by a handful of versatile singles, including ‘20 BPM,’ which premiered on Soundvenue and P3. A year after her first single, CEVIL released her debut EP, ‘FREAK’ (2024), which explores the theme of being deceived in romantic relationships, encompassing all the lies, disappointments, and feelings of being unfairly treated.

name: Elias Rønnenfelt
description:
Elias B. Rønnenfelt, renowned as the frontman and lyricist of Iceage, is known for a sound of his own which is dreamy yet bombastic, fragile yet tough, continually evolving while staying rooted in his fearless artistry.
In October, the singer unveiled his debut solo album ‘Heavy Glory’, released via Escho, co-produced with Nis Bysted and featuring collaborators like Iceage’s Dan Kjær Nielsen, punk legend Peter Peter, and vocalists Joanne Robertson and Fauzia. The album boasts a dynamic and atmospheric sound and it is a raw, genre-defying exploration of love, chaos, and resilience, capturing the essence of growing up by diving headfirst into life, anchored by Rønnenfelt’s ever-present pen and guitar. Born during the uncertain post-pandemic haze of 2022, ‘Heavy Glory’ emerged as a collection of songs written and tested on the road in forests, chapels, and living rooms across Europe.
Elias Rønnenfelt is never afraid to examine the complexities of human connection, from desperate longing to tender surrender. With tracks like ‘Unarmed’ and ‘Stalker’ he presents a deeply personal yet universal narrative.

name: Embla and the Karidotters
description:
Embla and the Karidotters is a project by former Razika drummer Embla Karidotter. After the successful Norwegian indie band went on hiatus, Embla gathered her "Karidotters" from talented bands like Honningbarna, Sløtface, Slomosa, and Aiming for Enrike. They quickly began playing concerts and recording music.
The renowned producer Matias Tellez was behind the band's first two releases, but on their latest album, ‘Off Leash’, they did everything themselves, with multi-instrumentalist Simen Følstad Nilsen producing and mixing the album.
The band's second album continues their “honky tonk noir” sound, with references to Ennio Morricone, Nancy Sinatra, and David Lynch films, featuring lyrics that are humorous, self-deprecating, and melancholic. Karidotter describes the release as having a detached relationship with country, in the sense that they don’t worry about what is right or wrong within the genre, while still drawing inspiration from classic country rock of the 1950s and 1960s.

name: Mira Solis
description:
Mira Solis is a young, vibrant artist ready to speak her mind. She paints a personal and intimate picture of mental health, self-image, youth culture and society through her lyrics and lively performance.
The lyrical universe is supported by a blend of lush neo-soul and alternative pop. Mira Solis has dazzled at several festivals such as JazzHaus UJNFOR, BlueBridge Festival, and Noget Bedre Festival.

name: Wads
description:
Since 2016, he has been the frontman of the hit-making duo Phlake, which, with songs like ‘Angel Zoo’, ‘The Rascal’, ‘Pregnant’, and over 250 million streams across four critically acclaimed and multi-award-winning albums, has become one of the country’s most popular and influential names in recent years.
Now, Phlake is on standby. And with the release of come here in January, Wads made his solo debut, having previously collaborated with artists like Pil, Benjamin Hav, Dos Santos, and Emil Kruse. The single ‘come here’ introduced an edgy and multi-layered electronic R&B universe, which now takes on new shades with the spaced-out pop track ‘beast’.
Wads twists the song’s theme with pitched alien-like vocals, reminiscent of his alter ego, Mercedes the Virus, from Phlake hits like ‘Slip Away’ and ‘Baby Steps’. Like ‘come here’, the new single was produced in close collaboration with producer Awinbeh Ayagiba (Jada, Artigeardit, and more).

name: ASTA NORR
description:
ASTA NORR is a 22-year-old Danish singer and songwriter who stands out on the Danish music scene with her unique fusion of classical music, jazz, pop, hip hop, and reggaeton. Her music combines strong melodies, lyrical intimacy, and rhythmic elements to create an enchanting sound that is both experimental and accessible.
Her latest single, which gained particular traction on TikTok, ‘Drinks Og Drama’, is a tribute to friendship and support, and has already drawn attention for its energetic production and relatable lyrics. In 2024, she released the radio hit ‘Til Sommer’, which cemented her talent for crafting catchy melodies.
With her charismatic vocals, a clear artistic vision, and the ability to push musical boundaries, she is an artist to watch on the Danish music scene.

name: THUS
description:
THUS is a brand-new and battle-ready metal band from Aarhus, Denmark, challenging the conventions of the Danish metal scene. With progressive riffs, complex rhythms, and melancholic melodies, THUS brings an original and modern interpretation of the Scandinavian death metal sound.
THUS is a fresh addition to the Danish metal lineage, consisting of highly skilled musicians with experience from a wide range of bands such as Chronicle, Mother of All, Polars Collide, Withering Surface, Defacing God, Statement, and Livløs (live). With their new and ambitious EP 'The Terminal Condition of Existence' and an extensive series of live performances under their belt, Thus is ready to kick down the doors of the international metal scene and bring their breathtaking and captivating live show to stages worldwide.
The band's first EP features five explosive metal anthems. THUS has recently won the Danish Wacken Metal Battle and will soon be tearing up venues – and eardrums – across the globe.

name: J. Ludvig III
description:
Behind the artist name J. Ludvig III is the acclaimed drummer and producer Jonathan Jull Ludvigsen, who first made waves on the music scene as part of the groundbreaking jazz trio Athletic Progression. Ludvigsen's precision, hybrid style, and talent for performing breakbeats live have taken him around the world, touring with artists such as Erika de Casier and Liv.e. The J. Ludvig III project began to take shape during Jonathan's days at the conservatory in Aarhus, where he explored the interplay between complex drumming and anxious, introspective songwriting.
In 2021, he released his debut album, ‘Sadboy Fusion’, showcasing the results of this exploration: hectic and provocatively off-kilter beats cycling alongside Jonathan's bright, angelic, autotuned voice. It’s an extreme contrast between vulnerability and strength, also evident in his live performances, where he turns his back to the audience, exposing his bare back while battling with his instrument.
In 2024, J. Ludvig III returned with his second album, ‘EMOTAN’, a tribute to his former self and a desire to defy expectations. It’s a grand breakup album that throws the listener through a whirlwind of genre references, all held together by Jonathan’s anxious vocals, seemingly on the verge of breaking. On ‘EMOTAN’, J. Ludvig III uses his myriad influences as a tool to tell a bigger story, both musically and personally.

name: Salon Noir
description:
Salon Noir consists of drummer Sebastian Fammé, guitarist and vocalist Solveig Margrethe, and bassist Daniel Bust. Although a newly formed young Danish rock band, the trio has known each other since childhood. All three members were born and raised in the heart of Aarhus, where their rehearsal space is located in the garage of siblings Solveig and Sebastian's home.
Inspired by genres like dreampop and melodic shoegaze, as well as artists such as Slowdive and Danish Kashmir, Salon Noir aims to craft a contemporary sound, placing the rock waves of the '90s into a modern context with lyrics about human relationships in the youth of the 2020s.
After graduating high school, Salon Noir is ready to take on the Danish music scene. In 2023, they released their debut album, ‘For A Second’, reached the finals of the Fatter Eskil Prize, and played at Mølleparken during Aarhus Festuge and Blue Ocean Music Festival in Ebeltoft. Last year, they were awarded the Bands of Tomorrow grant, and they have just completed a 4-song EP, now ready for release.

name: Suaré Virginie Dembele
description:
Suaré (Virginie) DEMBELE is a Malian musician and singer who hails from the Bo region in the Ségou area and the San circle (located in the southeast) of Mali.
With her band she presents the music and the traditions of her people. With a great energy, a beautiful voice and a special instrument that she builds herself, a mix of a guitar and the traditional instrument ngoni, she captures the audience with authenticity and intensity. She renews the traditions, and she challenges the gender expectations in Mali as an instrumentalist.
Her dream is to become the new international star from Mali. She had vocal studies at Fondation Passerelle which is founded by the Malian superstar Rokia Traoré. While studying she attended church Choirs and different bands and quit rapidly, she formed her own orchestra with high ambitions, and soon she raised her carrier to a professional level.
Musicians all over the globe fight for their carriers and everywhere we talk about the gender
challenges as a woman in the business. In Mali the difficulties are even more challenging both culturally, politically, and financially. It takes a strong woman to insist on her right to play music and be ambitious. 
Suaré became the selected artist from the Danish facilitated Spot on Mali festival 2024 to be invited to Denmark to play at SPOT in Aarhus 2025. Spot on Mali festival will support Suaré Virginie Dembele with this tour.

name: Ana Juél
description: The 25-year-old musician Ana Juél creates pop-R&B with an international sound that lets her South American heritage shine through. Her songs exude rebellion and justice, while the productions are laid-back and rich in detail, subtly inviting you to dance.

name: Bye Bye Brenda
description:
Former lead singer of Alphabeat, Stine Bramsen, and one of the country's best Americana/country musicians, Kajsa Vala have joined forces to create a new power duo in Danish music.
Bye Bye Brenda writes songs with an intimate atmosphere that go deep and resonate widely. They have just released their debut album ‘Landmarks’, where country and Americana - inspired by artists like Kacey Musgraves, Bon Iver, and Phoebe Bridgers - set the stage for a collection of honest and poetic stories and songs.
This means, there is a beautiful and intimate live experience in store when Bye Bye Brenda brings all their new songs to SPOT.

name: Marstein
description:
In recent years, Marstein has established himself as one of Norway’s most innovative and creative rap artists, achieving both commercial success and legendary rap tracks. Since his solo debut in the fall of 2022, the 22-year-old artist has already impressed both fans and critics with his diverse sound and energetic live performances. Before going solo, Marstein gained widespread success as part of the Norwegian rap group Undergrunn.
Most recently, Marstein collaborated with Danish artist Annika on the track ‘SAMMEN’, which became the most streamed song in both Norway and Denmark just days after its release.
With his ability to blend different genres and styles, Marstein has solidified his place in the Scandinavian music scene.

name: Mekdes
description:
Mekdes is one of the most exciting voices on the Danish music scene. With her unique vocals and ability to create deeply personal lyrics, she has established herself as an artist who masterfully combines emotions with soulful melodies.
She released her debut album ‘Greedy’ in 2022, reaffirming that she is a singer and songwriter beyond the ordinary. Mekdes' lyrics revolve around close relationships, supported by a powerful and intimate vocal presence.
Her latest single, ‘This Isn’t Cool’, is set for release in late January 2025, marking a new era for Mekdes as she continues to evolve both musically and personally.

name: Rakkerpak
description:
The two energetic and charming rappers exist in harmony with the band’s intense and dance friendly pop/rock, which is filled with epic and melancholic melodies, that bring out a stylish and poetic side of the rapper’s celebratory, fast paced verses.
A highlight of their journey is their award as Northern Jutland’s Best Live Band 2023 at Band Battle, Skråen, as well as SPOT Festival 2024 in Musikkens Bus, which became an intensely intimate ride, when the extremely long queue led to the band having to play 3 concerts in a row. Rakkerpak have recently released their second EP ‘Hooligan’.

name: USERS
description:
USERS is a rising post-punk band that has quickly taken the Danish underground by storm. With roots in social activism, their fight for a new society is channeled through noisy riffs, aggressive vocals, and thought-provoking lyrics. Their music is a "wake-up call" you can dance to, offering plenty of opportunities to experience hope amidst frustration at a high tempo. Despite the band's short lifespan, their uncompromising and explosive live shows have proven they fill a void in the Danish music scene.
Through their involvement in major political actions and a DIY approach to performing at intimate venues like Loppen, Den Anden Side, and Ideal Bar, USERS has successfully bridged the gap between old punk traditions and contemporary political issues.
2024 marked a new phase for USERS, and the quartet is currently hard at work finalizing their debut album, set to release in 2025. Even with only a few releases under their belt, the band has already set the tone for their activist and musical journey. It’s an ambitious project, featuring collaborations across genres and artistic expressions—clearly, this journey has only just begun.

name: B FROM E
description:
B FROM E is an established DJ on the Copenhagen scene and a growing international profile. Some have called him one of the friendliest DJs you can meet.
B FROM E is one of the most versatile artists in the electronic underground scene. Although he masters a wide range of genres, his deep passion for old-school rave music shines through everything he does. He has released music on renowned house labels such as Traxx Underground, Tartelet Records, Houseum, Happiness Therapy, and his own Buddahood.
Most recently, he has been showcasing his artistic and technical talent with releases on Physical Education and Haws. His music has reached audiences worldwide and is played by DJs such as Shanti Celeste, Job Jobse, Gerd, Mama Snake, Courtesy, Chris Stussy, Laurent Garnier, Anastasia Kristensen, James Zabiela, Chloé, and Jennifer Cardini.

name: giddy goye
description:
The live-acclaimed giddy goye creates expressive and danceable pop music that blends vulnerability with attitude. Imagine the combination of Gwen Stefani, Rina Sawayama, and the nostalgic 2000s vibe of the High School Musicalsoundtrack—there you have giddy goye! She’s the sassy girl in the schoolyard, side by side with her ladies, inviting you into the group with her honest and in-your-face lyrics.
Behind the stage name giddy goye is 24-year-old Birgitte Kolby Eriksen, who has established herself as a standout artist since her debut in 2022. With an impressive résumé that includes performances at festivals like Distortion, Uhørt Festival, Rudme Festival, and Eurosonic in the Netherlands, she has already gained recognition both nationally and internationally. giddy goye is undoubtedly an artist to keep an eye on.

name: Drongo
description:
Drongo sounds like the bastard child of a Norwegian Space Disco DJ and a Krautrock collective. Their no-bullshit improvisational approach to making music translates into playful, organic and strange tracks that blend techno aesthetics and live musicians, inspired by everything from Lindstrøm to Lightning Bolt to Charles Mingus.
They have gathered a somewhat cult-like reputation for their live shows, which are energetic workouts with no one in the audience standing still. Having released 3 albums since 2021, and with a fourth one on the way, Drongo is a collective set on establishing themselves as a force to be reckoned in the European alternative music scene. Since signing with Norwegian booking agency Polar Artist they’ve done extensive touring in Norway, as well as gigs in Sweden, Denmark and England.

name: Thea Dora
description:
With just a few songs released, Thea Dora has already cemented herself as one of the most exciting new artists on the Danish electropop scene, kicking off 2025 as part of VEGA’s Udvalgte. Soundvenue was highly enthusiastic when singer/producer Thea Dora released her debut EP ‘Enter’ in May 2024, even including it on their list of the year’s 20 best releases. A rather unique reception for an artist with only four songs out, but perhaps there's something to it—since then, things have taken off at an extraordinary pace for Thea Dora.
Thea Dora’s music invites you into a universe of pulsating, forward-driving productions topped with seriously catchy melodies that make you want to dance and sing along. Her follow-up single ‘Something About You’ is an atmospheric and deeply heartfelt dance track that captivates listeners with a hypnotic rhythm and lyrics exploring the intense emotions of attraction and desire. Released in September 2024, the single gained airplay on Australia’s national radio station Triple J, Radio Fritz in Germany, as well as P3 and P6 in Denmark.
Now, Thea Dora is riding this wave of momentum with the release of her new single ‘New Beginnings’, dropping on February 21st. The song was created in collaboration with producer Ronni Vindahl (Kendrick Lamar, MØ, Avicii, Minds of 99) and mixed by Geoff Swann, known for his work with international superstars like Charli XCX, Chappell Roan, and Billie Eilish.

name: DJ Melo
description: Despite her short time as a DJ, DJ Melo has quickly found her place behind the decks. She embraces the nuances of nightlife with a deep love for mixing different genres and rhythms, creating a fusion of sound with carefully selected tunes, including genres like hip-hop, R&B, trap, soul, and Afrobeats.

name: The Lazy Jesus
description:
The Lazy Jesus, a sound producer from Ukraine, presents his roots project UA TRIBAL in collaboration with visual artist Magistr Of Magic.In this project, the artist explores the richness of ethnic music, reinterpreting it in a fresh, modern form. The project blends percussion and Ukrainian folk elements, creating hypnotic dance tracks that transport listeners into a trance-like state. 
A key part of the UA TRIBAL show is its animated visuals, which allow the audience to fully immerse themselves in the experience. For the project, Kyiv-based illustrator Yevheniia Vinokurova (Magister Of Magic) created each visual pattern by hand, incorporating Ukrainian symbols and researching ornaments from various regions of the country. However, this is not just a pre-recorded video sequence running from start to finish—it is a live visual performance. Each pattern is processed in real time by Yevheniia using various effects, generating new graphic designs and ornaments throughout the show.
The UA TRIBAL audiovisual project was first presented in 2022 on the big screen at Dovzhenko Film Studio. Over the following years, it has been showcased at numerous European venues and festivals in Germany, France, Czech Republic, Belgium, Poland, UK, Spain, Slovakia.

name: Gavnlig
description: With her relentless energy, inquisitive personality and her playful approach to genre, since 2023 Gavnlig has been kicking the doors to the Copenhagen scene off their hinges. While fluent in garage, jungle and other sounds of the UK hardcore continuum, she effortlessly switches gears into timeless techno, oldschool g-house or classic acid - destination unknown, but with over 100 shows behind the decks the floor is in safe hands

name: Tripolism
description:
Emerging as one of Copenhagen's most captivating electronic acts, Tripolism has quickly carved out a niche in the scene with their unique blend of house, disco, and techno, characterized by their trademark vocals and eternal good vibes.
In 2023, Tripolism signed with dance powerhouse Ultra Records, and their unforgettable debut single, ‘Dope Dance’, became one of the scene’s biggest hits of the year – arguably the standout track.
Renowned BBC Radio 1 host Pete Tong named ‘Dope Dance’ the Essential New Tune in July 2023 and included it as one of his Top 5 Essential Tunes of 2023 in his Year In Dance show.
As they kicked off 2024, the Danish trio continued their thrilling journey. Their first release of the year, ‘Whatever We Call It’, featuring Meera, earned them another Essential New Tune on BBC in January. With the release of ‘Good Times’, the Danish trio officially bid for the summer anthem of 2024.
In June, their anticipated debut album, ‘Absolute Dope’, was released on Ultra Records. There's a lot more to come. Stay dope, and get ready for an unforgettable sonic voyage into the rugged realm of Tripolism.

name: Zuloo
description:
The 21-year-old rapper Zuloo has achieved remarkable success, first with his self-released single "Molly," which peaked at #19 on the Spotify chart, and then with the release of Fejlfri, which was streamed 70k times on its release day and entered at #25 on the Spotify chart.
Zuloo's sound is filled with direct and easily accessible references that speak directly to his young audience. Lines like "de ka’ alle li’ Johnson, kig forbi" and "helt nye Noctas kom ind clean fra Take Off ej hvor dejligt" give his songs an authentic and personal style that is easy to relate to.
Zuloo’s rapid growth on platforms like Spotify and social media has not only created hype among fans and influencers but has also cemented his position as one of the young talents with something to say in the Danish music industry. With support from both fans and peers, it seems that Zuloo is just beginning to show his potential. Now, Zuloo and his universe are ready to take over the real world.

name: DJ Lilli
description:
With over 2.5 million followers, DJ Lilli is a rising force in the music world. Known for her relentless work ethic and unique sonic identity, she is rapidly making her mark with viral remixes and original productions. As an international DJ and artist, she has created some of the most viral sounds on social media, frequently used and shared by global icons like Kylie Jenner, SZA, and more.
Beyond her own music, DJ Lilli has become a trusted figure in the industry, helping artists amplify their songs and drive viral success. Her expertise in curating and reshaping tracks has played a key role in the success of numerous songs, contributing to major campaigns for artists such as Rihanna, Coldplay, and Adele, and introducing her sound to a new generation of fans.
Lilli’s versatility behind the decks is unmatched. Seamlessly blending hip hop, drum & bass, baile funk, and more, her sets are an electrifying fusion of chart-topping hits and exclusive edits. She effortlessly curates an inclusive, high-energy atmosphere that keeps audiences engaged from start to finish. Beyond music, DJ Lilli has cemented herself as a force in the fashion world. With appearances at prestigious fashion weeks worldwide and collaborations with elite brands like Gucci, Mugler, and Hugo, she has become a recognized style icon. Her presence is now highly sought after at luxury fashion events across the globe.
2025 marks a major milestone in her career with the release of her highly anticipated debut EP, a project that showcases her artistic evolution. Adding to her accolades, she made history as the first Danish artist ever invited to perform on On The Radar in NYC. She is also a proud invited member of P3 Pulten at DR P3, further solidifying her influence in the industry. Remarkably, DJ Lilli has achieved all of this independently, building a massive global fanbase spanning the USA, Southeast Asia, Brazil, Germany, and the UK. With her unparalleled talent, relentless ambition, and genre-defying sound, DJ Lilli is well on her way to global domination.

name: Mica Lizio
description:
Mica Lizio writes songs about the cyclical everyday life - the small moments, the big emotions, and everything in between. Inspiration is drawn from friends, ex-lovers, family, and, most importantly, personal experiences. Behind the artist name is Caterina Wul Micalizio, who grew up in Sicily with roots in Korea - a combination of temperament, passion, and energy that has had to find its place in Denmark. But one thing is certain: Janteloven can take a break when Mica Lizio takes the stage.
With a boundary-pushing and loud presence, an energy that spreads, and a warmth that feels like a conversation with a friend, every concert becomes an experience you won’t forget.
So fasten your seatbelt, sit back - or even better; stand up, shout along, and be part of the show!

name: MONSUN
description: MONSUN is a Danish-language alternative pop duo where the boundaries between the organic and the electronic merge. With lyrics that capture the contrasts of youth — the fragile and the wild, the intimate and the unattainable — Bertel Carl and Anton Uhre create a universe that both draws in and challenges the listener. Their songs move through a landscape where words and sound stand side by side. The sonic expression is both raw and refined at the same time. MONSUN is an exploration of moods and shifting perspectives — a sound that listens back.

name: UHØRT Day Party
description:
UHØRT Day party is back at SPOT for the 6th time!
LINE UP AND TIME SCHEDULEKl. 12.00: Doors
Kl. 12.30: Astrid Schick(Pop-rock like Morissette og Lavigne. Also playing at 4.30 pm elsewhere)
Kl. 13.15: Dør i Dine Arme(Electronic Hyperpop, Drum’n’Bass, UK Garage og Punk)
Kl. 14.00: Kedde(Honest pop with an acoustic vibe. Also playing at 6.10 pm the day before)
Kl. 14.45: Von Quar(New ’hooligan’ rockmusik. Also booked for Roskilde)
Kl. 15.30: Lea Eyðbjørg(Honest folk-pop. Also booked for Roskilde)
Kl. 16.15: BÆNCH(Post-punk rockband. Also booked for Roskilde. Also playing at 7.30 pm elsewhere
 
Admission: Free for everyone w/wo wrist band.

name: 6 Years of Konkylie
description:
Six years ago, Konkylie appeared on the scene with artists like First Flush, Uden Ord, Jenny, and Afskum—challenging the way we think about record labels. But Konkylie has grown into
something far more than just a label. They’ve opened a bar in Copenhagen, recorded live
sessions in an abandoned greenhouse during the pandemic, collaborated with ARoS at Spot
Festival, and most recently launched the creative agency, Konkylie Studio. Through it all, they’ve remained deeply committed to music, culture, and art as a unifying force.
Now, as the label turns six, they’re marking the occasion with a film that blurs the lines between concert recording, music video, and art film. 6 Years of Konkylie brings together the label’s own artists, reimagining their tracks in a new space—6 interpretations, 6 pieces of music, 6 artists. Together, they form 6 Years of Konkylie.
The film features sessions with: Kayak, First Flush, Demersal, Yvonnes, Polite og Peter Pain.

name: We Do Music Day Party på Salling Rooftop
description:
We Do Music invites you to a Day Party on Salling Rooftop—kick off your SPOT Festival Saturday with music on top of Aarhus! Enjoy a stellar lineup under the open sky:
Marie Frank
You can’t say Marie Frank without thinking of big hits like “Symptom Of My Time” and “Under The Water”, numerous music awards, and that unmistakable voice. Now she’s back—with new songs about life, its tempo, being present, and being in motion. And about Stenslag—not just as a song title.
Renay
The sound and the voice are anything but typically Danish—soulful, funky, warm, and authentic, with deep roots in the very best of the international scene. But the man himself is firmly grounded in Jutland, his musical and Danish-African heart always beating for the big leagues “over there.” And luckily, Renay lives up to all of it.
Loud Tiger
She’s written songs for huge stars, toured the world, and spent 11 years in London and LA. Her voice and songwriting are top-tier, and yet, you might not know her—yet. But you will. Meet Viktoria Siff aka LOUD TIGER.
The Mukherjee Development
“Like Danish Coldplay—just better than the original,” GAFFA wrote in a five-star concert review. This indie, rock, and folk band invites both introspection and celebration in a world that moves too fast.
Jesper Lindell (SE)
Jesper Lindell blends soul, rock, and Americana with a voice full of longing and strength. After a promising football career ended due to injury at 13, he found his calling in music, inspired by legends like The Band and Van Morrison. A modern Nordic troubadour with an international sound and deep authenticity.
Schedule
13:00 – 13:20: Marie Frank13:40 – 14:00: Renay14:20 – 14:40: Loud Tiger15:00 – 15:20: The Mukherjee Development15:40 – 16:20: Jesper Lindell (SE)

name: Johanna Reine-Nilsen
description: Vocalist and songwriter Johanna Reine-Nilsen has made a name for herself with her remarkable musicality, voice, and expressive ability. As a student at the jazz program in Trondheim, Reine-Nilsen has already become a name associated with high quality, and her debut album ‘Blue Circle’ is no exception. With references to Joni Mitchell and Radka Toneff, the debut delivers singer-songwriter music of the highest caliber.

name: Bending Backwards
description:
Bending Backwards is a loud indie band from the Copenhagen/Århus underground scene. Both joyful and melancholy, all their songs are filled with memories and warmth. A wall of sound embraces the audience as an ecstatic ritual; the lyrics are about being kids, death, long-distance brotherly love and longing. Noisy and naïve; never hostile or sarcastic. The band is a bare bones trio formation: the tuneful Scott Walker-esque vocals of Frederik Vuust, backed by the loud, downtuned guitars of Halfdan Stefansson and lit up by the drumming of Johannes Jacobsen.
Bending Backwards will be releasing their debut album in December of 2025.

name: Bjerg/Miilmann
description: Bjerg/Miilmann is a new duo featuring Lærke Sofie Bjerg (vocals) and David Miilmann (guitar), delivering heartfelt songs inspired by life’s big and small moments. Founded in the spring of 2024, their dynamic interplay blends Lærke’s warm, engaging voice and David’s creative guitar play. Their music combines storytelling and artistry, crafting a timeless soundscape that feels both intimate and relatable.

name: Emil Bror
description:
Emil Bror is a glamorous indie rock artist who, with songs dressed in stardust, adorned with dusty distortion and glossy synth melodies, takes you on a journey through early adulthood. With electric energy and a radiant frontman, Emil Bror and his band, The Astronauts, demand the audience's attention when they perform live. You’ll be taken by the hand, launched into outer space, but also brought right back down to earth - and if you squint your eyes, they might just be mistaken for a star.
Emil Bror's songs are seen through lenses tinted by the choices one must make when standing face to face with the rest of their life. The knot in the chest, the fear of the future, and the question - who is really looking back when you see yourself in the mirror?
Emil Bror is in a constant and never-ending search for inspiration and the next great idea. He isn’t afraid to wear his biggest influences on his sleeve, and when you see him perform, there is no doubt that legendary artists like David Bowie, Harry Styles, and Prince have left a deep mark on him. His playful and explorative approach to fashion, makeup, and - most of all - music is a defining trait, as he continuously pushes new boundaries to see just how far he can go.

name: KROGEN
description:
For KROGEN, aka Lasse Krog, country music is all about energy, emotions, and creating something you can both tear up the dance floor to and cry your heart out to.
Country music has been KROGEN’s great love ever since he first listened to Waylon Jennings - the outlaw icon who turned Nashville and country music upside down in the ‘70s when he became one of the first country stars to muster the courage to break free from the genre’s rigid rules and conventions. And KROGEN shares that same urge to do things his own way.
The musical legacy of Waylon was evident on KROGEN’s 2022 debut album, ‘Henover Lakken’ - a festive, rebellious, and at times heartfelt tribute to everything that makes country music iconic. However, with his new songs, he is stepping into the genre’s more pop-oriented future - without forgetting its past.

name: Live Radio med Malte Sanggaard og Sean-Poul
description: Live radio with Malte Sanggaard and Sean-Poul is pure vibes.They chat casually about the music they’ve picked themselves – no stress.It’s all happening live, but it’s not radio in the traditional sense.You have to be there in person to experience it – no stream, no recording.It’s conversation, music, and presence in the moment.

name: SPRITTEDE
description:
SPRITTEDE is an energetic and captivating indie-pop group from the charming town of Middelfart. Since their debut, they have quickly made a name for themselves on the Danish music scene with their unique sound and intense live energy. With their infectious hooks and honest, melodic lyrics, they have already performed at some of Denmark’s most renowned venues and festivals, including Jelling Musikfestival and Posten in Odense. Their catchy hooks and deeply heartfelt pop songs make them a band you don’t want to miss.
SPRITTEDE was formed in 2020 as a response to the COVID-19 pandemic, when the band members found refuge in their shared passion for music. Led by frontman Jonas Rasmussen, alongside drummer Søren Ronge, guitarist Casper Jørgensen, and bassist Magnus Bo, the four members strive to spread and share SPRITTEDE’s three key components through their music and live performances: enthusiasm, joy, and unity.

name: Danefae
description:
Danefae is a band that divides opinions. With one foot in the Danish song tradition and the other in modern progressive rock, their sound is unlike almost anything else on the planet. As a result, the band has made its mark both on metal stages at home and abroad, as well as on tours at Danish open-air museums.
Live, Danefae is an explosive force - yet with small openings into something intimate and quiet - all performed with deep sincerity and total immersion.

name: Herkedal
description:
Herkedal is a 24-year-old Norwegian artist from the coastal town of Ørland, located out in the open sea along the Trøndelag coast. Herkedal's music can best be described as storytelling and intimate. His songs are delivered with a distinctive, powerful, yet also vulnerable voice. His musical universe draws inspiration from both traditional Norwegian music and incorporates rich string arrangements and electronic elements.
Over the past year, Herkedal has teamed up with Danish Tigerspring and Radiated Management and has signed a record deal with Warner Music Central Europe. He is now taking significant steps onto the international music scene.
In 2023, Herkedal released his EP ‘Wild Raspberries & Plum Trees’, which remains his first and only release to date. Additionally, in the fall of 2024, he embarked on a tour across Norway with his large ensemble, featuring strings, harp, and a full band, receiving great acclaim. With his incredible ensemble, Herkedal will be performing at SPOT Festival – a musical experience you won’t want to miss.

name: Stemmer i Voks
description:
Stemmer i Voks is a project created by core members of the folktronica ensemble Sorten Muld. The music is based on a collection of raw phonograph recordings from the Jutland heath, dating back to the early 1900s—crackling wax cylinders preserving the songs that still lived among the humble folk of the heath on the brink of a new era. Songs that, despite the hardships of the time, sing of humanity’s unyielding pursuit of happiness and love.
The voices from the wax cylinders blend with Ulla Bendixen in new twilight-dark compositions, featuring harmonium, mandolin, detuned piano, cello, double bass, and subtle electronics prominently in the soundscape. With great care, Stemmer i Voks extends a hand into the past, bringing the people and stories of the heath into our world—bridging time and generations.
"… A tree cannot continue to grow when it is severed from its roots …” – Evald Tang Kristensen

name: Aarhus Kammerorkester
description:
Aarhus Chamber Orchestra is a professional, medium-sized ensemble based in Aarhus, consisting almost exclusively of the city's leading musicians aged 18-40. The orchestra has played over 40 concerts throughout Denmark, premiered more than 20 works by living composers and played a number of Danish premieres of works written by international composers. Aarhus Chamber Orchestra's vision is to create friendly communities through classical music, and to be the city's ambassadors in spreading classical music to new audiences.
Frederik Zeuthen (b. 1996) is a Danish composer and teacher, currently studying at the soloist program in composition at the Royal Danish Academy of Music. Frederik Zeuthen has composed for a number of Danish and international ensembles and festivals and written music for several short films and documentaries. The concert will feature the work “Waldeinsamkeit”, which Aarhus Chamber Orchestra premiered in 2019.
Composer Mette Nielsen (b. 1985), educated in composition at the Royal Danish Academy of Music and the Royal Academy of Music, works with ensembles of all sizes, soloists, choirs and orchestras. The concert will feature the work “Song I used to sing to the machines”.
Composer, conductor and cultural entrepreneur Magnus Plejdrup (b. 1995) is the founder and artistic director of Aarhus Chamber Orchestra, for which he both composes and conducts. Since 2018, he has conducted more than 50 concerts with the chamber orchestra and a number of renowned soloists and has premiered major works by, among others, Britta Byström, Matthew Grouse, Louise Alenius and Niels Rønsholdt. The concert will feature the 3rd and 4th movements of Magnus Plejdrup's “Symphony No. 1”.

name: Palads
description: You will find Palads in the field between the fragile, frontier seeking and moving. Complex rhythmical patterns and radiant singable melodies creates a vulnerable space - something which is also found in the lyrics. Elements from multiple genres melt together in original compositions when Palads invites the audience to reflect, cry and dance. They ensure to cleanse the air and fill the room with open arms.

name: Sander Sanchez
description:
Sander Sanchez has roots in both Jutland and South Dakota (USA), with the latter contributing to his Native American heritage, which has had a significant influence on his musical expression.
As a Native American powwow dancer, Sander approaches music and dance from a more spiritual perspective, where heart and soul are essential ingredients.
A self-proclaimed color addict, Sander's aesthetic is highly light-bending, holographic, and expressive. Genre-wise, he is playful and effortlessly moves between dynamic pop, ’80s, soul, R&B, hip-hop blues, ambient, and EDM, blending them into an explosive and cohesive sound. He is also inspired by the emerging electronic subgenre Vapor Twitch.
Sander has performed on numerous Danish stages and at major events, including World Pride 2021 at KB-Hallen, Copenhagen Pride, supporting American drag star Adore Delano at DR’s Concert Hall, and Royal Arena for Dansk Melodi Grand Prix 2020, where he secured second place with the song ‘SCREENS’. He also performed at the Danish Rainbow Awards 2022 at Cirkusbygningen, where he was nominated for Artist of the Year.

name: Asger Thomsen
description:
The solo project of Asger Thomsen is an exploration of radical approaches to the double bass as an acoustic sound source. Improvising with use of objects and various extended techniques the music is inspired by noise and concrete sound.
He has released four solo bass albums, all of them focusing on different aspects of the raw unaccompanied sound making without the use of overdubbing or other electronic equipment.

name: GIMI
description:
GIMI is a Danish/Kosovo-Albanian artist, songwriter and producer - heavily inspired by MTV/pop culture of the early 00s and Albanian traditional music. Infused with humor and irony, GIMI has woven a lyrical tapestry of romance, sensuality and longing, serving as the cornerstone of his genre-defying pop universe. His music sparkles with opulent and whimsical electronic elements, engaging the listener in an exhilarating dance between provocation and warm embrace.
GIMI has Kosovo-Albanian parents, grew up in Padborg (small bordertown in South Denmark) moved to London as a young adult and now lives in Copenhagen. Many different places feel like home to him, and the journeys he has been on both personally and musically has led him to his upcoming debut album coming out summer 2025!
With support from BBC Introducing, heavy rotation on Swiss Radio 3Fach and write ups and premieres on German magazines KALTBLUT and C-Heads, GIMI’s music has generated buzz in the emerging European pop underground scene, resulting in him playing main stage at Copenhagen Pride 2023. 
Championed by 'The Line of Best Fit’ calling his music sultry and intense and featured on the renowned US pop culture magazine Paper Magazine’s list of ‘50 LGBTQ+ Musicians You Should Prioritise,’ GIMI has spent the last year performing all over Denmark and recently in Kosovo for Prishtina Queer Festival 2024, with his upbeat, unifying and energising performance. 
GIMI is set to release his debut album on June 6th 2025, marking a new era for GIMI and his pop universe.

name: JOVE
description: JOVE is the artist name of 20-year-old Northerner Julius Mygind, who creates piano-based alternative pop music. His music explores the struggle of interacting with others, and his greatest fear is ending up alone. JOVE's sound universe is inspired by FINNEAS' productions, among others. The young songwriter won the Talent Prize at the Band Battle at Skråen in Aalborg in 2023. In 2025, he is working in the studio on songs for his first release.

name: Shoom
description: Instrumental five-piece Shoom emerged at the beginning of 2022, debuting in the Dutch alternative music scene with an intimate living room concert. Since then, the band has opened for legendary groups Battles and Ice Age, performed at ESNS thrice, and toured the Netherlands. In a schizophrenic fever dream of subtle rhythms, loud swinging guitars, and poignant saxophone solos, Shoom showcases influences from all corners of music: from black midi to Charlie Parker and from MF DOOM to Talking Heads.

name: Simone Tang
description:
Simone Tang is perhaps best known as the guitarist for Ida Laurberg and the bassist for Ki!, but on her debut album ‘Things I Remember’, she stands on her own. In September, she received an honorary award for her songwriting at the Nashville Nights Festival in Odense – a fitting prelude to the release of the debut album that prompted American songwriting legend Jim Lauderdale to exclaim, “That was amazing!” after her performance at Tønder Festival this summer.
‘Things I Remember’, created in collaboration with producer Christian Ki, sounds like something from a bygone era, emanating from a vintage gramophone, where an acoustic guitar and a gripping vocal were all that was needed to captivate an audience. The album presents a minimalist, raw, and dusty aesthetic, with only guitar and vocals carrying the deeply personal stories.

name: Zinssou Quartet
description:
Zinssou Quartet is not afraid to push the boundaries of what a modern jazz quartet can be. With piano and cello at the forefront, the quartet blends elements of classical chamber music, traditional Nordic music, and contemporary, expressive New York jazz.
Zinssou Quartet’s debut EP ‘Et ungdomstestamente’ is a tribute to naivety, joy, and all the emotions that fill life when you're young. The young band approaches music with intuition and curiosity in their pursuit of an honest and vibrant expression. With a strong stage presence, Zinssou Quartet invites the listener into a sensitive and playful universe that resonates in both body and soul.

name: Aarhus Jazz Orchestra feat. Niels Rønsholdt og Henriette Sennenvaldt
description:
Experience a whole new side of big band music when Aarhus Jazz Orchestra presents ‘Excellent Place to Start’ at SPOT Festival 2025. Taking the stage as soloists and behind the composition of this brand-new piece are the renowned artists Niels Rønsholdt and Henriette Sennenvaldt, who have drawn inspiration from the wondrous literary universe of author Signe Gjessing.
Together with the orchestra, Sennenvaldt and Rønsholdt create an experimental soundscape and stage atmosphere that both builds upon and challenges the classic big band format as we know it from the golden age of the great crooners.

name: maia maia
description:
maia maia writes music for all the confused, sensitive souls in their late 20s and early 30s who still haven’t figured everything out. Those who find it hard to be an adult. The overthinkers. The dreamers. The ones whose minds never stop spinning. The ones who always feel like they’re either too little or too much.
Behind the alias maia maia is singer, songwriter, and producer Maja Barløse. She began her career by signing with Sony Music and later participated in Danish Melodi Grand Prix 2023. Beyond TV and radio, maia maia has lit up stages across the country, headlining at this year’s Copenhagen Pride on Rådhuspladsen, securing a spot at UHØRT Festival, and supporting acts like Go Go Berlin and Ericka Jane.
After a few years of full-speed momentum, the red-haired firebrand has spent more time in the studio and writing bubble. This has resulted in a handful of new Danish songs, straight from the heart and gut. On social media, maia maia has built a strong community of followers who eagerly tune in to her daily thoughts and musical journey - an authentic universe that seamlessly aligns with her new, more personal music.

name: Matching Outfits
description: Matching Outfits are a trio of adopted Berliners whose warped, wistful take on indie pop has been compared to “a Super 8 film from the family attic”. Singer Linnea Mårtensson's lyrics capture life’s major losses and minor inconveniences in gut-wrenching, occasionally hilarious detail, while dulcet harmonies morph into discordant freakouts and shout-along choruses. Their debut cassette ‘Band Made Out Of Sand’ caught the attention of cult radio station WFMU as well as New Jersey label Bar/None (Yo La Tengo, The Feelies), which signed the band and put out their Emperor X-produced breakup lament ‘No Whiskey’ in January 2025. The band does not wear matching outfits, except when they do.

name: shinyhunt
description: shinyhunt (Frederik and Signe) is a Copenhagen based indie-rock band. They released their sophomore album ‘sea-salt ice cream’ in November 2024. They write with big, amplified emotions about loneliness and companionship exploring how to find solace and comfort in both teenage feeling at the edge of youth with beautiful airy vocals and fuzzy guitar beds

name: SZIM
description:
Blending electronic and house-inspired pop, SZIM balances sharp, honest, and vulnerable lyrics with an effortless flow and musical confidence. She is a visionary artist who bridges the gap between party anthems and everything they come with - while also tapping into a universe where big, complex emotions are allowed to take center stage. Her latest release, ‘Årsag’, marked the beginning of a new chapter that reflects her growth both as an artist and as a person.
Since her debut in 2020, she has released several strong singles - including ‘Hos Mig’, ‘Dårlig til at svare’, and ‘Barbee’ - and performed countless shows, both under her own name and as support for prominent artists. With her unique sound and ability to balance the vulnerable with the energetic, SZIM continues to evolve, cementing herself as an artist who creates true presence - both in the studio and on stage.

name: KRYD
description:
KRYD consists of Anne Sofie, Signe, Maria, and Viktoria, who together sing and play Danish pop songs. The quartet champions anti-individualism, firmly believing that they are stronger together than apart. KRYD dreams of introducing Denmark to a new dynamic with four front figures, delivering catchy pop melodies wrapped in rich vocal harmonies that inspire others to collaborate and help each other shine.
On stage, KRYD’s setup is packed with harmonies, confidence, and attitude, with all four members contributing on vocals and instruments. Their musical inspirations include artists like Molly Sandén, Haim, and Shit & Chanel.

name: Søn
description:
Copenhagen-based Søn is made up of Kristoffer, Søren, William, Jonathan, and Carl-Erik. Since their 2019 debut album ‘Det Skandinaviske Design’, they have established themselves as a singular force with electrifying live performances, idiosyncratic compositions, and razor-sharp lyrics. Their second studio album, ‘Danish Crown’, released in 2020, earned critical acclaim and secured spots on multiple year-end lists.
On stage, Søn is agile, vibrant, and known for leaving audiences completely floored. With unshakable intensity, they seamlessly blend the intimate and fragile with the explosive and rocking, creating a live experience that feels both personal and unpredictable.
In 2023, the band released their third album, ‘Solstorm’, which was followed in 2024 by the EP ‘Solpletter’. The EP features a mix of new and acoustic songs, a collaboration with Angående Mig, and a re-recording of their most powerful live track to date, ‘Ægte Kærlighed’.

name: Veronika Rud
description:
Veronika Rud is a singer and composer from Aarhus who has made a name for herself with her debut EP 'Mens Jeg Venter', which has attracted a lot of attention on P8 Jazz.
She invites listeners into an atmospheric musical universe where inner life is shared with honesty and presence. With great love for musical traditions, filled with elements from the modern Nordic jazz scene, R&B and folk music, she paves the way for the music's very own agenda.
In a universe where the soft and energetic expression merges and through curious improvisations and playful rhythms, one is reminded of the traditional jazz scene while new musical connections emerge.
Veronika's music takes the listener on a journey, that will hopefully touch and connect people across different backgrounds and experiences!

name: Eir
description:
Eir merges folk music and pop, creating a hypnotic and danceable soundscape by blending electronic elements with lyrics passed down through generations.
With her debut album ‘Om jeg lar deg sove må du våkne’ (2023), she aims to prove that folk music can be just as popular as any other genre. And while the lyrics carry a melancholic tone, she will still make you dance!
“‘Med ulik avstand ser vi samme sol’ is one of the most captivating and sacred pop gems on this album – a song that fits just as well on a sunny beach as it does on a club floor." — Mode Steikjer (Dagsavisen, 6 out of 6 stars)
The front figure of Eir is also a recognized member of the award-winning band Ævestaden, bringing additional depth and experience to the project. Eir has already performed on stages such as Rockefeller, John Dee, Riksscenen, Big Dipper, Blå, Victoria, and Parkteatret. Furthermore, they had the honor of supporting the American artist Lissie, showcasing their ability to reach a broad audience and collaborate with diverse musical acts.
Eir takes listeners on an exciting musical journey where ancient traditions merge with modern electronic elements. With their unique sound and strong stage presence, there is no doubt that Eir has the potential to make an even greater impact on the music scene in the years to come.

name: Jessie Ka
description:
Jessie Ka, the North Jutland singer and songwriter, released her debut album 'Girls in Subtopia' last year in October. The album emerged in the wake of a difficult period in her life. Pernille Dige Weltz – Jessie Ka’s given name – had lived with stress symptoms for several years, and music became her salvation.
Thematically, 'Girls in Subtopia' is a concept album rooted in Jessie Ka’s upbringing and life as a young woman in small towns in "the dark heart of Jutland." All the songs are inspired by her own personal experiences. The album explores themes of identity, the nice girl complex, the struggle to be true to oneself, societal expectations of what a "real girl/woman" should be, and the courage to follow one’s heart. Throughout the album, you can hear the influence of Jessie Ka’s major inspirations, including MØ, Robyn, Lydmor, and Tove Lo.
However, the live stage is where Jessie Ka’s heart truly lies. In addition to headlining concerts and performing at various festivals, she has also supported artists such as Tessa, Lydmor, and Jacob Bellens.

name: Lise Ranks
description: Lise Ranks embodies many cultures. In each song, she steps into a world that reflects the nuances of these cultures. From African rhythms to Western modern beats, her music evokes a blend of Afro, pop, and R&B. She is a living proof that cultures can merge through music's universal and unconditional language, connecting us as humans. The listener is invited into a playful lyrical universe that holds both the deepest emotions as well as the small, yet valuable things in life. The lyrics focus on parties, love stories both good and bad, and the people she's met along her journey. She produces her own music simply because she can't help it.

name: Maja Kjær si Orkester
description:
Fiery instrumental folk composed by the multiple DMA Roots-nominated composer Maja Kjær. With a desire to challenge the delicate sound of “Nordic Folk,” Maja has created a boundary-breaking orchestra featuring cimbalom, tuba, percussion, and violin - where Nordic crispness meets Eastern European charm and heavy grooves.
On stage, Maja Kjær si Orkester puts community at the heart of their performances with their unique circle concerts. It’s an almost tactile musical experience for both audience and musicians, where the line between performer and listener is blurred; everyone is gathered together on the floor, creating an atmosphere of closeness that enhances the musical interplay. It’s raw, unfiltered - and utterly unforgettable!
This isn’t your typical “Nordic Folk” or “Balkan” sound. Instead, Maja Kjær si Orkester aims to turn expectations upside down. The piano is replaced by a cimbalom, the bass by a tuba, and the percussion blends primal earthiness with the delicate feel of winter mornings. The violins form the link to Scandinavian folk traditions, and together this oddball ensemble offers a glorious opportunity to dial up or down the Nordic and Eastern European vibes according to mood and moment.

name: Movement Shaped Like a Heart
description:
Movement Shaped Like a Heart is a record label and working collective. With a DIY spirit out of necessity, Movement Shaped Like a Heart releases music and arranges events to create a platform, promoting the new wave of alternative music coming from the Danish underground scenes.
Focusing on music is a connecting force, community building as a way of dealing with being a young person in tumultuous modern times. For this showcase Movement Shaped Like a Heart will present acts from their surrounding community.

name: Plum and I
description:
Plum and I combines jazz, electronica and strong songwriting into their own genre of music. When Plum and I enters the stage it’s with a strong presence, beautiful melodies and delicate improvisations - and a sound that stretches from the most intimate to the large concert hall. That’s why Plum and I appeals beyond the ordinary jazz audience.
Since their debut EP ‘For Me He Was A Passenger’ (2023) the band have played around most of Denmark, been in radio rotation on DR P8, and most recently they released their album Glowing/Gone in 2024.
With Glowing/Gone Plum and I takes the listener on the journey that starts in a grand concert hall and ends up in a nightclub in the middle of the night. The album opens with a contemporary jazz sound, recorded live as an orchestra in the studio, with trumpet, guitar, percussion and double bass. The song ‘All of The Time’, marks the transition to the electronic side of the album where the band brings the listener into a world consisting of big synth pads, minimalist drum machines, glitchy beats and singer/songwriter-esque melodies.
On Glowing/Gone Plum and I explores the acoustic versus the processed - the organic juxtaposed with the synthetic - the controllable with the uncontrollable.

name: Astrid Schick
description:
23-year-old Astrid Schick builds a generational bridge by bringing women back to the forefront of pop rock. With a flair for powerful choruses, she delivers bold, melodic songs reminiscent of 2000s icons like Alanis Morissette and Avril Lavigne which can be heard on her upcoming debut EP, set to release this spring.
Astrid Schick emerges from the music collective SheCanPlay, which in recent years has nurtured some of the most exciting female artists.

name: ULD
description:
ULD is a fresh Oslo-based trio consisting of Une on vocals, Lucia on piano, and Dagny on accordion. After spending three years together in high school, they began jamming at Toneheim Folk High School. And it’s safe to say - it worked out really well.
Since then, they have continued brewing and enjoying the process of making and playing music. Together, they write intimate and honest lyrics, complementing them with harmonies and melodies straight from the heart. In addition to writing their own lyrics, they are also inspired by Norwegian poets such as Jon Fosse and Gunvor Hofmo, aiming to breathe new, modern life into their powerful poetry.
This fusion gives their music a unique expression that is difficult to define in terms of genre, but they describe themselves as often drawn to a kind of indie-folk singer-songwriter format.

name: Michaela Turcerová
description:
With the project ‘IN FLUX’, Copenhagen-based Slovak saxophonist Michaela Turcerová, in collaboration with Simon Mariegaard, demonstrates a distinctive and unique musical language, where the sonic universe of the solitary acoustic saxophone is explored and expanded. Through experimental microphone setups, the saxophone’s hidden acoustic properties are amplified, unfolding into otherworldly and crystal-clear explorations of the instrument’s possibilities. From distorted, almost aggressive percussive sequences played on the valves to rustling noise, where amplified delicacy reveals hypnotic, subtle overtones.
The playful appeal of Michaela Turcerová's ‘IN FLUX’, which could easily work as sound design for a surrealist animated film, lies in its exposed physicality - of both the instruments and the performer. On her solo debut, the Denmark-based Slovakian musician digs through the inertia of the modulated saxophone, found objects and a variety of toys. Turcerová examines their percussive traits with childlike rudimentary eagerness. Moreover, there is an erratic sense of humor, which alters the release in unexpected ways.

name: Clovis
description:
Clovis, born Osée Clovis Nkezabahizi, is an artist with a remarkable story and a soundscape that captivates both emotions and the dance floor. With roots in Burundi and a childhood spent in a refugee camp in Malawi, he moved to Denmark at the age of 12 and discovered music as a way of expressing himself and connecting with the world around him.
Today, Clovis is an exciting new artist on the Danish music scene, known for his unique fusion of afrobeat, amapiano, and Danish lyrics.
Clovis' live performances are energetic, captivating, and unforgettable. He performs with a live band and professional dancers, creating a festive and authentic concert experience. With a mission to spread joy and inspire others, Clovis masterfully blends culture, rhythm, and storytelling in his music.

name: Ondskyld
description:
Ondskyld (a wordplay meaning both “I’m sorry” and “evil guilt”) is a colourful seven-piece from Copenhagen. Their music lies somewhere between DIY-punk and grandiose heartfelt pop-rock balladry in Danish.
From their punk roots you’ll find a deep love for community, high energy and doing things wrong. With intense, ornamented, poetic, hyper direct, soul- and sorrowful songs Ondskyld excuses for their insufficiency, though there’s nothing to be sorry about.
They blend life’s biggest emotions and boring detail from everyday life into a chunky smoothie of absurdity, humor and optimism. The band made their entrance on to the scene with a hand-full of heartbroken rock bangers, live-tracked on cassette tape, with their EP ’Hjertesorg Sommerrock 2024’ (Heartache Summer Rock 2024), displaying poetic snapshots from a shitty and lonely-ass summer. They’ve made a name for themselves with explosive live shows, a fair amount of airplay of the singles ’Kundeservice’ and ’Føle Ssomom’ and two full-length interviews in DEBUT on Danish radio station P6 BEAT.
Ondskyld are releasing their debut album ’Fuld Affekt’ in autumn 2025.

name: Xenia
description:
Xenia is a composer, producer and performer from Valencia. In 2021 she gave life to her dystopian first EP ‘ESFERA’ leading her to become part of the ecstatic Spanish dark band scene. 
In 2022 Xenia released her first album ‘RUIDO-0’, a dark pop LP, much more mature and accelerated which does not leave aside her underground roots and the enveloping sounds that characterize her music. 
Currently Xenia has released a new album ‘Cuando Las Sombras Se Alargan’ (when the shadows grow longer), in which we find electronica, reggaeton, urban, pop and drum’n’bass. Her concept takes us to the most dreamlike, talking about dreams and surreal moments, combined with the sensations and feelings that we live in our conscious life.

name: öð
description: öð merges an unique palette of sounds consisting of guitar, banjo, dobro, mandolin, and a string quartet. They blend elements of pop, folk, and jazz, inviting listeners on a journey through musical landscapes. By placing the audience at the center of an acoustic surround experience, they are quite literally embraced by the sound and enveloped in the magic of the music.

name: ØJESTEN
description: With a DIY approach, ØJESTEN shapes their sound through countless rehearsals in basement rooms and home studios. With a sound universe where the soft guitars of dream pop meet the raw nerve of post-punk, the band creates an atmosphere that both dreams and tingles. The lyrical universe revolves around everything we can't control: grief, decay, love, and wonder – a search for footing in something that is constantly changing. The band is organic and raw, like a mixtape sent from a lost friend.

name: Eezy
description:
Eezy has always dreamed of becoming a rapper and began his musical journey with the classic clichés of flashy cars and expensive chains. But after a few years away from music for deep personal reflection, he has reinvented himself and created the project Eezy. His music now reflects a more honest and authentic identity—a transformation that cements Eezy as an artist worth keeping an eye on.
Eezy’s sound stands out through a unique blend of powerful beats and personal lyrics, creating a deep and motivating experience for listeners. His music is both inspiring and moving, while maintaining a grounded, relatable tone—enhanced by rocky and soulful samples.
On his debut single, ‘Topfart’, you can feel the raw emotion and depth that now define his work. He has since followed up with releases like ‘SNAK/MILANO’, ‘Vi’ Op’, ‘Hustlers Ambition’, and most recently the Kundo collaboration ‘Corner’, which drew attention from outlets like Soundvenue, calling it his best single to date.
Eezy continues to deliver outstanding examples of what hip hop can sound like in 2025.

name: FooN
description:
FooN is a modern metal band delivering the soundtrack to the apocalypse. With massive walls of sound, grandiose choruses, and raw energy, FooN embodies everything you'd expect from a band riding the wave of baddiecore. It's colossal yet heartfelt as FooN invites listeners into their sonic doomsday landscape.
