On the live scene, FooN has toured extensively across Scandinavia and the UK, earning high praise from audiences and critics alike. Their shows have been described as capable of making any stage resonate like a stadium, with an energy built for the grandest arenas.
It’s no coincidence that the band has shared the stage with prominent live acts like Black Foxxes, Odd Palace, and Forever Still. In 2024, FooN signed with Last Mile Records and, in September of the same year, released the single ‘Bloodstream’ featuring Adam Rigozzi from UK band Lastelle. This marks the band’s first step into a new era, showcasing a heavier, darker, and more explosive sound.

name: Nausia
description:
Nausia has captivated and impressed audiences and critics alike with their doom-jazz sound that shifts between spiritual, hypnotic trance and wild, euphoric outbursts. The Copenhagen quintet, consisting of two saxophones, guitar, bass, and drums, defies genre boundaries. Their sound alternates between hypnotic repetition and intense, euphoric energy, drawing inspiration from alternative rock, spiritual jazz, and minimalism. 
This spring Nausia released their new album ‘Finding a Circle’ (Vasen, 2025), which the band describes as the culmination of five years of hard work on tours and releases. Created in close collaboration with producer Jacob Günther, the album reflects a strong musical camaraderie and a desire to find solace amidst the storm of turbulent youth, climate collapse, and dystopian futures. Expect a work that is spiritual, intense, jazzy, doomy, and cohesive - cementing Nausia as a profoundly original band in constant development and one of Denmark’s most compelling jazz-rock acts. 
When Nausia last played SPOT Festival in 2022, the legendary rock journalist David Fricke dryly  after the concert remarked, "It's hard to beat this one." Now, three years later, Nausia returns after releasing a brand new album and they are looking forward to blowing both the bowling hall and SPOT away.

name: Sound of the Damned
description: Sound of the Damned is a greenlandic death metal band who combines a twist of metalcore with the deep honest words of songwriter Pani Enequist. With their base in the world’s northernmost capital, Nuuk, Sound of The Damned has toured both Denmark and Greenland and has recently visited The Faroe Islands to record their highly-anticipated first album.

name: Stella Darla
description:
With an awareness of and love for country music’s tools, Stella Darla attempts to reinterpret a songwriting tradition. Her storytelling songs reflect both her upbringing in Vendsyssel and explore the complexities of friendships, sexuality, and the search for identity. With her playful approach to the Danish language, Stella Darla is unafraid to quote Medina and reference sexual abuse in the same song.
Behind Stella Darla is singer, songwriter, and producer Emilie Ohrt, who was previously part of the dreampop duo Audrey and has written music for and appeared in the film ‘Blåt Lys’. However, it is as Stella Darla that she has found her most personal stories as a songwriter. Stella Darla's debut album, ‘Miss Nordjylland’, was released in November 2024 through Playground Music.
On stage, she is accompanied by a band that, with its combination of acoustic guitar, synthesizers, and vocal harmonies, creates a space that accommodates both the acoustic and the ethereal. It’s like waking up in the middle of the night and turning on a film you’ve never seen before, but somehow, you feel like you know it.

name: Ida Wenøe
description:
Ida Wenøe has carved out her own unique musical space by blending international influences such as Nick Drake, Joni Mitchell, Bill Callahan, Bedouine, Leonard Cohen, Vashti Bunyan, and Beth Gibbons with her Danish roots. These roots stretch from traditional folk music and the Danish Højskolesangbog to composers like Carl Nielsen and Sebastian, all filtered through a clear inspiration from English folk.
Since the release of her debut album ‘Time of Ghosts’ in 2015, Wenøe has played hundreds of concerts across Europe and North America. Her music has been featured on outlets such as DR (Danish National Radio), BBC 6 Music and BBC Radio 4 in the UK, as well as KEXP and WXNA in the US.
Ida Wenøe is known for her dense and poetic storytelling, often drawing inspiration from nature. Her voice carries both raw emotion and strength, with threads linking back to the folk traditions of the ‘60s and ‘70s - yet always delivered with her own distinct touch. Her accompaniment is characterized by subtle yet insistent guitar work, complemented by violin, double bass, flutes, and soaring vocal harmonies.
Wenøe’s latest album ‘Undersea’ was released in 2023 to glowing international reviews and received airplay on BBC Radio and numerous independent stations around the world. The album has since been followed by concerts in Sweden and Denmark, and in autumn 2024, she will embark on a longer tour through England and Wales.
She has also released an EP and a mini-album as part of the creative collaboration ‘Whates & Wenøe’ with Samantha Whates. Their most recent release, ‘Loopy & Esther’, came out in November 2024 and received airplay in both the UK and the US.

name: Min Veninde Signe
description:
Min Veninde Signe writes intimate, Danish-language songs about the small moments of everyday life and the big things in life. Words are a major driving force behind the music, and Min Veninde Signe uses them elegantly, honestly, and with great relevance.
A Min Veninde Signe song is a safe space. It feels like a conversation between you and your close friend at home in the living room. You're sitting on the couch, drinking something warm, catching up — talking about morning routines, train rides, and relationships with friends, family, partners, flings, and yourselves. A Min Veninde Signe song makes you feel seen, understood, and a little less alone.
Rooted in the singer-songwriter tradition, she draws inspiration from a variety of genres, including pop, jazz, folk, and the Danish storytelling tradition. This combination creates a distinctive and clear style, radiating warmth, calm, and musicality. "A musical hug," someone once called it.

name: KUUNATIC
description:
KUUNATIC is a thrilling tribal / experimental / rock trio bolstered by diverse global sonics and powerful female vocals. Drawing on the members’ different musical and cultural perspectives, their music explores ritual drumming, pulsing bass lines, atmospheric keyboard sounds, and Japanese traditional instruments.
In 2021, they released their debut album “Gate of Klüna” on Glitterbeat Records, produced by Tim DeWit (Gang Gang Dance). The record garnered widespread acclaim for its mesmerizing soundworld that transcends genres and hemispheres, succeeding in being both boldly experimental and wildly catchy. They have performed across Europe, the UK, and Asia, including appearances at festivals such as WOMAD, Roskilde Festival, Le Guess Who?, and Levitation France, to name a few.
They are coming back with their new album “Wheels Of Ömon” in 2025. It places a stronger emphasis on their musical concept of sci-fi mythology with their stories set on fictional planets, and using more traditional Japanese instruments. The album will be released from Glitterbeat Records on 11 April 2025. KUUNATIC are Fumie Kikuchi on keys and vocals, Yuko Araki on drums and vocals, Shoko Yoshida on bass and vocals.

name: Schæfer
description:
With quirky and poetic songs, Schæfer invites you into a world of socially relevant stories—both dark and melancholic, yet bright and whimsical. The duo and close friends, Anna Skov Jensen (vocals) and Emil Mors Rasmussen (keyboards), craft vulnerable, intense, and humorous songs that point fingers at the world around them—and not least at themselves. Schæfer has already gained recognition for their sharp songwriting, earning the title of North Jutland Songwriter of the Year 2024 in Skråen’s music competition Band Battle.
Live, Schæfer takes the stage as a seven-piece orchestra, pulling their music in explosive directions.

name: Cursemaster feat. Legobygger123 og Granit
description: Cursemaster invites you into a cold and vibrating sound universe with his mastery of synthesis and electro-improvisation. Alongside him are Legobygger123 and Granit. Legobygger123 bridges the gap between dancehall and jungle with catchy hooks across a broad range of grime, dub, and digi-core. Granit delivers grand arrangements with electric roots in Hypergaze. What unites them all is their connection to Aalborg’s underground network, DATAHaven9000.

name: Filuka
description:
In a short time, Filuka has made her mark as a promising hip-hop name on the Danish scene. The rapper, singer, and producer is known for her sharp lyrical universe and captivating live performances. With roots in Copenhagen's underground, she has managed to break through the cracked asphalt.
With a unique sound, Filuka moves in a dynamic blend of energetic hip-hop and lightly spiced warm tones of soul and reggae. Backed by her live band, the music extends far beyond the stage, as audiences have experienced at venues like Vega, Den Grå Hal, and the Uhørt Festival.
Filuka is set to release a series of brand-new material, which will be presented on even more stages across the country in 2025. The first release was the single ‘Håndtegn’ from the upcoming album of the same title.

name: NYSTALGI
description:
NYSTALGI is a Danish-language folk-jazz quartet that, in addition to dynamic musical interplay, delivers lyrics and songs with depth and social relevance. NYSTALGI tells stories of loneliness and frustration in response to the climate crisis, war, and disconnected relationships in a fast-paced society. The songs search for hope and anchors in nature, supported musically by persistent, pulsating rhythms and warm, dreamy tones. With this, NYSTALGI aims to give the audience a strong sense of togetherness and a space to share these emotions.
NYSTALGI consists of songwriter, pianist, and vocalist Naja Holst Nymand, guitarist Jacob Kaaberbøl, bassist Sarah Pehn Engholm, and drummer Thomas Pilkington.

name: SORTHANDSK
description:
The Aarhus-based trio SORTHANDSK has spent the past few years completing two interconnected EPs, set for release in the fall of 2024 and the spring of 2025.
SORTHANDSK offers something unique to Danish music and lyricism in a time when the political climate is particularly volatile. Lyrics, music, and storytelling should serve as an outlet for frustration and anger while also providing authentic insight into the life circumstances of minorities. In this way, the lyrics take on a constructive role for both sender and receiver. Marwan and the rest of SORTHANDSK have consciously chosen to channel all their emotions into works that can spark debate and show future generations that there are alternatives to burning the system down.
A pact has been made between SORTHANDSK and their audience - to unite around what truly matters. This becomes evident once the layers of frustration and anger settle, leaving hope still resonating in Marwan’s voice. The authenticity is striking in its expression. It is the language of the streets and the underground, but it is also deeply human - the human experience, with all its flaws and shortcomings, yet with an unrelenting urge to do better than before. The lyrics are both ruthless and heartfelt. They leave no one untouched by the relentless energy and will for change that drive them.
SORTHANDSK may hit hard, but they also have the power to elevate listeners to new realizations and into a warm community where even the most difficult emotional struggles are embraced.

name: Stine Klingsten
description:
Stine Klingsten has made a striking entrance onto the Danish music scene with an expression that is at once uncompromising, bold, and fragile. Her acclaimed debut album Dage was released in 2022, and in the summer of 2024, she dropped the single ‘Hvis Jeg Ku’ ft. NØX – a song that proves Stine is just as confident exploring electronic pop as she is rooted in folk and country. The single was named "Hit of the Week" on DR P4 and shot straight onto the biggest Danish playlists!
On October 18th, 2024, she released her latest single, ‘SØLLE HJERTE’, which also made an instant impact on the top playlists. Both in her recordings and on stage, Stine Klingsten captivates with her enchanting presence, infectious energy, and a unique groundedness that has made her a fan favorite since 2020.

name: Carlina de Place
description:
Carlina de Place is a fresh, young voice from the Nordics, offering a captivating blend of organic singer-songwriter vibes and R&B that is sure to capture hearts and minds alike. Determined to follow her own path, she has chosen to release all her music independently.
Despite having only three songs in her catalog, Carlina de Place has already made a significant impact—not just on the Danish music scene but among listeners worldwide. With strong backing, she has landed on some of the world’s largest playlists and made her live debut last year at an exclusive Spotify showcase during BY:LARM in Oslo. Her debut single, ‘Pieces’, is nearing half a million streams on Spotify, while her second single, ‘Reminded’, earned her a spot on Soundvenue’s list of the year’s best Danish songs. Most recently, Danish Radio station P3 named her one of the four artists to watch in 2025.
Carlina’s songwriting process often begins in the late hours in her home studio on Nørrebro, crafting songs that tell stories of the trials and triumphs of youth, with a wisdom that belies her age. She has a close musical partnership with LA-based Danish producer Morten 'Rissi' Ristorp, known for his work with prominent artists and his recent Grammy win for Beyoncé’s ‘Cuff It’. Together, Carlina and Rissi elevate her bedroom demos to new heights, offering the world an even clearer glimpse of her remarkable talent.

name: Honey
description:
Honey – a New Aarhus Indie Band is Born at SPOT
At this year’s SPOT Festival, a new name emerges on the Danish music scene. Honey is a collaboration between prominent Aarhus-based musicians, united by a shared musical language rooted in Danish lyrics and an acoustic, organic soundscape. With influences from both the Nordic folk tradition and modern indie rock, Honey invites the listener into an honest and intimate space. The band makes their debut at SPOT with a sound that feels both familiar and fresh, and with stories that demand to be heard.

name: Ahead
description:
The jazz-hip hop collective Ahead is ready to deliver an energetic and explosive show at SPOT Festival 2025.
Featuring five rappers - plus some extras - drums, bass, keys, and turntables, Ahead is bringing a massive hip hop party where you won’t be able to resist getting swept away by the music as we celebrate the three B’s of hip hop culture: beats, bangers, and bars!
Drawing inspiration from various hip hop traditions, including Detroit, New York, and L.A., Ahead functions as a living, progressive beat machine full of drops and impressive details that unite generations with hands in the air! In short, Ahead has developed a show format that hits you in the best way possible and makes the whole room tremble with energy.
Ahead reflects the ever-evolving culture of collaboration that hip hop is built on. As a collective, they put together unique shows tailored to each venue and festival. Their lineup of featured artists includes some of the biggest names in hip hop, and the band has collaborated with over 30 artists over time, including Per Vers, Mund De Carlo, Tanajah (USA), Particle Man, Nøx, Jaden Castro (USA), Pede B, and many more. Every time they take the stage, it’s with a dynamic and unforgettable performance that excites the band, the rappers, and the audience alike—bringing a whole new level of live hip hop to the table.
At SPOT 2025, you'll get the chance to experience Ahead with both familiar and brand-new features - bringing the wildest jazz and hip hop energy, the sharpest rappers, and a show that simply refuses to stand still. It’s an experience you won’t want to miss—so make sure to stop by and give it a Spot!

name: Flach | Østerby
description:
Step into a world where tones, harmonies, and overtones merge into delicate instrumental stories. With the instruments accordion, nyckelharpa, and hardingfele, Anna Østerby and Henriette Flach invite you into their Nordic soundscape of original music.
The duo’s latest release is the album ‘Ude af mine hænder’ - an album that, through intimate interplay, takes the listener down streets of joy, longing, hope, heaviness, lightness, night skies, and sunbeams. Woven into a shared narrative, it speaks to everything that swirls around us and shapes the lives we live. Everything that is - out of our hands.

name: 100%WET
description: 100%WET is a collaboration between Casper Munns and Jakob Birch. Their music is a unique blend of breakbeat, drum’n’bass, and acid house, mixed with grunge and shoegaze songwriting. A genre they define themselves as Drum'n'Gaze. 100%WET invites the listener directly into the musical engine room, where the art can be reinterpreted and twisted, and where the musical details are in absolute focus.

name: Healthy Choices
description:
Floating around in the post-punk pool, you'll find Healthy Choices. Hailing from Trondheim, Norway, and inspired by bands like Pissed Jeans, Viagra Boys and Single Mothers. The lyrical themes lean towards the more serious side of life, with a touch of childishness to lighten the mood.
Healthy Choices consists of members from Norwegian bands like Bakrus and This Daze. The debut album, mixed by Magnus Lindberg (Cult of Luna), is set for release in the summer of 2025. Five singles and a music video have been released so far, and they have been listed on Norwegian radio program NRK P3 Urørt. In January they performed at the Norwegian showcase festival Trondheim Calling to great reviews.

name: Ida Duelund
description:
Who is Sibo? One might ask when looking at the clownlike 3D rendered face on the front cover of the new LP from composer, bassist and vocalist Ida Duelund. 
Sibo is a celebration of poetry and fantasy. A gentle dadaistic work where Duelund moves effortlessly, almost ruthlessly through musical history and genres as if mixing a bag of fantastical lollies. She reminisces both the jazz standards from Broadway, the choral works of Hildegard von Bingens middleages, impressionistic classical composition and modern improvisation. Playfully and carefree.
For SPOT Festival, Duelund has gathered a sextet of remarkable musicians from very different corners of the Danish jazz- and experimental music scene. Together they will interpret Sibo in a musical collage where improvisations weave in and out between Duelund’s surrealistic songs and childlike compositions. 
As musician and composer, Duelund is an integral part of the Copenhagen music scene and wanders freely between experimental music, pop- and rock, and the established jazz and improvised music scenes. She has in recent years collaborated with artists like Marilyn Mazur, Jada, Baby In Vain, Hess is More, Pia Raug, Barbro, Astrid Engberg, Kresten Osgood, just to name a few, and she is co-founder of the experimental string duo Lueenas. Recipient of the Tivoli Jazz Price in 2023 for her work as a musician.

name: Alba Akvama
description: Alba Akvama (b.1999) is an emerging songwriter and composer based in Copenhagen, Denmark. A recent graduate of Copenhagen's Rhythmic Music Conservatory, she is now debuting with her first collection of intimate and introspective songs. The music blends orchestral midi with open-tuned guitars and jazz-minded chords, drawing the listener into a minimal and loopy universe that feels all together conceptual, eclectic and sincere. The work explores being stuck in time, relationships and unresolved feelings, and the songs could be described as like a single stream of thought, with no emotional resolution, beginning or end. Alba’s first release is set to come this year, however most recently she’s been featured on the record of the artist GB, “Gusse Music’” (Posh Isolation, 2024), where she’s done backing vocals on a number of songs.

name: Elliot
description:
Elliot is the sound of late-night hours and bittersweet dreams of dusty ’70s glamour. The 22-year-old singer and songwriter crafts songs rooted in indie rock, featuring poetic and daydream-like lyrics about life as a young man.
Behind the artist name Elliot is Carl-Emil Lohmann. His career began in childhood when he played major roles on Danish theater stages. In recent years, he has focused primarily on his career as a singer and songwriter, and in the fall of 2024, he released the EP ‘Affogato’.
The sound he has developed is far removed from mainstream pop, residing in a condensed universe of melancholic moods, raw guitars, and an atypical, timeless love for analog recording and live-played instruments.
Elliot’s narrative explores a young life filled with inner and outer pressures. Embracing the darkness that accompanies him, his music tells an honest story of rebelling against the world’s expectations and daring to stand as his true self. The new songs are entirely Elliot’s own, and much more music is on the way in 2025.

name: LAY
description:
When the wind blows east, LAY moves west. His debut EP ‘M.D.M.A’ (Mange Døjer Med Angst, 2023) added a new layer to urban music as we know it. The EP has already left its mark on the harsh environments of youth, disarming them and instead finding comfort in the moon rather than weapons when the world shows its merciless side. With the song ‘Run Away’, LAY captivated listeners with his melodies and flows over the heart-pounding R&B beat.
Since his debut EP, he has grown stronger in his belief that his path in music should be self-sustaining rather than tied to major label deals. As a result, Problembarn Records is now the partially self-owned label through which LAY releases his music. In 2024, he played his first headlining concerts with a full band, including a sold-out show at Huset and a performance at Forbrændingen. In the fall, he was part of the support lineup for USSEL’s entire tour—could this exciting connection spark a chemical reaction? LAY’s well-thought-out moves have drawn attention and raised the bar for what to expect from his future shows and releases.

name: Naked
description:
Feat. DAYYANI, Dusin, UNG-SKAB, and Julius Amdisen (Kind mod Kind)
Once again, SPOT opens the doors to the intimate concert space, NAKED, where well-known singers redefine their material right before the audience's eyes.
One by one, the singers take the stage alone, accompanied only by Swedish multi-instrumentalist Gustaf Ljunggren on piano. Unique concert experiences are guaranteed as familiar songs take on a new expression.
This year, NAKED presents three solo artists and a duo, each of whom has made their mark on the current musical landscape in their own way.
With a musical depth rarely seen in mainstream pop, DAYYANI delivers everything from high-energy Y2K-style pop bangers to more emotional and reflective sides of herself.
As the frontman of Kind mod Kind, Julius Amdisen’s heartfelt falsetto glides over dark electronic productions that are both danceable and introspective—complemented by lyrics that evoke the feeling of reminiscing about memories you haven’t yet made.
On stage, Dusin consistently blurs the line between audience and artist, creating an intense and immersive space where emotions unfold collectively. Their impressive catalog spans multiple corners of the musical spectrum.
UNG-SKAB serves as a mirror to a generation of young people who wear their emotions on their sleeves, with an honest tear on their cheek. Over Eigil Bjørn’s productions—stubbornly exploring the borderland between R&B, pop, and trap—Clara Rose’s floating arrangements dissolve the listener into the world of UNG-SKAB.

name: Orbits
description:
Orbits, the band redefining modern jazz, has quickly captured the attention of music lovers and critics alike. Made up of vocalist Natalie, composer and producer Erlend, and multi-instrumentalist Lars, the trio has delivered unforgettable performances and releases, blending jazz, soul, and experimental sounds in unique ways. Their recent EP ‘Bad Mantras’ received glowing reviews, with Clash Magazine praising the band for their ability to combine sound, emotion, and art.
Their debut album, ‘Blood Red Sky’, set to be released in May, combines R&B with influences of jazz fusion, alternative pop, and electronic music, drawing comparisons to legendary acts like Fleetwood Mac, Arthur Verocai, and Thundercat. With perfect soundscapes and intricate melodies, Orbits creates a musical experience that's both groundbreaking and accessible.
Formed by long-time friends Lars and Erlend, and the powerhouse vocalist Natalie, Orbits has become a dynamic force in the music world. Their debut album is set to make waves and solidify their place in modern jazz’s evolution.

name: VAKT
description: VAKT is Anton True Klüver, Balthasar Vilhelm Asmussen, Christian Haldrup Jensen, and Solvig Tora Ringhof. Their strong friendship forms the basis for their curious and collectivist approach to music. The unique interplay results in a virtuosic and cohesive experience – live as well as on record. With their live format, they aim to create an immersive space where the grand merges with the intimate. With the lyrics in focus, lead singer Solvig steps forward with her charismatic energy, with a story of sorrow, anger, longing, and love.

name: VELA
description:
When you step into VELA’s universe, you encounter a reflection of what lies beneath the surface - something immediate yet hidden. VELA is an alternative pop project with an electronically pulsating heart, where relationships and a sense of belonging form the core of the music.
Behind VELA is singer and songwriter Mathilde Rosengren, whose captivating vocals guide you into the tension between power and fragility. Through honest lyrics, she explores feelings of being alone without feeling lonely, the experience of change, and the beauty of daring to be vulnerable with another person.

name: Karoline Funder
description:
Danish singer-songwriter Karoline Funder moves within an organic, guitar-driven sonic universe inspired by the American indie folk scene. The themes in Funder’s music are deeply rooted in emotional and relational turbulence, and her reflective and honest songwriting captures the intense complexity of close relationships. She sings about the unspoken things that trouble and scare us—how we connect to and become dependent on one another. As music magazine GAFFA put it: "Few Danish artists can weave the anxiety of difficult relationships into such delicate sonic patterns as Karoline Funder."
When Karoline Funder released her debut single, ‘Vores Forhandling’, in March 2024, it was met with overwhelming praise. With just two singles out, she made her live debut at the festival Syd For Solen in the summer of 2024 and in the fall, she followed up with her third single, ‘Jeg Hader At Jeg Tænkte At Du Lignede En Engel’, a precursor to her upcoming EP set for release in early 2025. Funder has also been selected as one of six artists for VEGA's Udvalgte 2025, marking her as a standout talent to watch.

name: BITOI
description:
Following rave reviews of their debut performance at the Intonal Festival, BITOI (Bass Is The Original Instrument) is steadily capturing the curiosity of audiences across the globe.
The project leans on tradition while exploring the outskirts of the human capabilities of musicians and composers. They merge the timeless instrument of the voice with the relatively new electric bass. BITOI’s lyrics are based on phonetic pronunciations of bird sounds. Bird whistles, vocal cord drumming, and wind sounds are interwoven into BITOI’s rich soundscape.
The band crafts a transformative experience at their performances, guiding the audience on a captivating musical voyage. This fosters a collective emotional bond between all attendees and the band. Their emotional connection comes to life through their songs, resonating with the audience and creating a shared emotional experience among everyone present. 
In 2024, the group was fortunate to embark on several European tours, participating in esteemed events such as the Roskilde Festival, Clandestino, Copenhagen Jazz, and Pasaggi Sonori, among others. Additionally, they took a significant step by traveling to Japan for their first tour there, which included a collaboration with Okinawan musician Aragaki Mutsumi.
BITOI has just recorded their debut album an album set to be released in spring 2025.

name: BÆNCH
description:
The live-acclaimed BÆNCH is a young Danish post-punk/rock band exploring an atmospheric and dynamic rock sound with international potential. Dark guitar elements, expressive synth layers, and a melodic, yearning vocal create a grand, unpolished, and authentic sound that fills a unique gap in the Danish music scene.
Following a nationwide tour and the release of their debut single ‘Skipped a Step’—which gained regular rotation on P6 Beat, Amazing Radio in New York and London, as well as airplay on BBC1—the rising rock quartet has expanded their discography with another single. The brand-new track, ‘Fall Behind’, showcases a different side of the band's musical universe. Serving as both a lyrical and sonic contrast to their earlier releases, ‘Fall Behind’ is introspective, reflective, and unpredictable. It carries a quiet frustration that unexpectedly erupts into a desperate, all-consuming force. The song pushes the boundaries of the rock genre in terms of dynamics and conventions, weaving in influences from shoegaze, grunge, and alt-pop, once again cementing BÆNCH as an innovative and powerful name on both the Danish and international rock scenes.

name: Carl Knast
description:
Carl Knast is a charismatic wordsmith. His original punchlines, sharp observations, and unique take on serious topics - combined with tight and offbeat beats - form the rapper’s distinctive and highly addictive sound. When Carl takes the stage, he does so with such convincing presence and intense energy that the audience can only surrender to the experience.
His catalog includes numerous single releases and the EP OPUS from 2020. He has released powerful singles such as ‘Stank,’ ‘Hjem Uden Klaver,’ ‘Glad Idiot,’ and ‘Træmand,’ and most recently, ‘Vennesangen’ with Andreas Odbjerg. In February of this year, he released his new album ‘CROWDPLEASER’.

name: Kindsight
description: Kindsight is a Danish band that plays indie rock with catchy melodies and noisy walls of guitar . After performing concerts in Denmark, Sweden, England, and Germany, as well as at festivals such as SPOT, Roskilde, and SXSW, the band released their second album ‘No Shame No Fame’ last year to great reviews from both Gaffa and KEXP. Since then, the band has been working to further develop their musical universe into a space that encompasses both sparkling pop gems alongside kraut-inspired passages that invite transcendence.

name: Merry
description:
Behind Merry is songwriter and performer Caroline Frandsen, who describes her music as dark-pop/sweet-rock. With a captivating performance and theatrical songwriting, Merry explores the subtle sparks that arise between you and me.
Merry’s lyrical universe is vast—ranging from themes of addiction, death, and heartbreak to corporeality, self-love, and crushes. These themes are explored on her critically acclaimed debut EP, ‘Easing into Healthy’.
Live, Merry is an unpredictable and unforgettable experience. With her expressive, contrast-filled songs, she has already made a name for herself on both the Danish and international live scene, delivering remarkable performances at Viva Sounds Gothenburg, Hotel Cecil, and as a supporting act for Brimheim on her autumn 2024 tour. With a voice that shifts from silky smooth to heartbreakingly powerful and a presence that both captivates and liberates, Merry draws her audience into her world—leaving them shaken, yet whole.

name: ex.girls
description:
ex.girls started out as the solo project of Guðlaugur Hörðdal in 2011 but soon became a platform for him and his friends to make music. Gylfi Sigurðsson and Tatjana Dís Aldísar joined the project in 2017, and the trio has since then become a prominent fixture in the Icelandic music scene, known for their unique sound and ambitious live performances.
In 2020, the group caught the attention of techno giant Bjarki with their then-unreleased track ‘Halda áfram,’ later released on his label bbbbb records. Two years later, the same track was awarded Electronic Track of the Year at the Icelandic Music Awards.
Genre-bending and nihilistic, the trio is constantly exploring new paths, making their music exciting and unpredictable — or, as it was once described, “entirely their own.”

name: Blush
description:
Blush is the musical duo consisting of Lola Hammerich and Jonathan Holst Bruus, known from Baby in Vain and Flawless Victory. Their music is an intense blend of melancholy and hope, where personal experiences such as heartbreak are transformed into experimental soundscapes.
With a musical style that ranges from raw energy to tenderness, Blush creates an atmosphere of vulnerability and playfulness. Their collaboration with producer Frederik Valentin adds unique elements like crooning harmonica and minor-key glockenspiel, giving their sound depth.
Blush is a natural extension of the friendship between Hammerich and Bruus, where their shared musical journey has both served as a therapeutic way to process heartache and as a space for escapism and experimentation. The friendship evolved into an artistic partnership, where vulnerability and play merge in the music, which can now be experienced on live stages this year. They have already created music with a particularly ambivalent and insane (in the original sense of the word) mood, providing a taste of what we can expect from Blush.

name: Lea Kampmann
description:
With her album ‘Seinferð’, produced by Teitur, Lea Kampmann invites the listener into a musical space that feels like sitting inside an acoustic guitar. Lea’s performances are known for creating an intimate atmosphere where the audience is welcomed into a space of calm and reflection. She’s not just a singer - she’s a storyteller.
Lea is a Faroese singer-songwriter, celebrated for her ability to captivate listeners with her soulful vocals and poignant lyrics. In 2024, she toured Denmark with Lucky Lo, and in 2022, she toured with Katinka Band.
In 2021, she won the Faroese Music Award for Song of the Year with ‘Kanska’, and in 2018 she was nominated for four awards, taking home the prize for Artist of the Year.
A multi-instrumentalist, Lea sings and plays both guitar and violin on stage. Joining her live are Sara Flindt (keys), Aske Frydenlund-Vad (acoustic guitar), and Lukas Loeb (double bass and saxophone). This live constellation forms the backbone of concerts that shift between whispering and explosive moments, sing-alongs, tapping guitar solos, saxophone, and violin passages. A concert experience that celebrates sensitivity, connection, and the power of music.

name: Søn af en Gud
description: Surging synth chords, energetic house beats, and atmospheric angelic choirs — this forms the backdrop for Søn af en Gud’s raw and honest lyrics, which constantly balance sublimely between the beauty and the ugliness in relationships. His songs are rich in imagery, his lyrics are deep and existential, and he possesses a voice capable of conveying the complex emotions he sings about. Søn af en Gud tells it like it is, offering the listener an honest, vulnerable, and inclusive space to take part in - a space that encourages reflection on one's relationship with oneself, others, and the stories that come with it.

name: Øyunn
description:
Drummer, singer, and rapper Øyunn leaves a lasting impression on her audience with her dynamic grooves, expressive vocals, and personal lyrics about relationships, hope, inner unrest, belonging, and identity.
In November 2023, she released her debut concept album ‘Aspects’ on the Danish label Midnight Confessions. Recorded live at the Munch Museum in Oslo, it was originally a multidisciplinary work combining film, performance, and concert. Since then, Øyunn has been honored with Tivoli's Jazz Award as ‘Breakthrough Artist of the Year’ and she also won the ‘New Jazz Artist of the Year 2024’ award at the Danish Music Awards.
Øyunn has performed and collaborated with artists such as Nils Frahm, Efterklang, and Guldimund, and has composed music for productions at the Royal Danish Theatre, as well as the National Theatre and Dansens Hus in Norway. As a solo artist, she brings this diverse background into her music with authenticity, catchy hooks, and experimental transitions. Her music is engaging and relatable, marked by an open and distinctive sound performed with exceptional musical prowess.
When Øyunn performs live she is joined by a band that includes bass, synth, backing vocals, and live processing. Her performance is dynamic, blending hard-hitting intensity with raw vulnerability, introspection with power, delivered in an unfiltered and captivating experience.

name: Søren Karim
description:
Søren Karim, known from Bogfinkevej, released his first solo project ‘Romeo <3 Julie’ in November 2024. Since then, he has dropped singles like ‘312’ and ‘FLOD’—songs that can best be described as dramatic and honest hip hop about big emotions. About beauty and infatuation. About happiness, jealousy, longing, and everything love brings with it.
At SPOT 2025, the artist will make his live debut, taking the stage with a top-notch band ready to perform meticulously crafted, high-quality hip hop in a perfect balance between accessibility and poetry.

name: KNKL
description: Aarhus rapper Knokkelmanden takes on SPOT 2025 under his drill alter ego KNKL. Since 2012, he has led the Palmehaven crew with producer FuckBoyData. ‘Pluk Dem’ showcases KNKL's ice-cold, minimalist approach to Danish drill - straight up, no bullshit.

name: Anakin Justin
description: The 2024 Urørt Winner, Anakin Justin, is widely regarded as the most exciting name to emerge from Trondheim’s rap scene in recent years. As both a songwriter and producer, the 20-year-old makes the impossible possible—he makes the Trønder dialect sound sexy. With multiple P3 listings, collaborations with artists like Tyr, and a wave of positive reviews, Anakin has quickly established himself as a remarkable and unique figure in Norway’s hip-hop landscape.

name: Frankly My Dear
description:
Frankly My Dear is one of the world’s first 100% artist-driven sync platforms and composer networks, founded by Steffen Breum and Thomas Bertelsen – both experienced composers and producers with deep roots in both the music and film industries.
Frankly (My Dear) reimagines how music is used in film, TV, and advertising. With a focus on originality and artistic authenticity, the platform provides global exposure to music that dares to stand out – with a special place for unconventional and underrepresented voices.
The platform represents a strong network of over 200 artists: from established film composers, in-your-face pop artists and indie bands to hip-hop labels, queers, and punk activists – all with edge, intensity, and something real to say.
Thomas Bertelsen, DJ, is known as one half of the electronica duo Lulu Rouge and for his solo project Tom And His Computer. For years, he’s moved seamlessly between club culture and music for the screen.
Steffen Breum is a renowned music producer and film composer who, for more than 25 years, has made a significant mark on both the Danish music and film industries. With his broad experience, he is a key figure actively shaping the Danish cultural scene through innovative projects, concert events, and artistic collaborations.
At SPOT, they’ll share their passion for music through a sharply curated, eclectic DJ set featuring their own edits and versions of cult classics and hidden gems.

name: Mille
description:
Daydreams, diaries, and the Danish language—three elements that have been part of Mille's life for as long as she can remember. At just 15 years old, she decided to take her daydreams seriously, moving away from home to chase her dream of a music career. With her big dream and diary in hand, she said goodbye to Aarhus.
Today, Mille is 18 and ready to spread her wings and take flight on her musical journey. She is now fully embracing her potential, soaring across the Danish music scene with her debut EP, which features tracks like ‘Byen Sover’, ‘Læs Mig’, ‘Spejlvendt’, and the title track ‘Dagdrømmer’.
With words from her diary and melodies from the piano and guitar, Mille paints vivid pictures—scenes that capture everything from longing to (un)happiness, seen through the eyes of a young person.

name: Kayak
description:
The trio Kayak consists of friends Eva Berghamar, Carl Magnus Olsen, and Albert Odgaard, who together carve out a unique spot on the Danish indie-pop scene that has yet to be fully explored. Their sound is grand and theatrical, yet simultaneously intimate and stripped-down. It’s a universe wrapped in layers of synths, airy vocals, and experimental guitar roles, with Berghamar’s lyrics serving as an anchor for the listener. With an insistent presence, the most challenging, profound, and contradictory emotions are addressed through an understated yet direct language. Adopting a curious approach to production, the band strives to push the boundaries of their own understanding of genre - still, beneath it all lies a constant love for the classic, well-crafted pop song.
Kayak aims to challenge the conventional pop listener. But they also want to reach you - right in the midst of those emotions you’re not alone in feeling, or perhaps didn’t even know you had.

name: Rhys
description:
Swedish-American artist Rhys first broke through at 17, becoming the most-played artist on Swedish national radio and going on a large-scale tour in her debut year. Seven years and 225 million streams later, Rhys returned to her childhood home in Portland, Oregon - where she finally rediscovered the musical spark that once ignited her career.
In 2024, Rhys returned with singer-songwriter single ‘Alice’, notorious for its appearance in the finale of Netflix hit ‘Young Royals’. This was followed by ‘Portland’, an independently released 5-track EP weaving indie, pop, and folk influences from her formative years. The project was praised by BBC6, NPR WNXP, Spotify New Music Friday, The Line of Best Fit, and hometown magazine The Oregonian, and led to a headline tour visiting all Scandinavian capitals - and now it’s time to take the stage at SPOT Festival in Aarhus.

name: Danefae
description:
Danefae is a band that divides opinions. With one foot in the Danish song tradition and the other in modern progressive rock, their sound is unlike almost anything else on the planet. As a result, the band has made its mark both on metal stages at home and abroad, as well as on tours at Danish open-air museums.
Live, Danefae is an explosive force - yet with small openings into something intimate and quiet - all performed with deep sincerity and total immersion.

name: Oskar Witt
description:
The young talent Oskar Witt began his lyrical career on the poetry slam scene, where, as a newcomer, he dove into words and won competitions for his exceptional talent. When he later transitioned to a more rap-focused style, he brought with him the advanced rhymes and powerful delivery from poetry slam.
Oskar Witt draws inspiration from a wide range of artists and genres. From Danish lyricists like C.V. Jørgensen and Michael Strunge to major American rap icons, he has crafted a style uniquely his own. His lyrics often explore darker themes such as identity crises, unrequited love, and fear. Combined with experimental beats, this creates a distinct soundscape that is both captivating and innovative.
Oskar Witt commands the stage with a magnetic presence, where his passionate performances and raw intensity ensure that every word resonates deeply with the audience. December 2024 marked a new chapter for Oskar Witt as he released his debut EP, ‘Bare Et Lille Øjeblik’, inviting listeners into his honest and boundary-pushing musical universe.

name: Pater
description:
Pater’s music is rooted in Stine Stengaard’s songs about rigid ideals, gender, and relationships. The band’s sound emerges from brutal lyrics and musical presence. Among the six members are two pairs of siblings and four roommates. That sense of security shines through in an intense live experience, where brass, samples, and synths challenge our understanding of what pop music is.
Pater’s music is a tribute to those of us who struggle within the norms that trap both ourselves and each other. It is a rebellion filled with love, anger, and faith in our ability to open the world for one another.

name: Ritmo Criminal x Hård Ting
description: Ritmo Criminal x Hård Ting started in a dark room on Grimhøjvej in Brabrand .… we just clicked from the start and basically thought each other were the shit … mads e from Ritmo is fucking good at chords and all that ….. so he just went ahead and made Hård Ting’s songs more cumbia-ish right … … then we figured we might as well play together at concerts and so on .… and just drink wudka afterwards … and before

name: Tabloid
description:
Tabloid is a collective of five of the country's leading musicians from the pop and jazz scene. Together, they create music that reminds us not to judge or limit ourselves. So far, this has resulted in three albums inspired by 1980s funk and fusion jazz, incorporating elements from everything from country to J-pop.
Despite having roots in a high-cultural musical tradition, they are not afraid to appeal to a broad audience with effective compositions and catchy, singable melodies. One might even go so far as to say that the musical ping-pong between the band's multifaceted musicians has a certain "gossiping" quality. The band certainly thinks so, which is why their new album is titled ‘Hot Gossip’.
Tabloid’s collective résumé is impressive, featuring Jada’s musical right-hand man, Malthe Rostrup; one half of Bremer/McCoy, Jonathan Bremer; the most renowned saxophonist of the new jazz generation, Oilly Wallace; drummer Felix Ewert, known from acts such as Nik & Jay and Alex Vargas; and guitarist, composer, and initiator Johannes Wamberg, who also plays with artists like Coco O. and Emma Sehested Høeg.

name: TT
description:
The hip-hop scene is welcoming a new, powerful voice: TT, an upcoming rapper bringing back old-school vibes. With a unique blend of lyrical depth and raw emotion, TT tells stories that resonate with listeners and provoke thought.
Her music is a journey through her life experiences and observations of society. Her lyrics touch on themes of identity, strength, and social challenges, using her platform to inspire others. 
With her deep passion for music, TT creates beats that fuse classic hip-hop elements with modern innovation. Her live performances are packed with energy and an authentic connection to the audience, making each concert an unforgettable experience. Keep an eye on TT—this talented rapper is ready to make her mark on the Danish music scene.

name: Damar
description:
Traditional Balkan folk music is far richer and often much more atmospheric, melodic, and melancholic than the expression most people in Denmark associate with the genre. In the band Damar, the musicians go straight to the source, playing this side of folk music from Bosnia, Serbia, North Macedonia, and Bulgaria, blended with the group’s own songs.
Damar was founded by Emir Pasic, who came to Denmark in 1992 as a refugee from the war in the former Yugoslavia. He arrived at a refugee camp in Thisted, where there was little to do. Instead of just sitting around, he began writing songs inspired by Balkan folk music.
The first result was the band Kurve, which played a punk-infused and intense Balkan sound across the country and throughout Europe for the next ten years. However, the more calm and atmospheric music stayed with him, and in 2020, Damar was formed by Emir (guitar and vocals) together with Adnan Oprasic (bass), who is also from Bosnia, Lotte Maxild (Singvogel) on clarinet, and Michael Andersen (UFO Yepha) on drums.
For Damar, it is essential not to westernize the music but to play it in its original form – in sound, atmosphere, and melodies – with a simple instrumentation.

name: Siamese
description: Siamese has rapidly become one of Denmark’s hottest musical exports, and have seen exponential growth and support since releasing their album ‘HOME’. With incredible reactions from influential rock media and DSP playlist tastemakers, over 60 million streams worldwide and a number of tours with acts such as KORN, Wage War, Dance Gavin Dance and Beartooth. The band just released a new album in March 2025 and they are not slowing down any day soon

name: Dybfølt
description:
Have you ever heard a song accompanied only by cello and double bass? If not, you should listen in. This unconventional constellation, formed by Dybfølt and Kira Martini, offers a much-needed counterpoint to mass-produced, fast-paced music. Here, you feel the music - you listen deeply and drift along with the waves they create together.
With the two deepest instruments in the string family, Dybfølt (formerly LuLo) has crafted a distinctive sound that both excites and moves audiences wherever they perform. Their playful and effortless interplay stands in beautiful contrast to the weight of the cello and double bass, and Kira Martini’s stunning jazz voice and warm presence bring a whole new dimension to the music.
Most recently, they released the album ‘Sange fra en væg’ - a reinterpretation of Else Marie Pade’s songs, written during World War II. And in the fall of 2024, they are set to release a brand-new album.

name: Bonjour Papa
description: Out of the blue, the dynamic duo popped up in the Danish EDM landscape. Be invited to your first workday at “The Bonjour Papa Office” and rave your way through to your first well-earned paycheck at the Office. With inspiration, all the way from Skrillex to the Danish TV series “Matador”, marks no boundaries for what gets explored in the Bonjour Papa universe. Suited and ready with their brown suitcases, the two showmen and band surprise UMTOxSPOT with infectious energy and pounding bass.

name: KATMORE
description:
KATMORE debuts as a solo artist at SPOT Festival. Former lead singer of Off Bloom, Mette Kathrine Mortensen, now steps forward as a solo artist under the name KATMORE. Her first single, ‘Dancing In The Dark’, is, in the artist’s own words, an anthem for getting through dark times. The sound is organic, and the lyrics are intimate and personal.
The song gained recognition from the Danish Netflix series Skruk, where it sparked significant attention on Reddit and social media—even before its official release.
Now, Dancing In The Dark is finally out, and KATMORE is ready to take on SPOT Festival with her unique sound and powerful storytelling.

name: Modou Traore
description:
Modou Traore is a man of dual heritage, with roots from Mali and Senegal. His soulful connection to music runs deep, a passion that has been with him since birth. He is not simply a musician, but a great storyteller and an excellent percussionist.
By his side are four equally dedicated musicians. Casper Amba, Jeppe Cloos, Mikas Bøgh and Jakob De Place all have a great passion for Malien music culture. Jakob and Mikas have been living in Bamako, the vibrant culture capital of Mali for over seven years and collaborating with a diverse array of artists. Together, they create music that transcends boundaries, and blends genres as bambara blues and modern afrobeat.
It is raw, powerful, and undeniably groovy. To experience Modou Traore and his talented companions is to be taken away on a journey of sound and emotion. It is a passionate ode to the music that pulses through the nightlife of Bamako, and a peak into the joy and beauty that can be found in Westafrican music culture.

name: Skammerens Døtre
description:
Skammerens Døtre is a young, all-female rap group from Aarhus who’ve been rapping for about two years. They’ve taken the Aarhus underground scene by surprise with their high energy, strong delivery, clever, controversial, and technically skilled lyrics - as well as outstanding live performances that have blown audiences away at several local events in Aarhus and across the country.
Skammerens Døtre moves within modern subgenres of hip hop, drill, and trap, featuring catchy and dynamic flows alongside a lyrical universe that speaks directly to youth - laced with bold attitude. Their music can, to some extent, be compared to U.S. artists like Cardi B, Glorilla, and Ice Spice, but at the same time, they bring a completely unique style and sound that stands apart from any other act on the Danish music scene.
Skammerens Døtre is a breath of fresh air in a heavily male-dominated genre, and they’re ready to show the Danish urban scene their fierce and distinctive take on modern hip hop.

name: Dork
description:
Dork is the musical alias of songwriter and musician Lærke Simoni. For Simoni, music serves both as escapism and a form of therapy in a life marked by overthinking and feelings of alienation. Dork plays the anti-hero as she sings about ghosting and lying about it on her debut EP, ‘I’m not a good person.’ A 4-track EP that explores the darker sides of the self.
On the debut EP, groovy guitar-based indie rock is combined with dream pop and bittersweet garage rock. The lyrics paint a picture of a lazy, antisocial, and self-ironic protagonist in a feel-bad indie universe. There’s a balance between sarcasm and melancholy in nonchalant and charming songs about personal inadequacy.
The first single, ‘Legs,’ has been well-received on the Danish music scene, with airtime on the radio station P6 BEAT and coverage in the cultural magazine Soundvenue which described the song as "a charming, scrappy dose of indie rock with snarky deadpan humor à la Rhian Teasdale from Wet Leg."
Look forward to an intimate and dynamic live experience as Dork invites you into her melancholic world.

name: De Høje Hæle
description: De Høje Hæle is an energetic and uncompromising punk rock band that sets the stage on fire with their raw and authentic sound. With their fast tempo, sharp lyrics, and intense live performances, they have achieved cult status on the Danish music scene. The band blends classic punk with modern elements, delivering an unforgettable sound that is both aggressive and captivating. De Høje Hæle challenges the norms and creates a musical space where rebellion and freedom take center stage. Their music is for those who dare to go against the grain.

name: FLÆK
description:
FLÆK came together for one purpose: to play the heaviest music possible - and they succeeded. A strong chemistry and a love for the boundary-pushing and the spontaneous created a space for raw energy and expression. There is no time to waste, and FLÆK soars effortlessly with their crushingly heavy music - relentless and uncompromising.
A raw nerve and fearless intensity are embedded in their sound, cutting straight to the bone. The instruments are pushed to their limits, drawn from the deepest depths of frustration and joy.

name: Soleima
description:
At the beginning of 2023, Soleima ventured into the Danish-language lyrical universe. That same year, she appeared on DR’s 'Min Sang til Danmark' and TV2’s 'Toppen af Poppen', captivating both participants and viewers with her distinctive vocals and heartfelt interpretations.
From P3 hits and powerful live performances to the critically acclaimed album 'Nationens Skrammer' – which truly showcased Soleima’s lyrical talent in Danish – she has sung her way into the hearts of Danish music lovers. Now, Soleima is taking yet another step in her musical journey.
With an upcoming album centered around a more rock-infused sound, her ambition is clear: she aims to be Denmark’s next big rock artist. The forthcoming album and her bold artistic vision testify to an artist unafraid to explore new territories – both in releases and live performances.

name: FIA
description: FIA is a well-known local DJ in the Aarhus scene, regularly playing at venues like Volume Village and Shen Mao. With a background in dance, she brings a unique energy to her music, and her goal is always to fill the dance floor with life and celebration.

name: Solkur
description:
With an unparalleled ability to challenge genres and create unique soundscapes, Solkur is ready to conquer the Danish music scene. Underground icon Loke Deph, together with Albert, known as one half of Benal, has formed the group Solkur, a groundbreaking electronic rap project with the aim of creating something entirely unique. With atmospheric productions, they charge forward with cinematic storytelling, and in 2025, Solkur will open the floodgates.
Loke Deph’s lyrical depth, combined with Albert’s experimental productions, is creating a new direction for Danish-language hip hop, where every line is a journey into a skewed universe. A world where sensitivity and attitude can coexist. After a string of successful concerts across the country, they are now ready for their debut release.

name: Ashes of Billy
description:
Ashes of Billy was formed in early 2022 and the trioenhas since then been very productive with the release of three EPs. Their style is a mix of alternative rock, post-grunge, and heavy metal. Despite being born in 2007, 2008, and 2009, the band members have already played numerous concerts, including opening for Psyched Up Janis and Siamese, performing at ‘When Copenhell Freezes Over 2024’, and playing various shows across Denmark.
Their latest EP, ‘Obscene’, was released in March 2024. The EP was produced by Tue Madsen (known for his work with Baby Metal, HateSphere, Behemoth, and Meshuggah) and recorded at Antfarm Studio. Two singles from the EP gained airplay on the Danish rock radio station MyRock. Additionally, the band had their first two EPs mastered by Flemming Rasmussen (Metallica) at Sweet Silence Studios.

name: Faza
description:
The 24-year-old R&B and hip-hop artist Faza, who signed with Def Jam in late 2023 with a striking introduction video, released his debut single ‘4Life’ at the beginning of 2024. Shortly after, he followed up with ‘Drunk Talk’, which solidified his growing relevance - not only in terms of digital streams and radio play but also through the support of established artists.
2024 has been a whirlwind year for Faza: a feature on Kesi’s latest album, a critically acclaimed EP, his first-ever live show at Vegas Udvalgte, performances at SPOT Festival and Red Bull’s Distortion stage, and to top it all off, he closed the year with a sold-out show at Ideal Bar in Vega.
Now, a new year is on the horizon; and with P3 and Soundvenue both naming him as one to watch, it’s only a matter of time before things truly take off for Faza.

name: Sebastian Wegener
description:
Sebastian Wegener shares the raw and honest sides of life through his music, exploring heartbreak, desire, and liberation. As the former frontman of the band Joyce, he already has a strong connection to the stage, but now he’s standing on his own, inviting listeners even closer.
Sebastian Wegener made his breakthrough as the voice of one of the most influential and acclaimed rock bands of the time. With their two albums, ‘Formskifter’ (2020) and ‘Elsk Mig’ (2022), Joyce became a triumphant post-punk wave that swept across the country, racking up radio hits, music awards, and glowing reviews along the way. The launch of his solo career begins with the singles ‘Upsi 28’ and ‘1 Lussing & 1 Vand,’ where his unique lyrical universe truly comes to life.
The music, created in collaboration with producer Vera, reveals a new side of Sebastian Wegener. It tells stories that are honest and brutal, comedic and tragic, about life’s ups and downs and the time before and after a breakup. Now, he’s ready to showcase his music live for the first time, accompanied by his talented band, who will enhance the dynamic and theatrical performance.

name: HUGX
description: HUGX offers a raw and honest indie-pop experience that embraces the complexity of being human in a digital world. Through music that blends dreamy tones with deep emotions, they explore themes of love, doubt and anxiety. HUGX sound is both an intimate "musical hug" and a call to come together in a world that pulls us in different directions.

name: CarlloYABOY
description:
CarlloYABOY thrives in the spotlight — the multitalented artist sings, produces, writes, records and plays every instrument himself, his energetic and passionate personality is felt instantly as he pours his all and everything into his music and into every single performance, his art. He leaves everything on the stage infecting everyone in the crowd from front to back to dance instantaneously.
His Ghanian and Danish roots combine perfectly into the new afropop/amapiano wave. The masterful dancer and performance king effortlessly ignitites the crowd. CarlloYABOY masters both the art of large scale high production stage setups aswell as captivating the entire crowds with just him and his guitar.
Carllo’s love for music flourished — rapidly sparking his interests for the life of a successful touring superstar at a young age. Carllo picked up the guitar for the first time at the early age of 3 and began writing and performing his own songs at every talent show he could find ever since. Carllo and his music has been called a modern day Rema, John Mayer, Tyla and The Weeknd — listening to CarlloYABOY’s music, the vision paints itself clearly and completely shatters any splint of doubt in him earning a spot among those he’s inspired by.

name: Fauna
description:
Fauna conveys an organic, psychedelic & dance friendly experience. The music is a meditative ritual where the listeners find themselves encased in rhythms. You will be dragged along through thorns and bushes by a forceful, volcanic pulse. Time and space lose all meaning in a mind warping journey through the woods.
The Gothenburg music collective Fauna released their debut singles "Animalisk" and "Cirkel" in early 2023, showcasing their unique and driving sound that has already earned them high praise from both audiences and critics alike.
Combining organic instrumentation with dance-friendly beats, Fauna's debut singles provide an exciting introduction to their identity. 
The releases were followed up by the band’s first live appearance on the 17th of March 2023, which took place at the collective’s underground club experience in Gothenburg, where the international acts Acid Arab and Carbon Based Lifeforms were invited as co-headlines. 
After a successful debut show and a first release of their music the band has appeared on numerous festivals both in Scandinavia and mainland Europe sharing stage with acts like Islandman, Föllakzoid, Bab L’Bluz, Waq Waq Kingdom as well as a support show for Goat in their hometown Gothenburg. 
In 2024 they recorded their debut album and with several planned tours and festival appearances they are gearing up for a busy 2025.

name: Mathias Ranch
description:
Mathias Ranch has, in recent years, established himself as a unique voice on the Danish music scene. With a background in the band Statisk and a past shaped by struggle and transformation, Mathias Ranch is unafraid to challenge both himself and his audience. He is an artist who insists on standing by himself—through highs and lows. And that is exactly what he does in his new solo project.
His music is an uncompromising fusion of deeply personal lyrics, melodic sharpness, and a raw yet poetic authenticity. Inspired by the Danish folk tradition, the melancholic tones of the '70s, and modern electronic elements, he crafts a soundscape that feels both timeless and contemporary.
Mathias' songs are narratives from the borderland between light and darkness—reflective, yet never self-pitying. His debut double-single, ‘Drømmer / Helt’, offers the first glimpse into a sonic universe that explores mental vulnerability, the absurdity of existence, and the inevitable beauty found within life's chaos.
Mathias Ranch's solo project is a new beginning—but not a break from the past. He carries it with him in his music—not to dwell on it, but to create something greater.

name: Berg
description:
Step into Berg’s enchanting world of crisp tones and pure good vibes, where there’s no right or wrong way to be. Drawing inspiration straight from the core of her own emotions, Berg creates music that feels personal and relatable. In her universe, authenticity and freedom are key - and that’s exactly what she wants to share with the world through her music.
Berg isn’t afraid to explore new sonic landscapes or step outside her comfort zone. Her songs range from subtle and sensitive to powerful and pulsating. She describes her music as authentic and intense, yet tender - a combination that led her all the way to the finals of KarriereKanonen at DR’s concert hall in 2024.
In September 2024, Berg played a sold-out show at Ideal Bar, marking a milestone that proved she could easily fill the venue with dedicated fans. Since then, she’s been working intensely on new music and evolving her sound in bold new directions. She has teased several new tracks on TikTok, where she’s built a large and loyal community of fans who are deeply engaged in her creative process.
The song ‘Koldblodet Killer’ became a turning point for Berg. After going viral on TikTok, and following massive demand, she released it on February 7th, 2025. Without a label backing her, the track has already racked up hundreds of thousands of streams and landed in the Top 50 - proving that Berg is an artist you simply won’t be able to ignore on the Danish music scene.

name: AGGi
description:
Based in Denmark with Ghanaian roots, AGGi grew up at the intersection of cultures between Aarhus, Denmark, and the Volta Region, Ghana. AGGi has created a unique sound that brings together the best of both worlds — something unheard of in Denmark before. She invites the listener into her playful universe with solid singles like ‘Better Money,’ ‘Waste No Time,’ ‘Blue Cheese,’ and ‘Follow,’ all of which reflect her cultural duality, blending Afro rhythms with a modern European approach to hip-hop.
AGGi is a powerful new voice on the Danish music scene. With her captivating rap flow and raw attitude, she has made a mark on both the international and Danish music scenes alike.
With her debut concert at Roskilde Festival, AGGi generated significant buzz among the audience, who were treated to a performance filled with energy, dance, and musicality. Her performance was met with enthusiasm and applause from both new and longtime fans.

name: PATINA
description:
PATINA truly broke through with hits like ‘Flammer Rammer’ and ‘Sådan Må Det Være (Uhhhh)’ in 2020, and have since established themselves as one of the most distinctive and original acts on the Danish music scene. With the release of their second album ‘GENSTART’ in 2022, they firmly cemented their position, as both radio and streaming platforms warmly embraced the title track and the rest of the release.
Most recently, PATINA has opened a new chapter with the album ‘Uvejr’, where the music weaves connections between inner emotional landscapes and the outer movements of the world - focusing on all the things we can’t always control. ‘Uvejr’ is a two-part release, with part 1 arriving in October 2024 as a prelude to the full album, which will be released on May 2, 2025. Audiences can thus look forward to an unofficial album release at SPOT 2025.
The band is known for its uncompromising approach to both songwriting and live performances. With a unique setup of three front members - Gregers, Søren, and Mads -  who take turns singing, playing drums, and percussion, PATINA balances on the edge of chaos - a chaos that is not just part of their sound, but a core element of their artistic identity. Their creative process is marked by a search for honesty and authenticity, where nothing is predictable and anything can happen. The music becomes a reflection of the human condition - both in the storm and in the stillness.
The band’s expression is anchored by regular members Toke Lynggaard Larsen and Mathias Bøttern on guitar, Frederik Bak on bass, and Jens Møller Jensen on organ and keys. Together, they create a sonic space where energy and vulnerability go hand in hand.
Autumn 2024 featured an extensive tour across Denmark, and this summer PATINA is once again ready to take over the Danish festival stages with their characteristic, devil-may-care live energy.

name: BOABOA
description:
Meet BOABOA – a powerful electronic music project from the heart of Copenhagen. The three members, Otto Høgh, Amma RaastoB, and Oscar Bjerrehuus, deliver a unique sound that fuses elements of house, techno, and melodic pop. BOABOA is one of Copenhagen’s most hyped and enigmatic music projects, known for its distinctive approach to both music production and live performances.
Some of their recent achievements include significant global editorial support from Spotify, such as being featured on the cover of Fresh Finds Dance for three weeks, as well as top placements on major playlists like NMFs, Oyster, Creamy, Club Hits 2024, All New Dance, and more. They have been nominated for ‘Newcomer of the Year’ at the Club Awards 2025 and have received multiple plays on BBC Radio 1 Future Artists with Sian Eleri.

name: Vilma Crow
description:
Vilma Crow explores love and heartbreak through raw and heartfelt DIY indie-pop/rock. With catchy guitar riffs and lyrics that begs to be sung at the top of your lungs, Vilma Crow conveys the many facets of love and self-image. With a fragility similar to Lizzie McAlpine and a strength reminiscent of Fiona Apple, Vilma Crow takes the stage with clear intent.
Her songs are infused with a genuine and present vulnerability, making the sonic universe both moving and relatable. The songs stem from real-life experiences, delicately processed in moments of introspection, like pages from a diary. Here, there is room for the full range of emotions, where deep pain, anger, love, and emerging hope coexist side by side.
For several years, Vilma Crow has worked with determination to develop a clear artistic vision, and with her debut EP on the horizon, she stands as a fresh and promising indie talent on the Danish music scene.

name: ØNDI
description:
ØNDI is a powerful fusion of youthful energy, generationally aware humor, and uncompromising productions, creating a unique and inclusive live experience. Frontman Tobias Bjerg's charismatic presence leads the audience into a space of youthful self-indulgence, where ØNDI pushes the boundaries of the Danish music scene. While many other high-energy live artists encourage mosh pits and intense shows, ØNDI aims to create parties that are for everyone, focusing instead on inclusion and dancing.
The young band was formed with the dream of a project that could challenge and test everything, where the common denominator would be energy, not genre. The sound established on their debut EP 'COPY PASTE' (2023) moved between electronic pop and industrial punk. To everyone’s surprise, the band went in an entirely different direction by releasing the “anti-club” club EP ‘IK SET DET FØR’ in 2024, with singles like ‘Fuck Dit Berlin’ and ‘Spejl’.
With motorcycles, guitars, and inspiration drawn from genres such as pop-rock and post-punk, ØNDI takes the first steps into a new era, offering the band's third EP, a new sound, and more concerts. ØNDI is ready to shoot their pop star energy out on the highways, convincing the audience with their distinctive charm and leaving a touch of tinnitus in the ears and love in the bodies of those who experience their intense, intimate, and explosive live performances.

name: Emil Kruse
description:
Under his own name, Emil Kruse found his very own hip-hop style. Before breaking through with his more pop-infused, house-inspired, and lyrically driven hip-hop, Kruse experimented with grime and even dabbled in ‘90s hip-hop. The young artist, who made the journey from the suburbs to the big city and from the underground to the spotlight, has grown into a fully realized artist with something to say.
Emil Kruse's musical journey began in Vangede, where he discovered hip-hop and formed the duo Sleng. Inspired by grime and Danish artists like Stanley Most, he found his own voice and artistic expression. After getting a taste of the music industry with Sleng, he returned to his roots as a hip-hop producer, exploring a melodic and poetic universe under the name Aesthetic.
In 2016, Emil Kruse debuted as a solo artist with the album ‘Slumromantiker’. The album struck a poetic chord, received critical acclaim, and established Emil as a talented artist with a unique sound and lyrical universe.
A lot has happened since his debut, including the release of his second album in 2022 and the Strunge-referencing ‘Væbnet Med Vinger’, which was named P3’s Ugens Uundgåelige. 2025 is set to mark yet another exciting year for Emil Kruse, with new projects on the horizon.

name: Jinsu
description: Copenhagen-based Jinsu plays local events such as Group Therapy, Kune Festival or Goodness and takes active part in various local DIY initiatives. Informed by many years of curious listening and dancing, his DJ sets welcome eclecticism, depth and a sense of playfulness.

name: Wicky
description:
Upcoming rapper Wicky blends American trap culture with a distinct cold and introspective Scandinavian sound. The album ‘Sabbeste’ from 2023 captured a new, emerging style of rap with heavy 808s, experimental synths, and Jersey club kicks— a combination never before heard on the Danish music scene.
On the EP ‘Evigt Op’, Wicky redefines the sound of Danish and Scandinavian rap in 2024. Across six tracks, he experiments with the evolution of modern Danish language, capturing Gen-Z youth’s feeling of being stuck somewhere between TikTok hyperculture and cultural decay. It’s a manifestation of being forever upcoming, never breaking through the surface.

name: Daniil
description:
Daniel Moroshkin, better known by his stage name Daniil, is a 23-year-old artist who has made a name for himself on the Icelandic music scene over the past several years. He released his debut album, ‘300’, in 2019, and since then, Daniil has established himself as one of the most exciting names in Icelandic hip-hop.
Daniil aims to break boundaries and challenge stereotypes about what is expected. He often collaborates with a wide range of artists across borders and excels at keeping his audience in constant anticipation with new musical ideas. This was highlighted with the release of the single ‘Ástin Mín’, where he collaborated with Danish artist USSEL.
Since the release of his second album, ‘600’, Daniil has headlined festivals all over Iceland and worked on his third studio album, which is expected to be released in early 2025. He has also released singles with prominent artists such as Aron Can and Izleifur.
Now, he embarks on his first proper tour in Scandinavia, bringing his energetic live performances to SPOT Festival.

name: Tarrak
description:
Tarrak is a rapper who released his debut album ‘FxGxS’ in 2016. His debut earned him Koda’s award for talent of the year in 2017, and the same year he received an award from Naalakkersuisut, the Government of Greenland.
In 2019 Tarrak released his second album, ‘Josef Tarrak’, which subsequently was adapted into a play starring Tarrak himself. Tarrak has been part of several collaborations, including ÎVA, the EP ‘Polaroid’ with rapper Peand-eL and most recently the Artic collaboration project Aajuik. In 2023 Tarrak released 3 singles, one of whom was with danish group Suspekt, and the same year he played Roskilde Festival as the first Greenlandic rapper ever.

name: Eros for you
description:
Eros for you is the sound of hugging in strobe lights. The Copenhagen duo produces euphoric electronic dance music that explores the contrast between melancholy and euphoria. With energetic and uplifting productions, they strive to create a vulnerable sonic space where the audience longs for the dance floor and a sense of togetherness.
Eros for you met through a shared love for emotional dance music and French electronic sounds. In 2023, they released their debut single, ‘Palm of Your Hand’, and just weeks later, they were offered a record deal in Paris. The duo describes their music as "EDM Bon Iver", an attempt to merge club music with the feeling of care and intimacy.

name: Pachaï B2B DJ You’re So Fine
description:
DJ Pachaï curiously explores music in all directions — from Persian melodies to juicy pop remixes and Latin club beats. Get ready for every bone in your body to move in sync with the rhythm.
Everyone’s feeling it on the floor of DJ You're So Phine. Let your feet run wild to pounding end-of-the-night techno and dreamy trance that slowly makes the ground disappear beneath you.
DJ You're So Phine & Pachaï have previously played b2b gigs at Distortion, Kaleido Festival, and 33|45|33 in Barcelona.

name: MASIV
description:
The electronic music trio MASIV breaks the barrier between a DJ set and conventional live music. The group consists of two producers and a drummer who, on stage, blends energetic synth-based madness with explosive live drums. The music draws on elements from drum’n’bass, techno, hyperpop, and dubstep, creating a unique and authentic electronic sound universe.
MASIV's ambition is to be the connection between the club and the concert hall. With live drums as the foundation, a space is formed where electronic chaos is facilitated by the analog and the human. The trio aims to captivate both national and international audiences with heavy bass and intense atmospheres, thereby fostering a community where everyone can unite through music.

name: Phloem
description:
Based in Copenhagen, Phloem is a DJ with a passion for early 2000s dance music as well as fresh sounds and currents of electronic music. Phloem's musical identity weaves together elements of progressive house, percussive techno, swampy psy-trance, and tech-house. With music that invites to enter a vibe and atmosphere, her sets are often flavored with warm basslines and soft vocals, with added euphoric touches and sense of bittersweet nostalgia. 
Phloem has spent the past several years performing on stages at venues and festivals across Copenhagen and beyond, including Roskilde Festival, Kiosk Radio in Brussels, as well as local venues like Den Anden Side, Hangaren and more.

name: Yo Johnny
description:
Arto Eriksen is the man behind some of Denmark's biggest pop hits in recent years. As a producer and songwriter, he has created hits with artists such as Tobias Rahim, Andreas Odbjerg, Lamin, Drew Sycamore, D1ma, Lord Siva, and ICEKIID. With Yo Johnny, he steps out of the shadows of the studio and onto the stage with his alter ego, Yo Johnny – a musical party starter who blends techno, house, and rave culture with playful self-irony.
Yo Johnny has already made his mark on the club dance floor with tracks like ‘Miami’, ‘Cardio’, and ‘Pengedans’, and with a remix of Gilli’s ‘Baianá’, which has streamed over 2.5 million times on Spotify, he has cemented himself as one of the country's most exciting electronic producers.
Yo Johnny has also turned up the volume on his mixes behind the DJ booth, performing everywhere from the country's clubs to street parties like Distortion and on Tinderbox’s mainstage, Magicbox. He always moves with the beat, bass arm, and body – because whether we like it or not, we all have a Yo Johnny inside us!

name: Emma Lincoln
description:
Since starting her DJ career, Emma Lincoln has become a well-known name in Copenhagen. She showcases her deep understanding of music when she's on the decks, seamlessly mixing genres together.
Growing up in a Jewish family with mixed roots from Hungary, Russia, and Britain, Emma brings this diversity into her music. With so many nationalities behind her, she's always curious to explore sounds from every continent. She takes pride in curating unheard genres with different rhythms and histories.
When performing, she cooks up a spicy mix of electronic, house, hip-hop, baile funk, Arabic riddims, and hidden gems from various cultures. She fell in love with hip-hop dance at a young age, which laid the foundation for her musical journey. Known for playing un-Shazamable bangers, she will be releasing her own productions very soon.
In 2023, she began producing her own music and is currently studying at the Danish Songwriting Academy to become a producer. One of the first songs she produced and wrote was ‘The Chase (Zoom Zoom)’, which was selected for the Danish Eurovision Song Contest 2024 and performed by CHU CHU. Always on the search for new upcoming music, Emma was the co-founder of the former local cultural station TEMA:, located in Nørrebro, where her primary role was booking and communicating with artists.
